industry: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services
description:
["About Lowell

As one of Europe's leading and most respected credit management companies, we believe in the importance of good relationships. Whether that’s with our customers or our people.

We want to listen to and understand our customers, not judge them, so that we can find the most affordable and fair ways to help them pay off their debts. Fairness runs through everything we do.

We believe our greatest assets are our people and we’re keen to develop teams who want to make a difference.

Summary

Job Description

Location: UK Wide. We’re based in Leeds but you don’t need to be.

We’re Lowell. You may not know us, but our reputation is growing. We believe that becoming debt free should be simple and affordable for everyone. Every year, we help thousands of people take control of their finances.

We buy debts from lots of different companies in all kinds of sectors. Our mission is to help customers on the path to becoming debt free; with a real focus on helping our customers pay off their debts in practical and affordable ways. We do this honestly, ethically and by treating our customers with dignity and respect.

So that’s us, now let’s talk about your role:

You'll deliver high-quality statistical and machine learning models for our UK business, including our Operations, Pricing & Investments, and Finance teams.

In Your Role, You’ll
Build, enhance, and maintain predictive models using the most appropriate statistical and machine learning methodologies
Develop a comprehensive understanding of Lowell’s core business model and identify opportunities to drive significant value through analytic intervention
Address a broad array of general business questions through data and logical inference, and provide ad hoc analytic support for operational projects and initiatives
Translate unstructured business problems into well-defined and tractable modelling projects
How we say thank you?

Benefits

So, at Lowell we have a range of benefits that include

An exciting career is much more than just a salary. We also understand that everyone, regardless of culture, gender identity, religion, ethnicity, age, neurodiversity, or disability status, can contribute to our goal to make credit work better for all. Our strength is in our people.
A discretionary annual bonus for a job well done.
Life assurance, Private Medical Assurance & Group income protection.
A fantastic culture with more little perks along the way including flexible working, family leave and recognition awards.
Wellbeing support, including THRIVE sessions, trained support officers, and regular webinars and classes geared towards mindfulness.
In Order To Make The Grade, You'll Have
Direct experience building a variety of statistical models
Demonstrated competency with one or more of logistic regression, generalised linear models, or categorical data analysis
Demonstrated competency with one or more machine learning methods (e.g., neural network, k-means clustering).
Direct experience using structured programming languages for statistical and/or numeric computing. We're looking for you to have experience of SQL along with one or more other programming languages such as PySpark/Databricks, Python, R, or Scala, cloud, Jupyter, or git.
We care about our customers, and we care about our colleagues too. At Lowell, we don’t just accept difference — we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our customers, and our community. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace, as we know the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

We’re on the lookout for those who really want to make a difference. People who want to help our customers turn their finances around. People like you?

Take the next step and apply"]

industry: Staffing and Recruiting and Information Technology and Services
description:
['Software Developer (Entry-Mid level)
Otley, Leeds, West Yorkshire
Competitive

This is an exciting opportunity for an enthusiastic software developer to become a key member of our fast moving Software Development team. For those looking for a career in software Development, no prior experience is necessary as training will be provided where required. 

Developed using the latest code and technologies, we provide industry leading recruitment software and services to our customers. You will be responsible for helping us develop our software.

As part of the Development team, you will get exposure to the full technology stack including the latest code technologies while working in a fast moving environment where no two days are the same. 

This is an ideal opportunity for someone with good programming skills who wants to kick start their career in software development. You will be involved in the full software development life cycle and develop business-critical features and services.

Working in the multi-disciplined Development team, day to day you will be:
Developing enhancements to existing software features
Working from development specifications and with key stakeholders to develop new features
Taking part in daily Scrum meetings
Researching and developing with new technologies

What we are looking for:
We are looking for you to have ambition to self learn and evolve your technical skills. You’ll be able to adjust quickly to changing priorities and help resolve complex problems. We will give you the time to develop your skills, all we ask for is willingness, passion and a drive to learn. 

Essential Skills:
VB or C# .NET MVC web application development
HTML / CSS / JavaScript / JQuery
A drive and passion to self-learn
A good understanding of technology
Outstanding analytical and problem solving

Desirable Skills:
Microservices
Azure DevOps
Git
SQL Server

Benefits:
Competitive salary
On the job training
Friendly and supportive environment
Personal Development Time
Free parking
Company pension scheme, 25 days holiday, gym membership discount, cycle scheme, etc.
Flexible working (37.5 hours per week) 
Remote working where applicable.

We offer and encourage in house career progression through the wider IT and Development team. With the right passion and initiative you can progress your career within our business in a supportive and progressive team environment.

The Company
Since our establishment in 2001, networx have been at the forefront of the recruitment industry.

Today we are recognized as market leaders providing the latest recruitment software (ATS) and an agency style recruitment service that supports over 450 companies across the UK to reduce costs and improve the efficiency of their recruitment processes.

With a wealth of flexibility and advanced level of functionality to choose from, our recruitment software can be configured to reflect the needs of any organization; regardless of size or recruitment process.']

industry: Financial Services, Information Services, and Information Technology and Services
description:
["About TransUnion

What We'll Bring:

TransUnion UK provides the data, analytics and software that enable businesses to build more valuable customer relationships.

We specialise in managing consumer data for businesses across every sector. We focus on developing innovative products and services that help businesses make smarter and more informed decisions throughout the customer lifecycle.

We are TransUnion and we believe in Information for Good.

About The Role

What You'll Bring:

In this role you will apply your data science skills to deliver new products and services, enhance existing propositions and conduct fundamental R&D into new approaches to provide our clients best in class solutions, ensuring the TU business remains at the forefront of the credit industry. Key applications will include fraud detection, real-time decisioning, credit risk & affordability decisioning and event-based triggers.

Key Responsibilities
You will partner with internal and external cross-functional teams to drive new business initiatives and deliver long term value-added solutions to various TransUnion customers. These tasks will include –among others- the development of predictive models and business intelligence solutions of high complexity for customers within the various industries served by TransUnion.
You will lead client / product development engagements for DSA involving descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive aspects for a variety of business use cases leveraging multiple data science techniques. As a project leader, you will take ownership of all aspects of the project from design (including helping articulate and shape client needs that may, at first, not be clearly defined) and pre-mortem, to development, to peer review, to client presentation, to implementation and audit.
You will design and write programs for data extraction, segmentation, statistical / ML / AI analysis on large population datasets using languages such as R and Python. Where applicable you will work to develop such programs into packages/ libraries / workflows which can be shared across the TU DSA organization for the benefit of all.
You will identify strategies and opportunities for customers to test and adopt TransUnion’s data science capabilities and develop project proposals, sales presentations, and promotional collateral to enable the adoption of integrated customer solutions, applying your practical analytic experience to find areas of new value. In the context of these opportunities, you will interact directly with TransUnion sales and business unit partners and provide a data science perspective as needed.
You will deliver data science driven insights and recommendations in succinct and compelling presentations for internal and external customers representing a wide range of backgrounds and levels, including executive audiences.
You will provide mentorship and training to junior colleagues, maintain progress on all initiatives and make significant contributions to the TU DSA community.
You will foster a high-performance culture and cultivate an environment that promotes excellence and reflects the TransUnion brand.
Impact You'll Make

Skills & Experience:
Master's or PhD degree in statistics, applied mathematics, financial mathematics, engineering, operations research, or another highly quantitative field. A consistent track record of academic excellence.
Professional experience performing data science within financial services or related industries (e.g., fraud, identity).
Deep professional expertise in one or more subject-matter areas or technical disciplines that would complement and significantly enhance TransUnion's existing data science capabilities. A consistent record of applying this expertise to achieve positive outcomes, and a drive to share with colleagues and business partners.
Outstanding analytical, critical thinking, and creative problem-solving skills.
Advanced programming skills; mastery of R or Python; experience with other programming and data manipulation languages (e.g., SQL, C/C++, Java); proficiency with Linux and Microsoft Office tools.
Comprehensive predictive modelling / machine learning (ML) / artificial intelligence (AI) knowledge and experience; dimension reduction, feature generation / engineering, outlier detection, statistical techniques, supervised / un-supervised learning (e.g., ensemble modelling, neural networks / deep learning).
Keen motivation for continued professional development, keeping abreast of the latest data science / ML / AI research and techniques, alongside applications within the industries served by TransUnion, such as financial services, insurance, fraud, or digital.
Versatile interpersonal and communication style (including presenting compelling visualizations) with the ability to effectively influence at multiple levels within and outside the organization.
Strong project and time management skills, managing effectively multiple assignments within a complex, fast-paced and dynamic environment; evidence of initiative-taking.
Willingness to participate in client-facing consulting work (such as TU’s innovation labs), developing their understanding of our capabilities and appropriate ML / AI approaches to solve key business challenges; to include some travel at times.
What’s in it for you?

At TransUnion you will be joining a friendly, forward thinking global business.

As well as a competitive salary, our benefits package includes 26 days’ annual leave (plus bank holidays) a generous contributory pension scheme, private health care and a host of other employee lifestyle benefits.

We take Corporate Social Responsibility seriously; our TU Good Works scheme supports communities around the world by advancing financial inclusion and education.

Remote Interview & Hiring Process

Protecting the health and wellness of our colleagues and candidates considering a career at TransUnion is our highest priority. Our recruitment and on-boarding experience for this role is fully virtual for the time being. Candidates interviewing will get to know our team over the phone and video, and this role will operate virtually upon hire until we return to the office. Even though we're not physically together right now, our goal is to provide you a supportive candidate and on-boarding experience that will immerse you in our culture and set you up for success at TransUnion

TransUnion Job Title

Advisor, Data Science and Analytics"]

industry: Information Technology and Services
description:
['2x Data Scientists / Leeds / up to £45,000 DOE / Remote and flexible working, Bonus, Generous holidays plus more…!
 Are you a Data Scientist who is focused on adding instant value to businesses? Are you driven by working in a project focused environment?

Corecom Consulting has partnered with a leading Data Science company who are going through exponential growth due the appetite of their ever-growing client base, which includes SME’s and Blue chips. The business is run by Data / Analytics focused Directors who each have an excellent pedigree in their respective fields meaning that the scope to learn off the best is available on a daily basis!

Their offices are based in Leeds, but you will have scope to work remotely. Whilst they are open to flexible working, they would require someone to be relatively local as they require you to come into the office on a semi-regular basis once restrictions are lifted.

What’s in it for you?
Bonus
26 days holiday plus annual leave
Appraisal based annual salary reviews
Excellent training opportunities
Career progression opportunities
Pension
Flexible working environment (office based and home working)

What we need from you
Python
SQL
Experience building models to understand customer behaviour
Experience building regression models
Experience building clustering models
Factor analysis experience

They have invested heavily in the BI and Analytics team over the past year and are now seeking 2x Data Scientists to add further value to their client base. The Data team is focused on working on client accounts to ultimately help them increase their data capabilities, resulting in ROI. You would predominantly be working on new business accounts, therefore have plenty of exposure to project focused work, and thus, new technology and techniques.  

The hiring manager is keen to review CVs by Tuesday 17th August so please apply as soon as possible to avoid disappointment!
 2x Data Scientists / Leeds / up to £45,000 DOE / Remote and flexible working, Bonus, Generous holidays plus more…!

“At Corecom, we don’t just accept differences, we celebrate them and thrive on them for the benefit of our employees, our clients and our candidates. Internally, we thrive from our differences and want our employees to be proud to be themselves and proud to be Corecom. Externally, we utilise those differences to help our clients and candidates strive for a more diverse and inclusive world.”']

industry: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services
description:
['Job Description

Oracle’s Secure Global Desktop team designs, develops and sustains a scalable, distributed product that provides secure remote access to applications and desktops. We are now hiring a high -calibre Software Engineer to work on Cloud services.

The role is for a full-stack product developer and offers unparalleled opportunities to work with a broad range of technologies, from low-level programming to system integration, and on a wide variety of platforms. The software you will be working on is used by major global enterprises and there is a strong emphasis on quality.

Working with experienced engineers, you will contribute to the specification and design of new product features; you will be responsible for their implementation and testing. Using Agile techniques, you will regularly deliver incremental enhancements to the product to both on-premises and Cloud customers. The work is very varied, ranging from services running on highly-scalable virtualized servers to desktops and mobile devices. This is a core software development position and you will be expected to demonstrate a strong understanding of computer systems, programming and building software. Collaboration is an essential skill and you will actively participate in design discussions and code reviews with colleagues.

Most of the development team is based in Leeds, UK, but we have remote workers and applications from candidates wishing to work remotely are welcome.

Candidates Should Have

Requirements:
Graduate or post-graduate qualification in Computer Science or a closely related subject.
4 years or more experience in commercial software development
Understanding and appreciation of software structure with a strong design aesthetic
Strong skills in Java, JavaScript, Python and web technologies
DevOps skills, such as Git, Jenkins, Ansible and Kubernetes
The desire and ability to learn about technologies quickly
Knowledge of HTTP and web socket networking protocols
Strong analytical and debugging skills, with attention to detail
A consistent and methodical approach to solving problems
Good verbal and written communication skills, in English
Flexibility, enthusiasm, drive and self-motivation
The desire and ability to learn quickly
The confidence to work independently and be comfortable working in a team
Knowledge of and interest in the following would be advantageous:
Skills in Cloud technologies
C/C++ programming experience
Experience developing products using security and authentication protocols, like TLS, SSH and SAML
Agile development methodologies, such as Scrum and test-driven development
Modern development tools
Design, develop, troubleshoot and debug software programs for databases, applications, tools, networks etc.

As a member of the software engineering division, you will assist in defining and developing software for tasks associated with the developing, debugging or designing of software applications or operating systems. Provide technical leadership to other software developers. Specify, design and implement modest changes to existing software architecture to meet changing needs.

Duties and tasks are varied and complex needing independent judgment. Fully competent in own area of expertise. May have project lead role and or supervise lower level personnel. BS or MS degree or equivalent experience relevant to functional area. 4 years of software engineering or related experience.

About Us

Innovation starts with inclusion at Oracle. We are committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people can be themselves and do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued, that we are inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. That’s why we need people with diverse backgrounds, beliefs, and abilities to help us create the future, and are proud to be an affirmative-action equal opportunity employer.

Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.']

description:

industry: Food & Beverages, Food Production, and Retail
description:
["About The Role

Are you a curious and pragmatic Developer with a passion for solving real world problems? If so, we’d love to speak with you. We’re looking for two experienced Full Stack Developers, to join our growing in-house Development teams. Morrisons is rapidly transforming into a Technology Driven supermarket, and we’re rapidly developing solutions to challenges we face every day, from both a customer and a colleagues perspective.

If you’ve got a track record working with organisations to solve problems at scale, and have a broad range of programming skills, Morrisons can offer you a fantastic platform on which to further your experience and a fast paced, ever changing environment that you will not only deliver at pace, but also expand your knowledge.

Wether you’ve got a desire to pursue React Native mobile applications, or have a keen interest in API’s / Services, if you are adaptable and resilient, we’ve got a place for you on the team.

You Will Also Be Responsible For
Utilising your full stack engineering experience to help us solve real world problems.
Becoming a key member of the internal development community, mentoring more junior developers.
Partnering and engaging our third party suppliers both internally and off shore.
Building and maintaining strong working relationships with both technology and business facing teams.
About You

You will ideally have the following experience:
A demonstrable track record acting as a full stack engineer within a large enterprise scale environment.
Stakeholder Management and influencing skills.
High proficiency in a number of programming languages - React/JavaScript/Python/Java/PHP
About The Company

Proud of our roots, Morrisons is a leading Yorkshire food retailer, serving 11 million customers across 500 stores a week. We’re also the UK’s second largest food manufacturer. Together, we make millions of products a year in our 18 manufacturing sites, allowing us to focus on what our customers want: good quality, fresh food and great value.

Our people make Morrisons. We’re passionate about recognising diverse talent and building careers for our people. We’re forward-thinking and stay one step ahead in an ever-evolving industry, giving us exposure to creative initiatives which improve the offering to our customers.

In return for looking after our customers, we look after our people with great perks, lots of career opportunities and the training and support everyone needs to be the best they can be.

We pride ourselves on being a diverse and inclusive business and are committed to making Morrisons a brilliant place to work, harbouring an environment where our people can thrive.

Treating all colleagues with respect and dignity is the Morrisons way - we celebrate individuality and love different perspectives. It’s what you bring to the table that matters.

New Ways of Working

The wellbeing of our colleagues is really important to us and we want everyone to have a great home and work life balance. Because of this we've introduced a four day working week for all full time colleagues based at our head office in Bradford.

You’ll be able to flex your working hours around the core hours of 10am-4pm, and can choose to do different hours each day as long as you’re covering these core hours. Each four day week will contain four average nine hour days.

To be more competitive and support our stores and sites more effectively, we now work over a six day operation, Monday to Saturday inclusive, and everyone in our head office now works one Saturday in every four (or 13 a year), albeit Saturday will be a shorter working day of 6 hours.

Your non-working day will need to fit in with the business needs so more information about this and which day you'd take off will be discussed at your interview."]

jobtitle: Software Developer (happy to discuss flexible working and can be flexible on location)
industry: Information Technology and Services, Financial Services, and Accounting
description:
["More than you expected

Grant Thornton UK LLP is part of a global network of independent audit, tax and advisory firms, made up of some 58,000 people in over 135 countries. We're a team of independent thinkers who put quality, inclusion and integrity first. All around the world we bring a different experience to our clients. A better experience. One that delivers the expertise they need in a way that goes beyond. Personal, proactive, and agile. That's Grant Thornton.

Job Description

Happy to discuss flexible working and can be flexible on location

Let’s talk about the job

If you enjoy working on a wide-reaching range of projects that will help businesses and communities flourish, you’ll fit right in. Here are some things you can expect from this Senior Software Developer role.
Making quality second nature. This means doing what’s right even when no one’s looking. The work that you will do has a major impact on our clients and our firm. We pride ourselves on the high-level standards we have for the work that we do.
Own your own work. You will develop, maintain and support software solutions that allow us to make best use of enterprise applications and data to solve business requirements and problems through optimisation, transformation and innovation.
Be a part of a team: You will work alongside other people in the IS team and wider business
Take responsibility. You’ll identify opportunities to innovate and contribute expertise to innovation initiatives, whilst establishing collaborative relationships with stakeholders and subject matter experts across the business. You will also:
Apply agreed architectural approaches and deign patterns and contribute to the evolution of these over time.
Contribute to the development, enhancement and continuous improvement of a DevOps culture
Focus on quality and security, in line with our ISO certified governance processes.
Build your brand. Given the importance of the Senior Software Developer you will deliver on business requirement owning products/solutions individually and as part of a team
The minimum criteria
Development experience using C# and .Net framework (preferably including .Net Core). JavaScript/Typescript skills and knowledge of Bootstrap, Angular and NodeJS would be an advantage
Experience using cloud platform capability as components in solutions, preferably serverless capabilities from the Microsoft Azure stack (such as Azure Service Bus, Azure API Manager, Azure Logic Apps and Azure Functions being an advantage)
Experience integrating cloud-based enterprise applications (eg SaaS solutions) using APIs with good knowledge of integration frameworks and formats (eg JSON, XML)
Skills to set you apart

Here are a few more skills we are looking for. Don’t worry if you don’t tick every box. It’s important for us to support you in your role and help you to develop along the way.

Expertise in back-end development and comfortable working on simple front-end capabilities and User Interfaces

Experience writing web APIs as entry points to services and data, preferably with knowledge of Swagger/OpenAPI

Knowledge of event driven and service/microservice architectures

Capable communicator able to express technical issues in non-technical ways and adapt style to the audience

Do you care about the same things we do?

We have six values we work by. When we meet, we’ll want you to show us how they’re important to you, too.

Collaboration: We work together, share ideas and always make time to help each other out.

Leadership: Everyone has the chance to lead their own projects.

Excellence: Quality is central to our purpose. We love what we do, and it shows. We sweat the details. We see things through, no matter how tricky.

Agility: The world moves quickly. To keep up, we stay flexible – changing approaches, changing projects, working offline, online, together and alone to get things done.

Respect: A given, of course: we value each other and our clients. We listen, we understand, we care.

Responsibility: The decisions we make and advice we give affects people’s lives and livelihoods. We take that seriously and always do well by doing what’s right.

Bring your whole self

Now you’ve seen our values, it shouldn’t be a surprise that we’re creating a respectful, open, diverse place to work. Building an inclusive culture, where we value difference and respect our colleagues, is not just the right thing to do, it helps our people to perform at the best of their ability and realise their potential.

“We are committed to making sure that the opportunities within our firm are equally accessible for everyone – regardless of background or gender.” Dave Dunckley, CEO

There’s more to life than work

Families, children, sports, night classes…the things you do and the people you’re with outside work matter. They can inspire, motivate and energise you. Inside the office and out. So if you’d like to work flexibly, let us know. We’re happy to look at flexible working options for all our roles, and we’ll always do our best to keep your work and life in balance.

#GTRO"]

industry: Construction, Staffing and Recruiting, and Financial Services
description:
["Your New Company

Hays are recruiting on behalf of a market leading organisation who use Digital Technology to support their business across the UK.

Your new role
Produce elegant and simple code in delivery of engaging web solutions
Creating innovative solutions to web design issues to enhance both the usability and appearance of web solutions
Maintain, improve and extend the current software stack with new functionalities, being part of a development team using Agile principles to continuously improve.
Solving complex business needs by building, testing and documenting software according adhering to best Devops best practices where possible
Help to grow apprentice / junior developers by applying coaching and mentoring techniques whilst contributing to advancing the team’s overall capability and culture.
Assist the product owner in converting high level requirements into smaller work packages
What You'll Need To Succeed
Strong proficiency in HTML, CSS, SASS and JavaScript.
Good knowledge of JS frameworks, ideally Vue.js
Exposure to frontend pipeline tools (Webpack, NPM, etc)
Experience of building responsive user interfaces
Strong project management and software delivery experience
What You Need To Do Now

If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.

If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career. #3944907"]

industry: Information Technology and Services
description:
['Your career starts here.

Interested in planning and delivering technology solutions along with developing your ability to write code? FDM’s software developer graduate programme will help you become a successful Microsoft .NET or Java developer and provides the opportunity to progress in a career within a wide variety of sectors.

Everybody tells you that technology is the world’s fastest growing industry, but what if you could really see for yourself? If you think a career in tech is just about coding, think again. Some of our consultants are currently working on exciting advancements in technology, including robotics, automation and more.

FDM is an award-winning graduate employer. We’re passionate about kick-starting graduate careers in technology and support you every step of the way. When you become an FDMer, you’ll be trained to the latest industry standards at our FDM Leeds Academy, situated in the city centre. You’ll then be placed on-site with one or more of our prestigious clients within a commutable distance of the Leeds Academy for a minimum of two years. It doesn’t stop there, many of our consultants go on to work permanently with the client, work internally at FDM or choose a different pathway using the connections and experience they’ve gained. If you’re looking for a fast-paced role with excellent career progression, look no further.

Over 3,700 FDM consultants are currently placed with our clients, working in a variety of roles including; Software Development, Business Intelligence, IT Service Management and Software Testing. We work with clients all around the world including HSBC, Virgin, Lloyds, Shell and Sky to name a few. Your opportunity to make an impact in the industry starts here.

7 reasons why FDM is for you:

You’ll receive commercially relevant training e.g. SQL and Linux (UNIX) and have access to industry-recognised qualifications
You’ll receive excellent employee benefits, including the prestigious ‘Consultant of the Month award’ and the option to join FDM’s buy-as-you-earn share scheme
You’ll receive development employability skills including Microsoft Excel, CV writing, interview and presentation techniques
You’ll work in an exciting career with some of the world’s most reputable organisations, within a market that is constantly evolving
You will have the opportunity to attend social, networking and development opportunities 
We have locations across the UK and beyond
You’ll receive individual mentoring and ongoing support throughout your entire FDM journey
 The ideal FDMer has:

An analytical, curious and creative mindset
A passion for tech
The ability to solve problems within a fast-paced environment
Strong attention to detail
A desire to learn new software languages
Clear communication skills and the ability to work with people across all departments
A degree, preferably within a STEM discipline but all degrees considered
Commitment to a two-year contract with FDM upon completion of the training period

The tech industry is constantly evolving and continuously needs new developers to take over critical tasks. With assessment centres running all year round and multiple start dates available, make an application today and see where your career will take you!

Please note, applying for this role does not guarantee a place on this particular programme, you will be assessed at the assessment day to align you to a best suited role for your skillset. There are other roles available including; Software Testing, IT Service Management and Business Intelligence.
 Apply now']

industry: Staffing and Recruiting, Financial Services, and Hospital & Health Care
description:
['We have an opportunity for a data and information analyst to join our client NHS Digital. These are long-term temporary roles to start asap

If you have experience of working within data/information analysis, recently graduated in a course which frequently required data/information analysis and experience with SAS then this may be the role for you
Location: Working from home but then a hybrid model will be introduced where you will work some days in the office and some days at home - the office will be based in Leeds City Centre - LS1 so ideally you can travel into the office when required, max 3 days per week
Hours: Monday- Friday 37.5 hours a week - flexible hours between 8-6
Assignment length: 6 (may be extended subject to business requirements)
Salary: £12.74 per hour (Annually £24,843)
NHS Digital are the national information and technology partner to the health and social care system using digital technology to transform the NHS and social care.

The Data & Insight Analyst supports the management and analysis of data across its full lifecycle, from initial receipt and preparation of the data asset through to analysis and interpretation of the data to support publication. Working as part of multi-disciplinary teams alongside colleagues from across Information, Analysis & Statistics and Data Management, the role holder will ensure that data are handled in an efficient and secure way in line with information governance legislation.

The role holder will apply skills across a range of data management and analysis areas including:
Supporting Requirements gathering
End-to-end process mapping
Code development
Solutions assurance
Data quality assurance
Data analysis & interpretation
Data presentation
Reference data management
Desired Skills And Experience
You will have experience of presenting and explaining through written and verbal communication in a style that translates technical detail into user friendly, accessible plain English that can be understood by all audiences.
Experience of having discussions with customers (internal and external) to clarify or define customer specifications.
Can easily interpret the quality of data through proactive identification of poor data quality and propose appropriate solutions.
Can analyse and interpret raw data, create appropriate measures of performance, value-added analysis and summarise the results
Experience of building data assets.
You will have some experience of using SAS, Enterprise Guide or Sequel
Qualifications
Degree level qualification in an IT or numerate related subject or equivalent qualification/experience
If this role sounds of interest to you then please apply now or send your CV directly to myself']

industry: Financial Services, Information Services, and Information Technology and Services
description:
["As our next Data Provisioning Services Software Development Engineer you’ll design, build, test, implement and support ETL and related technologies which support the Society’s data requirements. You’ll join a likeminded team in our Leeds based Technology Delivery function. We are looking for experienced developers who can help use their expertise to direct and lead the service.

What You'll Do
Develop, document, and test software and configuration ensuring they adhere to development standards and meet requirements. You’ll be technically competent and experienced in applicable technologies and platforms.
Be responsible for coordinating and implementing packages of work into the various test and live environments.
Report on the progress of work allocated using applicable Agile tools (Kanban, Scrum) to maintain and support live application systems running at YBS.
Participate and lead peer reviews of documentation, code, unit and integration testing
Collaborate with architects, analysts and product owners to perform impact analysis on requirements and designs.
Ensure that system design meets the current design standards, is appropriate for current architecture and meets future architecture and infrastructure requirements.

How You’ll Do It
Have excellent knowledge of one or more ETL tools
a number of the following software skill sets: ODI, BODS (other ETL tools considered) ,EDQ, SAS and/or SAS administration, SQL, PL/SQL, SSIS packages
Desirable skills include:
Data design experience
Experience of automation
Continuous Integration - Gitlab, Jenkins
Knowledge, understanding and experience of DevOps software delivery methodologies and the application of them.
Demonstrable experience within a modern software engineering role.
Strong knowledge of modern technologies and platforms used within data management
Ability to interpret complex information to develop business outcomes and present back in an easy and simple manner
Experience of working within IT support environments
Knowledge of IT delivery and maintenance
Training and support will be provided to develop your skillset and knowledge

Life at YBS
In addition to the usual benefits such as competitive salary, annual bonus and healthcare packages we offer you…
Flexibility – Whether it’s picking up the kids from school or catching that early morning yoga session we have you covered.
Celebrating Success – From everyday thank you cards, to our annual ‘Raising the Roof’ gala to celebrate our golden ticket winners we acknowledge our colleagues successes no matter how big or small.
Giving Back – Fancy 31 hours of paid leave a year to get involved in community activities? Together last year, we completed more than 11,000 hours of volunteering!
Inclusivity - We don’t just accept difference — we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our colleagues, our customers and our community. We are proud to be an equal opportunities employer.
Site Perks – Some of our sites have added little extras such as a gym, restaurant and free parking at our Bradford site, roof garden in Leeds, and on-site restaurant and free parking at our Peterborough site.
So….
If you’ve got a solid background in modern software engineering/design and you want to develop a career in an empowering, respectful and supporting business then why not join us?
Our people are our heart and soul; we’re commercial and caring, big enough to offer you a challenge and small enough for you to make a real impact. We’re devoted to putting people first and doing the right thing by providing real help with real life.

We’d love to hear from you so why not apply today and be Your Brilliant Self!
Any Questions – Contact Tazafia Mahmood via email at tmahmood@ybs.co.uk"]

industry: Computer Networking, Computer Software, and Information Technology and Services
description:
["DWP. Digital with Purpose.

DWP is the UK's largest government department. We help people into work, and make payments worth over £195bn a year to support some of the most vulnerable people in our society.



We are looking for a Data Engineer to join our community of tech experts in DWP Digital.



You'll work with us on the design and development of innovative new cloud based data solutions that will improve DWP services for millions of users.



We're driving a once-in-a-generation transformation of government services, using fresh ideas and leading-edge technologies to create innovative, scalable and user-centric digital solutions.



The DWP products and services we maintain and modernise will be used by nearly every person in the UK, at key moments in their lives. The scale of what we do is extraordinary, and our scale and purpose is unique. We'd love you to join us.





Delivery. Work. Projects.



As a Data Engineer in DWP you'll develop and deliver innovative data products which transform how we service data to a variety of consumers.



We're looking for someone who can deliver proactive, innovative and insightful data products and analytics via agile philosophies and cloud technologies that will tangibly improve user outcomes.



You'll be working within an Agile environment alongside one of the Data Science teams within DWP's Data & Analytics directorate, to define and create cloud based technologies, open source tooling and ETL process designs.

We're hiring you for your expertise, and you'll be a respected voice in our community. You will share ideas and best practice across the organisation, leveraging both new and existing technologies and supporting our journey to cloud-native.

You'll be able to tap into expertise and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career. And you'll have chancel provide leadership and technical guidance to our junior data engineers.



What skills, knowledge and experience will you need?



Designs, develops, codes, tests, corrects and documents simple programs or scripts under the direction of others.
Understands core technical concepts related to their role and is able to apply them.
Aware of the need to translate technical concepts into non-technical language and understands what communication is required to internal and external stakeholders.


Tech Stack:



Demonstrable experience with designing, developing and maintaining data solutions on AWS/Azure
Demonstrable expertise in modelling concepts (normalised/dimensional/noSql/Big data)
Working-level experience in programming Languages - in particular SQL, Python, Shell scripting (BASH)
Experience with big data frameworks and associated processing and storage components, e.g. Hadoop Cloudera/AWS EMR, Spark, HIVE, Hue


Details. Wages. Perks.



You'll join us in one of our brilliant digital hubs in Leeds, Newcastle or Sheffield, whichever is most convenient for you.



We also have all the tools and tech we need to enable our people to work flexibly, and many of us are working remotely at the moment due to COVID-19.



In return for your skills, we offer a competitive salary of up to £41,682 a brilliant civil service pension with employer contributions worth over 27%, and a generous leave package starting at 26 days.



We also have a broad benefits package built around your work-life balance which includes:



Flexible working, flexi hours and up to 3 extra flexi days off a month
Hybrid working: some time in a hub with the team, some time at home
Family-friendly policies
Time off volunteering and charitable giving
Bring your authentic self to work with 'I Can Be Me in DWP'
Discounts and savings on shopping, fun days out and more
Interest-free loans to buy a bike or a season ticket, so it's even easier for you to get to work and start making a difference
Sports and social activities
Working in an award-winning environment and culture
Professional development, coaching, mentoring and career progression opportunities.


CLICK APPLY for more information and to start your application."]

industry: Computer Software, Internet, and Marketing and Advertising
description:
["Our full stack engineers bridge the gap between backend data and the frontend websites of Yelp. Our goal is to provide the best user experience to millions of users and we’re excited to dive into any area of the web stack to make it happen.

Full stack engineers rarely have a typical day: One day you might be writing HTML/CSS/JavaScript and another you might be discussing the best approach making our web apps work in our service oriented architecture.

Yelp engineering culture is driven by our values: we’re a cooperative team that values individual authenticity, and encourages “unboring” solutions to problems. We enable all new engineers to deploy working code their first week, and your impact will only grow from there with the support of your manager, mentor and team. At the end of the day, we are all about helping our users, growing as engineers, and having fun in a collaborative environment.

What You Will Do
Design and build new features to connect Yelp with large scale businesses.
Implement beautiful layouts that work across all of Yelp’s platforms (desktop, mobile browsers, and mobile apps).
Deploy projects in a Service-Oriented Architecture, all the way from backend services to fully-featured UIs.
Run A/B experiments and dive into the resulting data to look for trends.
Collaborate closely with product managers, designers, and other engineering teams.
Mentor other engineers and share the skills you’ve learned.
What It Takes To Succeed
Deep understanding of at least one popular server side web framework (Django, Flask, Rails, Pyramid, Laravel, Express, etc.) or modern JS frontend framework (React, Angular, Ember, etc.)
Full-Stack engineering experience in Python, Ruby, JavaScript, Java, or C++.
Understanding of web security and performance best practices.
Comfortable working in a Unix Environment.
Experience with popular Python libraries/tools (Pyramid, pytest, tox, SQLAlchemy) is a plus
What You'll Get
Full responsibility for projects from day one, an awesome team, and a dynamic work environment
Competitive salary with equity in the company, a pension scheme, and an optional employee stock purchase program
25 days paid holiday initially, rising to 29 with service
Private health insurance, including dental and vision
Flexible working hours and meeting-free Wednesdays
Regular 3-day Hackathons and weekly learning groups, always with interesting topics
Opportunities to participate in events and conferences throughout Europe and the US
£58 per month toward any exercise of your choice
Yelp values diversity. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and consider qualified applicants without regard to Age, Disability, Gender Reassignment, Marriage or Civil Partnership, Pregnancy and Maternity, Race, Religion or Belief, Sex.

Note: Yelp does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to any recruiting alias or employee. Yelp is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resume"]

industry: Construction, Staffing and Recruiting, and Financial Services
description:
["Data Scientist

Permanent Data Scientist required to join leading Telecoms company in Birmingham, Leeds, Ipswich, London, or Cardiff!

Your new company

Your new employer is a functional division of a telecommunications company. This super brand maintains the telephone cables, ducts, cabinets, and exchanges that connect nearly all homes and businesses in the United Kingdom to the national broadband and telephone network.

Your new role

To ensure that we provide a service to our customers that is right ‘First Time, Every Time, On Time’ we are focusing on a customer centric data revolution. This means our goal is to become an insight enabled organisation, through data-driven transformation

You will be responsible for solving complex business issues through the development of analytic models, using multi-source data and strong descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive analytics skills. You’ll implement Artificial Intelligence, including Machine Learning tools to support business decisions. Furthermore, you’ll support business teams scaling models into low-touch solutions to provide optimal ROI from data science.

What You'll Need To Succeed

Ideally, you will 3-5+ years’ industry experience in a data science role, with a degree or Masters in a relevant technical field (Operations Research, Computer Science, Physics, Engineering, Statistics, Engineering, or Mathematics). You’ll be an expert in Phyton and/or R, plus SQL/HQL with working knowledge of Qlik. You’ll be passionate about empirical research and for answering hard questions with data, with limitless curiosity and imagination to create novel business solutions. Additionally, you’ll have working knowledge using and scaling analytic products in the Cloud.

What You'll Get In Return

In return for your hard work, your new employer will reward you with a competitive annual salary, a bonus and a great environment and team to work in. As a permanent employee, your new employer will also give you access to a fantastic range of benefits that we can provide you more information of at your request.

What You Need To Do Now

If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.

If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career. #4036827"]

jobtitle: Software Development Engineer - API and Microservices
industry: Financial Services, Information Services, and Information Technology and Services
description:
["We are looking for a Software development engineer to join our Digital Services teams, your role will involve re-platforming from the current website monolith to an API and micro services architecture alongside supporting services for a new mobile app and cloud based Authentication platform. You’ll join our Leeds based Technology Delivery function (but with working from home capability).

What You'll Do

Participate and lead peer reviews of documentation, code, unit and integration testing

How You’ll Do It

Desirable skills include:
Restful Design, working with API Gateway products (Google Apigee or equivalent)

Life at YBS
In addition to the usual benefits such as competitive salary, annual bonus and healthcare packages we offer you…
Flexibility – Whether it’s picking up the kids from school or catching that early morning yoga session we have you covered.
Celebrating Success – From everyday thank you cards, to our annual ‘Raising the Roof’ gala to celebrate our golden ticket winners we acknowledge our colleagues successes no matter how big or small.
Giving Back – Fancy 31 hours of paid leave a year to get involved in community activities? Together last year, we completed more than 11,000 hours of volunteering!
Inclusivity - We don’t just accept difference — we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our colleagues, our customers and our community. We are proud to be an equal opportunities employer.
Site Perks – Some of our sites have added little extras such as a gym, restaurant and free parking at our Bradford site, roof garden in Leeds, and on-site restaurant and free parking at our Peterborough site.

So….
If you’ve got a solid background in modern software engineering/design and you want to develop a career in an empowering, respectful and supporting business then why not join us?
Our people are our heart and soul; we’re commercial and caring, big enough to offer you a challenge and small enough for you to make a real impact. We’re devoted to putting people first and doing the right thing by providing real help with real life.

We’d love to hear from you so why not apply today and be Your Brilliant Self!

‘Any Questions – Contact Tazafia Mahmood via email at tmahmood@ybs.co.uk'"]

industry: Gambling & Casinos
description:
['Do you love iOS development? Do you to build large scale apps? Join us in the Bet Engineering team, where you’ll be part of an agile, native app squad responsible for the delivery and upkeep of our flagship Sky Bet product. Our ambitions are to deliver an incredible native betting & gaming experience across all our SB&G products!

As an iOS Engineer in the native team you’ll play an instrumental role in taking us there, and in return we’ll give you a phenomenal opportunity to work with the newest tech, on one of the most popular mobile applications in the UK market! We keep our squad lean in the “two pizzas” sense, with your role providing the operational expertise knowledge across the full stack for the squad.

Day to day we want you to take ownership of the following;

Development and maintenance of our Sky Bet iOS app.
Advocate improvements to the current development process.
Collaborate with your squad and others to tackle engineering problems and incidents.
Involved in the full delivery process from elaboration to the delivery in the App Store.
Work in a highly collaborative agile way, with other developers and test engineers, alongside a Tech Lead and a Product Owner.
Working with Product Owners and the Tech Lead to find opportunities to utilise the newest technology trends to improve the customer experience.
Write well structured, testable and maintainable code.

We’re looking for passionate iOS Engineers who can demonstrate the following skills;

Skilled in Swift. Skilled in Objective-C is a desirable
Experience using the Xcode IDE
Familiar with the latest iOS SDK
Understanding of HTTP protocols, requests and responses
A keen interest in the latest mobile development trends

What we offer

Flexible working - Whether you want to be fully office based or just pop in a few times per year to meet your team, get in touch
Competitive salary package and bonus scheme. Whilst we cannot disclose salaries publicly, it will be confirmed when you first speak to us
Flexible start/finish - our core hours are 10:00-15:00 each day
£1000 Learning Fund
Free SKY Q Ultra Premium Package
16 hours paid volunteering time per year
25-30 days holiday with buy and sell options
Part time, reduced hours and job share available
Maternity, Paternity and Adoption leave from day one

What is next

We will aim to get back to you as soon as possible. If you are suitable for the role, we will have a short telephone conversation to get to know you and answer any questions you have. Should that go well, for the final stage you will do a pair coding session with one of our engineers followed by an in-depth interview with the squad lead and engineering manager.
 We`re open to discussing reduced hours, job sharing and flexible start and finish times. Speak to us about your options and we`ll explore what`s possible.']

industry: Computer Software, Internet, and Marketing and Advertising
description:
['Want to join a team where your work makes a significant impact? Using the richest source of local business data and user-generated content in the world, Yelp’s application backend engineers work closely with mobile and web developers to generate and power our websites and mobile apps, bringing Yelp’s 224M+ reviews to millions of users all around the world.

Application backend engineers take on a diverse set of challenges across the engineering org, from building products for business owners to get the most out of Yelp, to taking on some of the most meaningful problems in distributed computing and API design.

Where You Come In
Build new features on top of our Service-Oriented Architecture
Iterate quickly using Continuous Integration / Continuous Deployment principles
Articulate a technical vision and execute it
Give back by mentoring other engineers and sharing the skills you learn
What It Takes To Succeed
Based or willing to relocate in the United Kingdom
Relevant industry experience
An understanding of and interest in elegant API designs
Relevant experience in at least one programming language: Python, C, Java, Go, Rust, etc.
A craving for new knowledge and challenges
What You’ll Get
Full responsibility for projects from day one, an awesome team, and a dynamic work environment
Competitive salary with equity in the company, a pension scheme, and an optional employee stock purchase program
25 days paid holiday initially (rising to 29 with service), plus one floating holiday
Private health insurance, including dental and vision
Flexible working hours and meeting-free Wednesdays
Regular 3-day Hackathons and weekly learning groups, always with interesting topics
Opportunities to participate in digital events and conferences
£58 per month toward any wellness activity of your choice
Quarterly team offsites
Yelp values diversity. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and consider qualified applicants without regard to Age, Disability, Gender Reassignment, Marriage or Civil Partnership, Pregnancy and Maternity, Race, Religion or Belief, Sex.

Note: Yelp does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to any recruiting alias or employee. Yelp is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resume']

industry: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services
description:
["Xero is a beautiful, easy-to-use platform that helps small businesses and their accounting and bookkeeping advisors grow and thrive. 

At Xero, our purpose is to make life better for people in small business, their advisors, and communities around the world. This purpose sits at the centre of everything we do. We support our people to do the best work of their lives so that they can help small businesses succeed through better tools, information and connections. Because when they succeed they make a difference, and when millions of small businesses are making a difference, the world is a more beautiful place.

Our culture & values:

We'd describe our culture as human, friendly, engaging, supportive, agile and super collaborative.

At Xero, our five values underpin everything we do: from the way we work, to how we delight and deliver to our customers.
Our values are: #Human #Ownership #Team #Challenge and #Beautiful. They create our special culture and the ‘Xero way’ that we want to foster and maintain as we scale and grow at speed. They're integral to our brand and resonate outside Xero through our ecosystem and ultimately our customers.

Whilst our engineering team are spread across the UK and work remotely, we truly make up for this with the social interaction and 'team' environment that we create.

How you’ll make an impact;

As part of an ever expanding product & tech function, you’ll be a champion for quality within our software engineering team.

Quality is a team responsibility at Xero, and part of your role will be to help coach the team on development approaches and testing strategies to promote quality as well as being a hands-on member of the development team.  You'll focus on helping to create sustainable, quality development processes, contribute towards automation, development and DevOps tasks whilst continually learning and sharing your knowledge with the wider team (.Net Core/C#/React.js stack).

Our team, and you

Your previous analysis and testing skills will help the team build quality and your experience with test automation within a development environment will enable you to contribute as a cross-functional team member.  The successful Software Developer in Test will have a successful background in the testing space with strong automation testing expertise gained within a fast paced agile DevOps, CI/CD focussed environment. You'll have a strong background in a range of testing frameworks, automation tools and previous coding skills in some of: C#, .Net, Python, JavaScript.

What makes a great team? A Diverse Team!

Don't be put off if you don't tick all boxes; we know from research that candidates may not apply if they don't feel they are 100% there yet, but why not give it a try? 

We're committed to creating a diverse and inclusive culture.

A snapshot of some of the things you'll get:
Top-spec Macbook Pro or HP Z-book
\xadHighly Competitive Salary
Employee Share Plan (Own a part of Xero)
23 days holiday plus bank holidays (plus an extra 3 days over the Xmas period!)
10 days Wellbeing Leave (for sickness, emergencies and taking a mental health break)
Company Pension Scheme (matched contributions up to 4.5%)
A range of Wellbeing initiatives
Remote & Flexible Working
And lots more!


Why Xero?

At Xero we support many types of flexible working arrangements that allow you to balance your work, your life and your passions. We offer a great remuneration package with benefits that support a range of lifestyle choices and requirements  and the opportunity to participate in Xero’s success through our Long Term Incentive scheme. Xero has rapidly expanding offices in London, Milton Keynes and Manchester and our work environment encourages continuous improvement and career development. 

Our collaborative and inclusive culture is one we’re immensely proud of. We know that a diverse workforce is a strength that enables businesses, including ours, to better understand and serve customers, attract top talent and innovate successfully. We are a Stonewall Diversity Champion, and Disability Confident committed. So, from the moment you step through our doors, you’ll feel welcome and supported to do the best work of your life."]

industry: Computer Games, Gambling & Casinos, and Online Media
description:
['We are looking for a Poker Data Analyst to join our busy and dynamic team based in our Leeds office.

The Poker Data Analyst is responsible for retrieving, reporting, and presenting commercial Poker data to internal partners. This role is essential to understanding poker player behaviours, contextualizing PokerStars’ place within the poker industry, and uncovering compelling statistics that span our 20 year history.

Why we need you

As part of the Poker Operations team, your key responsibilities will include
Retrieving, validating, compiling, and reporting complex Poker datasets to provide commercial insights related to competitors, regulatory changes, and the core game offering
Presenting said datasets in a compelling and digestible way to colleagues with and without analytics backgrounds
Providing internal customers data validation for use in external communications, Poker product features, and other general requests
Improving data access for Poker Operations staff, such as creating Excel or MicroStrategy dashboards and collaborating closely with Data Warehouse to ensure desired data is readily available
Identifying and undertaking technical projects to improve operational efficiency across the teams as needed
Who are we looking for
Expert knowledge of SQL and Python
In-depth knowledge of the online poker industry
Effortless presentation skills
General knowledge of attributes of online poker players and hands
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
English fluency – written and verbal
Dedicated, hard-working, self-motivated
Ability to juggle multiple urgent requests from management
Strong analytical and decision-making skills
As an ideal candidate you`ll have
A university-level education or equivalent work experience
Expert level SQL and Python skills
Expert level Microsoft Excel skill
Experience with Tableau is a plus
What’s in it for you?

The salary for this job is based on experience, so whilst we are not able to go into detail at this stage, we can say that we offer great salary packages and a discretionary annual performance bonus. We can also provide advice and dedicated assistance to those moving to Leeds.

We offer health and dental insurance for you, your partner and your children (if you all live at the same address). If you have a baby whilst you work for us, we will give you 1000 GBP as congratulations.

In addition to that, we provide the opportunity for a discounted gym membership.

Our in-house training and development team delivers fantastic support in terms of developing your skills and helping you progress your career.

What happens next?

We will aim to get back to you as soon as possible. If you meet the criteria, then we’ll invite you to a phone interview and if that goes well we’ll meet you for a face-to-face interview.

The Group

PokerStars is part of Flutter Entertainment Plc, a global sports betting, gaming and entertainment provider headquartered in Dublin and part of FTSE 100 index of the London Stock Exchange, which brings together exceptional brands, products and businesses and a diverse global presence in a safe, responsible and ultimately sustainable way.

We are an equal opportunity employer that values diversity. We do not discriminate on any protected characteristic as defined by applicable law.

We will look to provide reasonable accommodation for applicants with disabilities to participate in the job application or interview process. If you need assistance, please contact talent@starsgroup.com

Please note we cannot accept general applications; this inbox is just for providing support to those who need it.']

industry: Civic & Social Organization and Nonprofit Organization Management
description:
['This is an exciting opportunity for an enthusiastic software developer to become a key member of our fast moving Software Development team. For those looking for a career in software Development, no prior experience is necessary as training will be provided where required.

Developed using the latest code and technologies, we provide industry leading recruitment software and services to our customers. You will be responsible for helping us develop our software.

As part of the Development team, you will get exposure to the full technology stack including the latest code technologies while working in a fast moving environment where no two days are the same.

This is an ideal opportunity for someone with good programming skills who wants to kick start their career in software development. You will be involved in the full software development life cycle and develop business-critical features and services.

Working in the multi-disciplined Development team, day to day you will be:

Developing enhancements to existing software features

Working from development specifications and with key stakeholders to develop new features

Taking part in daily Scrum meetings

Researching and developing with new technologies

What We Are Looking For

We are looking for you to have ambition to self learn and evolve your technical skills. You’ll be able to adjust quickly to changing priorities and help resolve complex problems. We will give you the time to develop your skills, all we ask for is willingness, passion and a drive to learn.

Essential Skills

VB or C# .NET MVC web application development

HTML / CSS / JavaScript / JQuery

A drive and passion to self-learn

A good understanding of technology

Outstanding analytical and problem solving

Desirable Skills

Microservices

Azure DevOps

Git

SQL Server

Benefits

Competitive salary

On the job training

Friendly and supportive environment

Personal Development Time

Free parking

Company pension scheme, 25 days holiday, gym membership discount, cycle scheme, etc.

Flexible working (37.5 hours per week)

Remote working where applicable.

We offer and encourage in house career progression through the wider IT and Development team. With the right passion and initiative you can progress your career within our business in a supportive and progressive team environment.']

industry: Internet and Information Technology and Services
description:
["hackajob are partnered with an award-winning technology and engineering consultancy for business. They work with the world’s largest organizations, delivering IT solutions that millions of people use every day. They want people to make the most of their talent and potential, so they are committed to supporting their personal and professional development.

They want their people to make the most of their talent and potential, so they’re committed to supporting their personal and professional development. Their reputation for excellence means they can provide exciting career development opportunities working on rewarding engagements for some of the world’s leading organizations.

What makes them different?

They’re not your typical technology consultancy. You won’t find a strict hierarchy or a constrained career path. Your Squad Lead has a pastoral role and is responsible for ensuring that you have a great employee experience, and most importantly works with you to determine the course of your career.

About the Role: They love to experiment with the latest tools, technologies and techniques to improve how they deliver their solutions and as a software engineer you can expect to be involved in:

Engineering software solutions - working with prototypes and proof of concepts and developing fully functioning applications based on frameworks such as .Net and Spring/Spring Boot, and using languages including Java, Scala, JavaScript, Python, C# and Go.
Producing rich front-end UI and efficient services with technologies like React, Angular and Vue.
The automation of environmental and application deployment, scaling, and management using Kubernetes, Terraform, both in the cloud (AWS, Azure or GCP) or on-premise.

About You:

You're an engineer at heart and enjoy the challenge of building complex software solutions
You want to work across a range of tech environments. Your priorities will be building new systems and improving stability, security and efficiency
You're keen to learn new technologies and languages
You're comfortable operating in an Agile environment with a good working knowledge in areas such as CI/CD, build pipelines, testing and architecture
You have a good understanding of computing fundamentals (e.g. logic, data structures, algorithms, low-level architecture, networks stack) along with strong software design skills, including OO, and knowledge of version control systems such as Git
You love nothing more than grabbing a pen and whiteboarding the next challenge

Their wider Tech stack:
 Backend: Java, Node JS, Scala, C#, Go, Spring Boot, .NET, Python
Frontend: Typescript, Angular, React, Vue.js
DevOps: Azure DevOps, AWS, Kubernetes, Docker, Terraform

They also offer a comprehensive benefits package, if you're interested in finding out more about this fantastic opportunity please get your application in and sign up to our platform to get matched with this role.

*This role requires you to be based in the UK and to have the right to work in the UK*"]

industry: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet
description:
["Elastic is a search company built on a free and open heritage. Anyone can use Elastic products and solutions to get started quickly and frictionlessly. Elastic offers three solutions for enterprise search, observability, and security, built on one technology stack that can be deployed anywhere. From finding documents to monitoring infrastructure to hunting for threats, Elastic makes data usable in real time and at scale. Thousands of organizations worldwide, including Cisco, eBay, Goldman Sachs, Microsoft, The Mayo Clinic, NASA, The New York Times, Wikipedia, and Verizon, use Elastic to power mission-critical systems. Founded in 2012, Elastic is a distributed company with Elasticians around the globe and is publicly traded on the NYSE under the symbol ESTC. Learn more at elastic.co.

The Infrastructure team in Elastic Engineering sits underneath the Elastic product stack and support many efforts in the company at large. Primarily we’re software developers that handle state — CI specifications, cloud resources, integrations between teams. The Elastic Stack is built on our infrastructure and we touch everything needed to get it there. We also do software consulting around the organization to put our products to use for our own business.

What You Will Be Doing:
Develop tooling to facilitate the building and shipping of the Elastic Stack
Develop and support production services related to all aspects of the Elastic business, including our downloads, Docker registry, maps service, and much more.
Support internal use of the Elastic Stack for software development and analytics.
What You Bring Along:
Software Developer: You probably have a broad software development background (we use Python, JavaScript, Clojure, Haskell, but across the company is everything else from Java to Go). Being deep in some language is a requirement, but it doesn't have to be one of the above
Site-Reliability Engineering: We are an operations team. We solve problems with code, but fundamentally we keep things working. You may have worked as an SRE
Service-Oriented: Multiple years hands-on experience administering Linux, preferably with distributed systems with some scale. You've maybe help run a SaaS platform
Infrastructure-as-code: You may have experience automating production Linux systems collaboratively, deriving configuration through version control, and are proficient in some of Docker, Puppet, Chef, Ansible, Salt, Habitat, Dhall, Terraform, Packer, your own shell scripts. Maybe you've thrown half of that away and use Kubernetes. We do that too
Bonus Points:
You have a strong desire to automate and monitor
You have a desire to build reusable software components. You’ve likely created an open source library for your favorite language, or at least made a meaningful contribution to one
You enjoy a versioned workflow, representing your work in git, motivated by a GitHub workflow through issues and pull requests
You have a healthy knowledge of Linux (have compiled your own kernel at some point, know how to trace syscalls, understand TCP, care about the difference between sysvinit/runit/systemd, etc.) You don't have to know everything, but be motivated to solve problems like these
You love open source development, and have committed to some project somewhere (doesn’t have to be ours), whether mailing lists, patches, documentation, etc.
You enjoy working with a distributed company and the active, asynchronous communication it requires.
You love a diverse environment, working with men and women all over the world. You believe that a diverse company is a better company
You are willing to listen and give everyone at the table a voice
Applicants have rights under Federal Employment Laws, view posters linked below: Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA) Poster; Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Poster; and Employee Polygraph Protection Act (EPPA) Poster.

Please see here for our Privacy Statement.

Additional Information - We Take Care Of Our People

As a distributed company, diversity drives our identity. Whether you’re looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life. Your age is only a number. It doesn’t matter if you’re just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.

We strive to have parity of benefits across regions and while regulations differ from place to place, we believe taking care of our people is the right thing to do.
Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary
Health coverage for you and your family in many locations
Ability to craft your calendar with flexible locations and schedules for many roles
Generous number of vacation days each year
Double your charitable giving - We match up to $1500 (or local currency equivalent)
Up to 40 hours each year to use toward volunteer projects you love
Embracing parenthood with minimum of 16 weeks of parental leave
Different people approach problems differently. We need that. Elastic is committed to diversity as well as inclusion. We are an equal opportunity employer and committed to the principles of affirmative action. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. If you require any reasonable accessibility support, please complete our Candidate Accessibility Request Form.

#

#

#

#000000"]

industry: Financial Services, Information Services, and Information Technology and Services
description:
["YBS is looking for 2 software development engineers to join Digital Services to work in the team responsible for supporting, maintaining and developing changes for the current transactional Savings & Mortgage websites (Java/Spring MVC architecture).

You’ll join a likeminded team in our Leeds based Technology Delivery function (but with working from home capability). The team structure is in the process of moving from project to product focused so you will be part of supporting that journey.

What You'll Do
Develop, document, and test (in an automated way) software and configuration ensuring they adhere to development standards and meet requirements.
Work on implementing automated build pipelines and monitoring capabilities.
Participate and lead peer reviews of documentation, code, unit and integration testing
Collaborate with Tech leads, architects, analysts, scrum master and product owners to perform impact analysis and estimation on requirements and designs.
Ensure that system design meets the current design standards, is appropriate for current architecture and meets future architecture and infrastructure requirements.
Provide out of hours support for services.

How You’ll Do It
Be a great communicator finding ways for non-technical people to understand technical concepts.
Be a strong influencer and negotiator to bring people on-board to new ways of thinking and working against a strongly regulated financial environment.
Have excellent knowledge of a number of the following software skill sets: Java & Java frameworks, Spring, Web services and XML.
Have experience of integrating new technologies and creating standards of usage within teams.
Desirable skills include:
Struts Model View Controller
