Knowledge of integrating with Oracle database environments (PL-SQL) and middleware (Tuxedo and SOA).
Consuming and exposing web services in both SOAP and REST.
Logging, Monitoring & Alerting
Continuous Integration Pipelines - Jenkins, Gitlab
Security (OWASP, Certificates, JWT, Encryption techniques)
Have experience of working within IT support environments
Demonstrable experience leading a modern software engineering team.

Life at YBS
In addition to the usual benefits such as competitive salary, annual bonus and healthcare packages we offer you…
Flexibility – Whether it’s picking up the kids from school or catching that early morning yoga session we have you covered.
Celebrating Success – From everyday thank you cards, to our annual ‘Raising the Roof’ gala to celebrate our golden ticket winners we acknowledge our colleagues successes no matter how big or small.
Giving Back – Fancy 31 hours of paid leave a year to get involved in community activities? Together last year, we completed more than 11,000 hours of volunteering!
Inclusivity - We don’t just accept difference — we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our colleagues, our customers and our community. We are proud to be an equal opportunities employer.
Site Perks – Some of our sites have added little extras such as a gym, restaurant and free parking at our Bradford site, roof garden in Leeds, and on-site restaurant and free parking at our Peterborough site.

So….
If you’ve got a solid background in modern software engineering/design and you want to develop a career in an empowering, respectful and supporting business then why not join us?
Our people are our heart and soul; we’re commercial and caring, big enough to offer you a challenge and small enough for you to make a real impact. We’re devoted to putting people first and doing the right thing by providing real help with real life.

We’d love to hear from you so why not apply today and be Your Brilliant Self!

‘Any Questions – Contact Tazafia Mahmood via email at tmahmood@ybs.co.uk"]

industry: Food & Beverages, Food Production, and Retail
description:
["About The Role

We have an exciting opportunity to join our Marketing Department as a Data Analyst to focus on Customer Insight.

This role will report into the Customer Insight Manager.

The successful candidate will be responsible for analysing data captured through our loyalty scheme and delivering actionable customer insight with a focus on customer behaviour to help drive business decisions. They’ll provide regular reporting as well as ad hoc analysis in order to support tactical and strategic decision making across the business, with a particular focus on marketing and commercial.

This is a full time, permanent role.

The position benefits from a 4 day week. The working pattern is 4 days per week of 9 hours per day, based in our Bradford Head Office, with some remote working.

There is also a requirement to work 1 in 4 Saturdays (6 hours).

Responsibilities;
Support the Customer Insight Manager in delivering compelling and clear insight to the wider business
Develop strong relationships with key stakeholders, particularly within Marketing
Automation of reports to speed up the way in which we analyse customer data
Understanding of all available data sources
Liaise with other data users to ensure we continually improve in line with the business
Deliver customer reporting weekly
Develop ad hoc analyses to answer immediate business questions
Review the performance of key events and deals from a customer perspective
About You

Requirements;
Confident user of excel, report automation and experience with SQL
Highly numerate with a proven ability to solve complex problems
Ability to develop hypotheses around stakeholder questions and utilise insight to prove / disprove them
A passion for doing the right thing by customers
Creative thinker with strong analytical skills
Able to communicate complex analytical outcomes in simple terms
Effective stakeholder management
High levels of drive and personal resilience
Strong listening skills
A positive, ‘Can Do’ attitude
About The Company

Marketing is a fast-paced, high energy function that drives sales by putting the customer at the heart of everything we do. The marketing team are our brand champions, making sure we give customers what they want, at prices they like, and delivering an experience that's always unmistakably Morrisons. The team pioneers and delivers industry-leading work in a collaborative and friendly environment with a forward-thinking, people-focused culture. Work is always challenging, frequently fun, and the career prospects are exciting.

Our aim to offer more of what matters extends to our employees too. Join us and you can expect to enjoy great career prospects and a very competitive pay and benefits package. In addition to an attractive salary, we offer a discount card for you plus two more for friends or family members giving you 10% off your shopping in Morrisons. We also offer company share options, a highly competitive pension scheme, Life Assurance and more besides.

We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all sections of the community."]

industry: Construction, Staffing and Recruiting, and Financial Services
description:
["Hays Technology are looking for a User Research to be part of an exciting project for a large global consultancy.

What You Will Be Doing

As a User Researcher, you will plan, design, and carry out research activities with users that help teams get a deep understanding of the people that use government services. This research informs policy, proposition, service, content, and interaction design so that services work well for users and achieves policy intent.

What We Are Looking For

- Previous experience within a User Researcher role
Experience of working within the Government Digital Service (GDS) environment
Experience following and working to GDS standards
Previously worked with Government agencies such as DWP, HMCTS, Home Office etc
Experience of working within multi-disciplined teams (Developers, Product Owners and QA / Testing teams)
Furthermore
Analysis and synthesis. Turning research data into clear findings that inform decisions.
Inclusive research. You understand the diversity of users of government services.
Research skills. You understand and have experience of a range of user research methods.
Society and technology. You understand the social and technological context for government services.
Strategic insight. You understand organisational strategy and objectives.
Technical understanding.
User-centred and agile practices. You understand user-centred design practices and know how to embed them into an agile workflow to deliver timely findings.
What You'll Get In Return

c£454 per day (outside IR35)

2 days on site every 6 weeks.

What You Need To Do Now

If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.

If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career. #4044817"]

industry: Telecommunications
description:
["giffgaff is a little different to your `normal` telecoms company. It’s a mobile business run by its members. Sounds interesting? It is.
 We may be a small company, but we like to think big and take a different approach to telecommunications. At the heart of it, we believe in mutuality and simplicity. A better way to do mobile. We'd rather our members stay with us because they want to, not because there's a nasty contract forcing them to. It's why we work our socks off every day to keep them and guess what? It works. We're uSwitch Network of the Year 2021.
 giffgaff is a fast-growing mobile network. Our business model is unique - we take a highly collaborative approach with our members who help (and are rewarded for helping) across all areas of the business. Our vibrant online community, online platform and immense value proposition are key to our success. We do not have a retail footprint or expensive call centres, so we can pass these savings straight on to our members in a way that no other telecoms business does.
 Our wonderful gaff is located in Uxbridge, in the West of London, but if a commute to that part of the country isn’t warming your cockles - please don’t be put off applying for this role.
 The world has changed - particularly when it comes to ways of working. This role is 100% work from home, but we’ll ferry you in a few times a year from wherever you are in the UK for team or company days, or our famous giffgaff summer and Christmas celebrations.
 About the Team:
 Software engineering is at the heart of what we do here at giffgaff - our agile engineering teams build and support a set of applications and services that combined create our unique user experience on the giffgaff website, enable our internal teams to work in the most productive and efficient ways and enable a whole range of awesome features via modern APIs.
 About the Role:
 The quality and maintainability of our software is very important for us, we are looking for engineers with real world experience, especially in terms of the whole development lifecycle.
 You will help us design and implement tightly focussed APIs, services and user interfaces and, together with your team, you will support them in production. We want you to share your opinions on how we are doing things - and help us get better! You’ll be embedded into one of our cross-functional product teams to work on a wide variety of creative technical solutions. Depending on the team profile you may be working on user facing applications, internal tools or processes, or APIs and services implementing our core business logic.
 Responsibilities:
 Work with a full-stack attitude within a self-organising, cross functional product engineering team using extreme programming practices - notably pair programming and test-driven development
 Build, support and maintain automated, fault-tolerant, scalable products and solutions that are continuously delivered into our production environment
 Be technically curious, tackling problems without giving up, and producing solutions that less-experienced engineers can use, maintain, and learn from
 Skills & experience:
 Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in computer science, programming, mathematics, or a related field or equivalent experience. Professional certifications in relevant technologies are desirable.
 Essential Skills: Reading & Writing Code, Debugging & Troubleshooting, IDE & OS Basics, Test Driven Development, Pair Programming, Clean Code & Refactoring, Version Control
 Desirable Skills: CI / CD, Algorithms & Data Structures, DI / IoC, Mocks & Stubs, Alerting & Monitoring, Functional & Non-Functional Testing, SOLID Principles, Containerisation & Networking Basics, Twelve Factor App Design, Solution Architecture
 Plus, competency in 3 or more of the following:
 Client-Side Engineering: CSS3, Cypress, ECMAScript (ES6+), HTML5, Jest, React & React Native, SASS, TypeScript
 Server-Side Engineering: Java 8 with Maven & Spring, JUnit, NodeJS, PHP with Laravel or Zend, Python
 Additional Technology: Apache & NGINX, AWS, Jenkins, DynamoDB, PostgreSQL, Redis & Oracle, Docker & Kubernetes, ElasticSearch & Kibana, Grafana & Prometheus, Kinesis
 Additional Information:
 The key stakeholders for you will be within your team, primarily the Product Owner, Scrum Master and Technical Lead (who provides line management), however interaction across the business at all levels is expected.
 Finally...
 This is a chance to work for one of the most sought after UK companies, highly regarded for its community model. In return for your outstanding efforts, you’ll be rewarded with a competitive salary and excellent benefits. We believe that hard work should be supported and recognised. This position plays an important role across the business, allowing you to work cross functionality, take on more responsibility and gain experience, which will greatly benefit you in the future."]

industry: Construction, Information Technology and Services, and Computer Software
description:
["Trimble is an exciting, entrepreneurial company, with a history of exceptional growth coupled with a disciplined and strategic focus on being the best. While GPS is at our core, we have grown beyond this technology to embrace other sophisticated positioning technologies and, in doing so; we are changing the way the world works. Our solutions are used in over 140 countries and we have incredibly diverse lines of business.

Our employees represent this diversity and can be found in over 30 countries, working closely with their colleagues around the world. Due to our geographic, product and customer reach, there is plenty of room at Trimble for exceptional people to grow. Come position yourself with an innovative industry leader and position yourself for success.

Trimble Solutions UK provides the construction industry with Tekla Building Information Modeling (BIM) and structural design and analysis software solutions that are in the core of the construction workflow. The solutions allow customers to achieve greater competitive edge through improved collaboration, efficiency and accuracy. Tekla tools are used for realizing projects around the world from housing and bridges to factories and skyscrapers. www.tekla.com

Software Engineer (Product Delivery)

Do you enjoy problem solving? Do you want a career in software engineering? Do you have good communication and team working skills?

If you've answered YES to all these questions and have a good degree in Computer Science/Engineering/Science or Maths then we want to hear from you.

We are looking to recruit a Product Delivery Software Engineer to develop the deployment solutions for our Tekla Analysis & Design range of software applications in the Trimble Structures Division in Leeds, UK .

We will consider applications from people with good analytical and problem solving skills. Experience of a high level programming language such as C#, Java or Powershell and a good understanding of Microsoft operating systems and/or software application development technologies would also be beneficial.

We are also happy to consider applicants with different experience levels, to include graduate or entry level, intermediate and more experienced developers.

You will be responsible for the development, support and maintenance of the deployment packages for our Structural Analysis & Design application products. You will also be responsible for the development of additional software support services that continue to make our software easier and more efficient for clients to deploy, manage and use.

This is an excellent opportunity to develop and grow your career with a successful global company.

Your Role Is To
Implement and maintain the DevOps workflow for multiple Windows desktop software products
Improve productivity and quality by utilising more digital automation
Collaborate with the teams responsible for delivering other Tekla products
Perform thorough testing to ensure that requirements are met reliably and robustly
We expect you to have:
A background in software engineering, either at educational or professional level
Experience in a high level programming language (C#, Java, Powershell, etc.)
Fluent written and spoken English
Ability to learn and adapt fast to changes and new environments
Good communication and collaboration skills
Positive attitude, active and enthusiastic about software engineering
Experience/knowledge of Git based systems and Agile methodologies.
We also value any existing experience of Microsoft Installer (MSI) and software build and deployment tools including InstallShield, Team City and Git.

Trimble is transforming the way the world works by delivering products and services that connect the physical and digital worlds. Core technologies in positioning, modeling, connectivity and data analytics enable customers to improve productivity, quality, safety and sustainability. From purpose built products to enterprise lifecycle solutions, Trimble software, hardware and services are transforming a broad range of industries such as agriculture, construction, geospatial and transportation and logistics.

Trimble is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, gender, age, color, religion, national origin, marital status, disability, sexual orientation, status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws, or any other protected factor. EOE/M/F/V/D"]

industry: Staffing and Recruiting, Financial Services, and Hospital & Health Care
description:
['We are looking for a Banking Analyst for the HM Treasury based in Leeds. This would be a long term temporary role covering 37.50 hours per week Monday-Friday. The rate per hour will be between £16-£18 per hour. You would be required to work from the office a few days per week and then home working.

The job role will require the duties below and you will be covering data mangement, working with excel spreadsheets to manage and report data

Examples Of Work Performed Will Include But Not Be Restricted To

The Temporary Worker will provide middle management support and operate with minimal supervision, exercising independent judgment in completing assignments.
Preparing high-level correspondence and checking that produced by others
Interpreting and reporting complex data
Resolving problems or responding to complex enquiries
Managing the workload of a team or section
Liaising with internal and external stakeholders at senior level building and maintaining relationships Typical qualifications and experience:
Five GCSE passes at Grade C or above
Two A level passes at grade E or above or equivalent
NVQ Management Level 3 or 4 (or suitable management experience)
Good knowledge of and experience in using Microsoft Office
Management experience in an office environment
Excellent communication skills both oral and written
Skills Required
Highly proficient/expert at creating and managing databases/excel
Ability to interpret/analyse/communicate large volumes of data effectively and efficiently
Ability to think of creative data driven solutions
Highly analytical and effective at reporting information']

industry: Staffing and Recruiting, Retail, and Financial Services
description:
["Job Advert

Are you looking for your first move into the data analytics arena and looking for an opportunity to innovate, own and drive data-based solutions to business problems?

As a Data Analyst - Space Optimisation working across General Merchandise and George, you will help specify and deliver a suite of analytical tools and capabilities to drive our Mission. Space Analytics is responsible for making sure that we maximise financial returns in our store estate and identify commercial opportunities.

You will help to shape and drive the functionality of our new tools and capabilities. Working alongside Experts in Trading, Analytics, and Property you will deliver analytics solutions and insight to help solve some of the major issues the business faces today.

Your role

As Data Analyst - Space Optimisation, you will be accountable for the management and delivery of data analytics to support stakeholders in making key commercial decisions. You will be able to identify trends and opportunities from data providing recommendations for change. You'll be obsessed with finding new and innovative ways of working and data presentation.

You will be provided with the opportunity to develop and learn from some of the of the industry's best data analysts and experts.

You will play an integral role in supporting the business to inform and deliver the GM & George Commercial Strategy.

About You
Inquisitive mindset and driven by continuous improvement with a history of embracing and driving change using new technologies
Self-motivated, able to work under pressure, prioritise quickly & effectively to deliver to agreed deadlines
Proactive ability to challenge and influence key stakeholders to help shape business requirements and scope
A problem solver who develops their own ideas and hypotheses
You must have demonstrable analytical and data visualisation skills
SQL, Alteryx, Power BI, Analytics experience
Your Benefits

If flexible working is important to you, then look no further! At George, we are proud of our culture and our commitment to flexible working. This role is based at either ASDA House, Leeds or George House, Lutterworth with the opportunity to work flexibly from home 2-3 days per week

You Will Also Get An Excellent Benefits Package Including
Discretionary company bonus
Company pension up to 7% matched
10% colleague discount, free parking and many additional rewards.
We want all colleagues to be able to bring their best and true selves to work, every day. Simply put, we want our colleagues to be Proud to be George and proud to be themselves."]

industry: Computer Software, Internet, and Marketing and Advertising
description:
["As an engineer on the Core Android team, you’ll support Yelp’s Android community by developing tools, libraries, architectures, and infrastructure to keep things running smoothly. From continuous integration that enables our automated weekly release cycle to multi-module build setups that make our build times superfast, we’re always looking to integrate the latest and greatest technologies that make Android development at Yelp quick and easy.

Yelp engineering culture is driven by our values: we’re a cooperative team that values individual authenticity and encourages “unboring” solutions to problems. We enable all new engineers to deploy working code their first week, and your impact will only grow from there with the support of your manager, mentor, and team. At the end of the day, we're all about helping our users, growing as engineers, and having fun in a collaborative environment.

Where You Come In
Develop tools, architectures, and infrastructure on top of modern open source foundations (Kotlin, Koin, Firebase Testlab, etc.)
Support our continuous integration platform to enable automated weekly releases
Mentor other engineers and share the skills you’ve learned
Be a key part of the larger Android developer community at Yelp
What It Takes To Succeed
Willingness to live and work in the United Kingdom
Several years of relevant industry experience
Eager to embrace challenges with scalability, reliability, and performance
Insistent on creating a fast and reliable developer experience
An advocate for Yelp’s mission to connect people with great local businesses
What You’ll Get
Full responsibility for projects from day one, an awesome team, and a dynamic work environment
Competitive salary with equity in the company, a pension scheme, and an optional employee stock purchase program
25 days paid holiday initially (rising to 29 with service), plus one floating holiday
Private health insurance, including dental and vision
Flexible working hours and meeting-free Wednesdays
Regular 3-day Hackathons and weekly learning groups, always with interesting topics
Opportunities to participate in digital events and conferences
£58 per month toward any wellness activity of your choice
Quarterly team offsites
Yelp values diversity. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and consider qualified applicants without regard to Age, Disability, Gender Reassignment, Marriage or Civil Partnership, Pregnancy and Maternity, Race, Religion or Belief, Sex.

Note: Yelp does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to any recruiting alias or employee. Yelp is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resume"]

industry: Staffing and Recruiting, Retail, and Financial Services
description:
["Job Advert

Is Data your true passion? Are you interested in building segmentation, models and logic to accelerate our customer personalisation capabilities?

Would you enjoy helping to develop a best-in-class direct to customer communications strategy across an omni-channel business?

You will join our Customer Decision Science and Analytics team as part of a newly formed Data Science team. You will help to build solutions aligned to our data science roadmap that enable us to bring insight to life and to deliver measurable ROI through intelligent targeting and testing.

Working closely with internal stakeholders within Strategic Insight, Direct to Customer comms and Paid Media, your work will help bring our customer-centric strategies to life. As Asda moves through a digital transformation, you'll be joining Asda at the right time. Leveraging data and analytics is a critical area of transformation and you would be at the very heart of this!

Your role

As a Customer Data Science Analyst, You Will

You will work as part of Asda's Customer Data Science and Analytics team.
Work on building and productionising Data Science and machine learning products to deliver customer strategies
Work with stakeholders to design experiments that quantify the performance of DS products aligned to business outcomes
Mine and analyse big data sets, leveraging data science skills and techniques to build products that make a difference
Be confident extracting, querying and manipulating data from multiple sources; and working with data engineers to define requirements for data pipelines
Work across a range of projects that could include:
Customer personalisation and targeting (products, offers, promotions)
Customer and store segmentation strategies
Recommendation systems
Behavioural predictions
Lifetime value modelling
About You

We want all colleagues to be able to bring their best and true selves to work, every day. Simply put, we want our colleagues to be Proud to be Asda and proud to be themselves.
Educated to degree level, ideally in a relevant STEM discipline
Naturally curious; passionate about marketing, data and technology
Demonstrable knowledge of some, or all of: SQL, R, Python, Alteryx, Power BI
Experience of applying data science to customer facing outcomes, ideally in a retail / ecommerce environment
Experience of data visualisation and reporting tools
Have a keen attention to detail and accuracy
A creative thinker who develops their own ideas and hypotheses
Have the ability to work well cross-functionally and communicate confidently
Self-motivation to learn and develop in the role
If flexible working is important to you, then look no further! At Asda we are proud of our culture and our commitment to flexible working. This role is based at Asda House, Leeds with the opportunity to work from home 2-3 days per week

You will also get an excellent benefits package including;-
Discretionary company bonus
Company pension up to 7% matched
10% colleague discount, free parking and many additional rewards.
We want all colleagues to be able to bring their best and true selves to work, every day. Simply put, we want our colleagues to be Proud to be Asda and proud to be themselves."]

jobtitle: C# Software Developer - Leeds or home based
industry: Information Technology and Services
description:
['Software Developers - all levels - Leeds or home based (both Full Stack and back end wanted) - £35,000-55,000 + 5% Bonus + 20% Pension

We are seeking C# Developers to join our client in their modern offices close to the centre of Leeds. The organisation has seen considerable growth and developers are required to enhance their products. They will be using .Net Core and Azure, though experience is not essential and training will be provided.

In this role you will to support the organisation in their ambitious IT strategy with commercial experience in developing web applications in C#. The organisation works to agile and devops practices.

*Systems design and specification.(C#, .Net Framework, Visual Studio, SQL)
* .Net Core and Azure would be advantageous though training given
*To produce technical specifications.
*To participate in the use and development of departmental procedures.


Modis International Ltd acts as an employment agency for permanent recruitment and an employment business for the supply of temporary workers in the UK. Modis Europe Ltd provide a variety of international solutions that connect clients to the best talent in the world. For all positions based in Switzerland, Modis Europe Ltd works with its licensed Swiss partner Accurity GmbH to ensure that candidate applications are handled in accordance with Swiss law.


Both Modis International Ltd and Modis Europe Ltd are Equal Opportunities Employers.


By applying for this role your details will be submitted to Modis International Ltd and/ or Modis Europe Ltd. Our Candidate Privacy Information Statement which explains how we will use your information is available on the Modis website.']

industry: Construction, Staffing and Recruiting, and Financial Services
description:
["Hays Technology are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join an award-winning and growing company based in central Leeds. You will need to be proficient in SQL, Data Visualisation and building and optimizing Big Data.

What You Will Be Doing

These are the tasks you undertake on a regular basis which make up your job role in order to deliver the objectives:
Analytical and problem-solving skills.
Communication skills.
Data management.
Data modelling, data cleansing, and data enrichment skills.
Data visualisation.
Logical and creative thinking skills.
Project management skills.
Proven IT and mathematical skills.
Quality assurance, validation and data linkage abilities.
Statistical methods and data analysis skills.
Who You Will Be Working For

You will be working for a growing and award-winning company based near the centre of Leeds. They are a diverse and closely knit team with a number of established customers and partners.

What We Are Looking For

Proficient working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.
Experience building and optimizing ‘big data’ data pipelines, architectures and data sets.
Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.
Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.
Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.
A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large, disconnected datasets.
Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable ‘big data’ data stores.
Strong project management and organizational skills.
Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.

The Following Skills And Experiences Would Also Be Desirable
Certified Data Analyst or Certified Professional
Experience with big data tools: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.
Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases, including Postgres and Cassandra.
Experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools: Azkaban, Luigi, Airflow, etc.
Experience with AWS cloud services: EC2, EMR, RDS, Redshift
Experience with stream-processing systems: Storm, Spark-Streaming, etc.
Education sector experience
Experience/knowledge of Jira Service Management
Proficient Business Systems knowledge (i.e., Jira, Linux, Apache Tomcat, MySQL)
5+ years of experience in a Data Analyst role
Qualified to undergraduate degree level in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field.
What you'll get in return

Our client is offering a competitive salary, company Pension Scheme and 25 Days Holiday in addition to Public Holidays. They are committed to creating a positive environment so in addition to having the opportunity to work flexibly and remotely, they offer company supported training allowance and time off to study alongside a host of personal development opportunities. They engage in regular social activities and wellbeing initiatives.

Please click to apply for this role, we welcome your application!

I am a consultant for Hays Technology, specialising in Data and Business Intelligence for the West Yorkshire region, helping tech professionals develop and progress in their careers and ensuring organisations are supported by the top talent. My passion for this space emanates from ensuring that businesses and organisations can build on strong principles of customer service and delivery and that I personally thrive on delivering for our candidates and clients.

At Hays Technology, we are shaping the future of recruitment. Systems & Database Technical Specialists have never been needed more and finding the best talent for these roles are a top priority. We are talking – all the time- to organisations who actively seeking to improve their use and understanding of data and for the talent to support them. So, whether you are hiring for your team, or looking to take the next step in your cyber career, talk to us today. #4058308"]

industry: Computer Software, Internet, and Marketing and Advertising
description:
['Have you ever wondered what happens under the hood when you hit “Build”? Do you often think of ways to improve code deployment systems? Or have an opinion on what makes a quality acceptance test? If so, you may be the next Core iOS engineer at Yelp.

Yelp’s Core iOS team is part of our Engineering Effectiveness group, responsible for creating and maintaining the infrastructure that facilitates iOS app development. The tools we build and platforms we maintain allow Yelp’s feature teams to focus their time and effort on shipping products that bring value to the company. We see ourselves as infrastructure engineers with a passion for iOS development and empathy for the community of iOS engineers that we support.

If you’re an iOS engineer who’s new to the infrastructure space but eager to learn, we’d love to hear what you could bring to the team.

Where You Come In
Ensure Yelp’s iOS community can leverage Apple’s latest and greatest tools
Support and improve on Yelp’s iOS Jenkins pipelines
Help maintain a high-quality bar for Yelp’s iOS app releases
Keep a pulse on any new technologies that can promote effectiveness in Yelp’s iOS engineering community
Mentor other engineers and share the skills you’ve learned
Continue to learn, grow, and help us take on brand new challenges
What It Takes To Succeed
Willingness to live and work in the United Kingdom
Several years of relevant industry experience
Capable of working independently and comfortable coordinating with peers in North American time zones
An understanding of the iOS platform (e.g., Xcode, Swift)Familiarity or an eagerness to learn the following: Xcode build architecture; the Jenkins CI system; the Carthage dependency management system; UNIX shell, Git-based workflows, and building command-line tools
Strong grasp of software systems design and architecture
What You’ll Get
Full responsibility for projects from day one, an awesome team, and a dynamic work environment
Competitive salary with equity in the company, a pension scheme, and an optional employee stock purchase program
25 days paid holiday initially, rising to 29 with service
Private health insurance, including dental and vision
Flexible working hours and meeting-free Wednesdays
Regular 3-day Hackathons and weekly learning groups, always with interesting topics
£58 per month toward any exercise of your choice
Quarterly offsites
Yelp values diversity. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and consider qualified applicants without regard to Age, Disability, Gender Reassignment, Marriage or Civil Partnership, Pregnancy and Maternity, Race, Religion or Belief, Sex.

Note: Yelp does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to any recruiting alias or employee. Yelp is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resume']

industry: Food & Beverages, Food Production, and Retail
description:
["About The Role

We have an opportunity for a Data Scientist to work within our newly created Data Science team. This is a fantastic opportunity for an early career Data Scientist to help us develop new algorithms and processes that improve the shopping trip for our customer, whilst learning and developing their professional practice. We have a growing team of Data Scientists, with a mix of experience, knowledge and skills, who support and coach each other to continue learning and developing new skills and techniques together.

The Morrisons Data Science group is responsible for building bespoke mathematical models and algorithms to provide valuable insight and predictive analytics to our senior stakeholder group.

The Data Scientist will champion the use of data science for decision making and ensure we are truly engaged with our stakeholders.

What this role will be doing…

Other Responsibilities Will Include

In our Data Science role, you will work as part of a team of Data Scientists and will be responsible for hands-on analysis which will contribute towards the effective delivery of specific projects which will optimise business performance. You will have hands-on data science experience with an ability to present complex information to technical and non-technical audiences in an accessible and concise way, providing clear recommendations that will optimise performance.
Finding patterns in large data sets, including the build of bespoke models which answer specific questions posed by stakeholders
Partake in the development of production ready Python code that enables us to deploy algorithms for use by colleagues and other Morrisons systems
Work closely with colleagues in our reporting teams, to ensure they have the access to the right “models” to answer their questions and support and guidance on when models should be used
Meeting with a variety of stakeholders to discuss data project requirements and taking action from these conversations
Being an advocate and champion for data science, talking about the tools we have available.

About You

So that you are set for success, we are looking for an ambitious individual with excellent communication skills with the ability to influence at all levels. You will work as part of a versatile team who are committed to providing an outstanding service so it's important that you lead by example. You will be a hands-on Data Scientist, committed to building the function's capacity for the future. You will also have:
Data science experience using Python or R; however, be aware that we use Python day to day and this is our language of choice
Statistical modelling, data mining hands-on experience
Knowledge of Machine Learning Techniques and an understanding of how they work
Proven track record in data science with evident experience in a commercial environment (within retail, digital, marketing or e-commerce)
Understanding how data science and predictive analytics can be used to enable better decision making in a large organisation, leading to sustainable and profitable growth
About The Company

What we offer

In return for looking after our customers, we look after our colleagues too
25 days annual leave, plus statutory bank holidays & option to buy an additional 5 days annual leave
4 day working week + occasional Saturdays
Annual bonus plan
Market leading staff discount scheme
Competitive pension scheme & life assurance
Private medical cover
Onsite Staff Shop, Barista Bar, Gym facilities, subsidised canteen
We pride ourselves on being a diverse and inclusive business and are committed to making Morrisons a brilliant place to work, harbouring an environment where our people can thrive.

Treating all colleagues with respect and dignity is the Morrisons way - we celebrate individuality and love different perspectives. It’s what you bring to the table that matters."]

industry: Information Technology and Services, Staffing and Recruiting, and Financial Services
description:
['Our IT Practice Area invest heavily in cutting-edge technology IT is a key part of our success and our clients include many large household name companies.

We are now looking to recruit a Front End Software Developer. There is the option to work flexibly and in the majority from home - however, you will sometimes need to attend our Leeds office to support team development and to meet the needs of our stakeholders.

You Will Need The Skills To

You will be joining a development team with a focus on web application development. As part of the role, you will work alongside designers and developers from other teams to help build consistency into a suite of existing websites. The role covers all aspects of software development such as analysis, design, coding, testing, deployment, support and documentation.
Develop and maintain a library of components to facilitate efficient front-end development across the company
Utilise stylesheets to upgrade the look and feel for existing applications
Continuously improve your knowledge of software, tools and development practices
Gain familiarity with existing sites, develop an understanding of the business context in which the software is used, and identify limitations and areas for improvement
Work with stakeholders directly
Support other developers in their use of front-end technologies
Our Solutions Are Built Primarily On The Microsoft Stack
Languages C#; TypeScript; SQL
Frameworks .Net Framework and .NET Core; ASP.NET; Entity Framework; Angular
Principles Automated testing, build and deployment; cloud and on-prem; SOLID
As a minimum, you will have 2 years’ experience of commercial software development along with GCSE Grade C (4/5) or equivalent in Maths and English. A degree in a technical subject (Maths, Physics, Engineering, Computer Science or similar) is highly desirable.

Core & Flexible Benefits
Competitive discretionary annual bonus
Core benefits paid for by BW including life assurance, group income protection, private medical cover and 25 days holiday per year with holiday trading
A generous pension scheme where we contribute 8% of your salary from day one of your employment
Employee Assistance Programme to support you and your family through any concerns or challenges you may experience
A comprehensive range of voluntary benefits to suit your life stage and lifestyle including a tech scheme, cycle to work scheme, dental cover, healthcare cash plan, health assessments, critical illness cover, extension of private medical cover or life assurance to family members, gym membership, travel insurance and a broad range of discounts at hundreds of retailers including supermarkets, fitness centres, travel and leisure companies
Fresh fruit, hot and cold drinks provided free of charge in all of our offices
Giving Something Back
1 paid volunteering day per year as a commitment to our Corporate Social Investment
Support your favourite charity with the "Give as You Earn" option
Match-funding for individuals raising money for a recognised charity
Our corporate social investment programme is an integral part of what we do and is focused on ensuring that our overall impact is a positive one. We recognise that we have an impact that goes beyond our core activities.
Values our values are PRINCIPLED, RESPECT, QUALITY AND PARTNERSHIP - they are important to us and we want them to be important to you as well.

Wellbeing employee wellbeing has always been important to us and our approach is to create an environment where individuals will be engaged at work, successful in what they do and able to achieve their full potential, benefiting both their self and the business. BW offer a great range of employee benefits as we believe it's important individuals are supported in making choices which are flexible enough to meet their needs and help support their wellness.

Diversity we are committed to having a diverse and inclusive workforce where people from all backgrounds, beliefs and perspectives can thrive, feel welcome and develop to their full potential. Our recruitment processes are designed to be fair and consistent and enable candidates to compete on a level playing field.

Your progression we offer career progression opportunities and a focus on training and professional development to provide you with the tools and skills to thrive. We also offer study support for relevant professional or skills qualifications.

Other activities we have clubs, sporting events, social, cultural and belief groups across our offices if you’d like to join in and meet like-minded people.']

industry: Furniture, Consumer Goods, and Retail
description:
['Join us as a Software Developer (VB/C#.NET) and you’ll become part of the leading kitchen specialist in Europe.

What you’ll be doing

You’ll join a supportive and dedicated Software Development team that provides a bespoke service to our Nobia UK brands.

You’ll be innovative and be able to prototype new ideas quickly to be highly responsive to market and operating requirements. You will develop layers of integration between bespoke and off the shelf solutions along with being able to migrate single-user developed systems to scalable and version control multi-user platforms.

How you will qualify for the role

We would like to hear from you if you are passionate about software development and are experienced in using VB.NET or C#.NET (VB.NET training provided). Microsoft SQL (2012+), MVC & Web Forms, HTML, CSS and JavaScript development.

You will need to have experience working in a similar role.

Knowledge and understanding of Project Management and Agile working would be advantageous.

What you’ll get in return

You’ll discover a rewarding team environment, excellent career and development opportunities, and a competitive salary. Benefits also include pension and life assurance, 23 days holidays rising to 25 with 5 years’ service, discounts with various retailers and a generous colleague discount on our kitchen products

Who are we?

Join us and you’ll be part of more than 15 strong brands including Magnet, Gower and Commodore Kitchens. We make sure our people have room to learn, evolve, and grow their skills.']

industry: Gambling & Casinos
description:
["We’re looking for a dynamic Data Engineer to join one of the most exciting Tribes within Sky Betting and Gaming – the Data Tribe!

Data are the tribe that takes raw information, and puts intelligence in the hands of decision makers. Our teams design and build SBG’s data capabilities, from data warehousing platforms and business reporting, to machine learning and predictive algorithms.

We believe the data we serve will make a difference, and we are on a journey to migrate our data warehouse to the cloud, to unleash more of its vast potential! Our strategy is to migrate from on prem Hadoop platform to Google Cloud Platform utilising their big data tools. We are underway with this project and skills in GCP tooling such as BigQuery, Pub/Sub, Data Flow, Data Proc, Composer as well as GCP accreditation is an advantage.

If you’re the kind of person who embraces challenges and is able help the team to think “outside of the box” to unblock processes, you would be an ideal fit for this role.


What you'll do

Responsibilities as a Data Engineer include...

Deliver outstanding software solutions, which are secure, appropriately tested, perform well, and help provide an engaging customer experience
Actively improve your engineering skills growing your mastery level of our stack
Play a proactive part in owning your team’s services; taking ownership for support, monitoring, measuring performance and addressing technical issues when required
Contribute enthusiastically to our continuous improvement of coding practices, application quality, tooling and agile processes
Continuously evaluate team’s processes and procedures to maintain a positive and efficient engineering culture
Directly contribute to the design and code of the data pipelines operating on secure, production data
Contribute to the end-to-end design and implementation of common components that improve our ability to write efficient and reliable data pipelines
Build and maintain quality technical documentation for any software you have developed, ensuring maintainability, readability and test-ability
Conduct code reviews, pair programming and knowledge sharing sessions, embracing feedback at every step
Involve yourself in code deployments, including raising and completing change requests to deploy to production
Help grow the engineering team’s community presence through contributing to conferences, meetups, blog posts and open-source projects


How you'll do it

Collaboration is a key part of working at Sky Betting and Gaming. The ideal candidate will thrive in this environment, supporting their colleagues in their weaker areas and in return, we'll nurture you with your development goals! You should also...

Demonstrate experience of working with and designing a platform, implementing best practices around data processing on an industrial scale
Show your ability to deliver on projects of varied complexity across multiple SBG domains
Have strong software development skills (particularly in Scala) in an object oriented and/or functional design, coding, and testing patterns, detailing in a clear and concise manner
Demonstrate solid knowledge of data modelling, including data lakes and warehousing tools and techniques
Have hands-on experience with ingesting and processing streamed data (e.g. RabbitMQ, Kafka, PubSub etc.) and data flow orchestration (Data Flow, Apache NiFi, Airflow, Luigi etc.)
Posses a strong understanding of the SDLC of data products, relevant CI/CD tools (Jenkins, Spinnaker, TeamCity) and containerisation (Docker, Kubernetes, Helm)
Adapt to new technologies and technical challenges, working in a fast-paced, dynamic and agile organisation
Support project delivery with pragmatic estimates and progress tracking
Excellent interpersonal, written communication skills and highly numerate
Be able to learn from mistakes, embodying a “fail fast, succeed faster” mentality


Culture & Benefits
 At Sky Betting & Gaming, we're building and promoting a culture where difference is valued, and everyone can be the best version of themselves. We hire you for you and celebrate individuality. 

Our culture has been recognised for being one of the best in the UK;
 11th Best Place to Work 2021 on Glassdoor 
34th in the Best Companies Best Large Companies to work for list 
Awarded Gold in Mind’s Workplace Wellbeing Index 2020/21
And our CEO Steve Birch (CEO), has been placed #21 on the Top CEOs in the UK list by Glassdoor.

 We help you to live your life better: 

Competitive salary & twice-yearly bonus package 
£1,000 learning fund to help you get better at what you do 
Flexible working opportunities 
16 hours volunteering time per year so you can give back to your local community 
Sky Q ultra-premium package inc. broadband 
Health & Digital Insurance 

And much more, please visit our benefits page for even more amazing benefits: https://www.skybetcareers.com/benefits/ 

We`re open to discussing reduced hours, job sharing and flexible start and finish times. Speak to us about your options and we`ll explore what`s possible."]

jobtitle: Software Developer in Test - JavaScript/NodeJS - 100% Remote
industry: Information Technology and Services, Staffing and Recruiting, and Financial Services
description:
['Software Engineer in Test - JavaScript/NodeJS - 100% Remote

A major client in the media industry are seeking a Software Engineer in Test to join their expanding Agile team. This position can be full time remote but they have offices in Leeds and London so flexibility to get to these offices from time to time may be useful. My client are a SME within a 20,000 person organisation, so there is huge opportunity to grow, and lots of upskilling across the team.

Software Engineer in Test - JavaScript/NodeJS - 100% Remote

A major client in the media industry are seeking a Software Engineer in Test to join their expanding Agile team. This position can be full time remote but they have offices in Leeds and London so flexibility to get to these offices from time to time may be useful. My client are a SME within a 20,000 person organisation, so there is huge opportunity to grow, and lots of up-skilling across the team.

This role would suit a proactive and detail-oriented Software Engineer in Test as you will help develop my client's automated test suite that underpins the delivery of our media supply chain. They have a complex solution built with "off the shelf software" and in-house development. They embrace Ci/CD and DevOps; delivering a cloud native media management solution.

The successful candidate will fulfil a vital part of a Tech and Ops team, utilising prior experience to build upon their automated test tools to migrate systems toward a true Ci/CD cycle.

The kind of experience we would be keen to see:
Is experienced Software Engineer in Test working with Javascript (NodeJS).
Has significant experience in automated software testing
Has good knowledge of SDLC (Software development lifecycle)
Has experience using Cucumber, Gherkin.
Is experienced in using JIRA and Confluence
Has knowledge of quality assurance processes and procedures
Has solid experience of working within agile frameworks
This is a 100% remote role!

If this role sounds like something you would be interested in, please get in contact with Katrina at Oliver James at katrina.rajah @ oliverjames.com or click APPLY to this job advert.']

jobtitle: Junior Software Support Analyst - Data collection
industry: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services
description:
["The Role

We are recruiting for interim Junior Software Support Analysts to join our Data team and accelerate our data collection activities; ensuring the right data is available to combine with risk analysis and other Machine Learning that will enhance the quality of services we provide to our customers. The project will be for a period of 6 weeks initially with the opportunity to extend and for a minimum of 20 hours per week.

The right candidate will have an understanding of a formal programming language and how to read API documentation. You will have a passion to automate manual business workflows & increase resilience and scalability of our service.

As our Junior Software Support Analyst you will be responsible for gathering and prioritising data collection requirements, implementing collection using existing CRISP technology and ensuring the data meets customer need and drives value.

You will work closely with onboarding teams, CRISP solution architects, the wider data team, account managers and analysts to ensure the requirements are fit for purpose and deliver value.

This role is suitable for a graduate / junior and will work closely with our data team and Solutions Engineers to learn on the job.

Duties will include
Gathering and prioritising data collection requirements from across CRISP.
Working closely with the onboarding team and Product team to align customer data collection requirements across various technologies.
Working closely with the data ontology team to ensure the collection is integrated with the CRISP data architecture
Working closely with the risk detection, machine learning and data science teams to ensure effective exploitation of the data, aligned to customer requirements.
Configuring SaaS based solutions accurately in line with specifications.
Produces solution design documents from customer facing workflows
Ensures project documentation is complete, current and appropriately stored
Follows robust quality assurance processes to ensure accuracy of implementation
Peer reviews other team members work as part of the quality assurance process
Proactively identifies opportunities to streamline the solutions engineering team’s processes
Works closely with the Programme Manager and internal customer facing teams to communicate progress of new implementations and change orders
Establish successful working relationships with all key personnel
Be a pro-active, productive and positive team member
Maintain and develop a professional approach to all aspects of the job and at all times uphold the image of Crisp Thinking
Requirements

Qualifications, training and experience required
Essential A minimum 2 1 in a technical / computer science degree or equivalent technical experience
Knowledge of XPATH to extract data
Experience of JSON, APIs and programming language.
Experience in learning and using bespoke software
Excellent communication skills.
Desirable Any industry experience gained within a technical environment would be an advantage
Key Personal Characteristic
Attention to detail
Ability to work under pressure and to client deadlines
Strong will to automate and streamline repetitive tasks
Strong logical thinking and problem-solving skills
Professional and organised
Ability to multi-task across multiple concurrent projects
Able to adapt technical skills in a rapidly changing environment
Ability to prioritise a busy workload
Professional and positive approach
Self-motivated and self sufficient
Good technical ability
Excellent communication skills
Team player
Benefits

Our rewards are as unique as our culture, and we want to attract the best people and retain them. Not only will we ensure that your development is key, but you will be joining a fantastic team of like-minded people who work together as one team to achieve a shared vision.
Market competitive salary based on your skills and experience.
33 days holiday including Bank Holidays (pro-rated for hours worked)
Employee perks schemes offering discounts, rewards, giveaways and more.
Mental health wellbeing portal and access to an in-house clinical psychologist.
Support and provision of supplies to facilitate home working.
Flexible working opportunities.
About CRISP

Crisp provides 24/7/365 early-warning risk intelligence as a service for leading brands, global enterprises and social media platforms, providing customers with a real-time risk defence, with intelligence and compliance solutions guaranteed to ensure our customers are always the first to know and act.

These risks can take many forms, including activist attacks, hate speech, threats, fake news, false rumours, illegal content, compliance failures and many more.

Fuelled by the increased popularity of closed social media groups and messaging apps, this harmful content can now spread virally, at scale before it reaches mainstream media channels. Unfortunately, anyone has the power to create and share harmful content, especially instigators and influencers who distribute millions of new types every day.

Statement

'This work meets the requirements in respect of exempted questions under the Rehabilitation of Offenders Act 1974, any applicants who are offered work for this organisation will be subject to an enhanced check from the Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS). This will include details of cautions, reprimands or final warnings as well as convictions. A criminal record will not automatically bar a person from successfully taking up this post."]

industry: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet
description:
["At Couchbase, big things happen. Every day, we’re translating vision into reality by tackling new and exciting challenges head-on. This is a breakthrough stage in our company, where the enthusiasm of our employees and leadership team is infectious and growing. You’ll have the opportunity to learn new skills, grow your career, and work with the smartest, most passionate people in the industry.

You are a Software Engineer responsible for building and managing cloud-native applications across multiple clouds. In this role, you will develop, implement, and operate Couchbase's Cloud products. If you have experience developing applications using Go programming language (or willingness to learn) along with experience with either the three major cloud platforms- AWS, Azure, GCP, we'd love to have you apply.

Here's a brief look at what success looks like in this role:
In 3 months time- you'll have collaborated with the team to build and shipped a material contribution such as a new feature, regularly contributed to code reviews, and fixed a few bugs.
In 6 months time- you'll have earned the trust of the team and taken on independent code review responsibilities that help prevent bugs that are collaborating on the design of new features.
In 12 months time- you'll have delivered tasks throughout the SDLC, from design through development with some guidance and have established a cadence of on-time deliver with high quality work.
This role is also open to remote work as our teams are globally distributed. We are a remote-first team.

Responsibilities
Design, develop, test, deploy, document, maintain and improve software
Manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables
Build and expand our APIs and services, written in Go
Collaborate with other engineers across the stack to deliver delightful user experiences
Monitor, troubleshoot, and improve system security, stability, reliability, and performance
Define and implement SLIs and monitor and improve SLOs
Write various kinds of tests including unit and integration tests
Smartly instrument software using techniques such as distributed tracing and logging
Write and review technical proposals
Improve engineering standards, tooling, and processes
Document systems, build runbooks, and automate those processes
Key technologies this role will employ: Go (Golang), Kubernetes, AWS, Azure, GCP, Grafana, Prometheus, Alert Manager, Thanos, Terraform, Vault, Couchbase Server, Datadog
Qualifications
You care deeply about software quality and operability, and better ways of building software
You are able to knowledgeably discuss performance, security, and user interactions within complex systems
You desire to write software that is sympathetic to the humans who will maintain it
You love to write Go, more Go, and then a little more Go
You enjoy giving and receiving code reviews
You are kind and collaborative
You enjoy working remote with people from all over the world
Value clear, open communication
We value thoughtful feedback and regular dialogue and collaboration as a fundamental skill for our team members
About Couchbase

At Couchbase, we believe data is at the heart of the enterprise. We empower developers and architects to build, deploy, and run their most mission-critical applications. Couchbase delivers a high-performance, flexible and scalable modern database that runs across the data center and any cloud. Many of the world’s largest enterprises rely on Couchbase to power the core applications their businesses depend on.

As a 2021 Bay Area Best Places to Work winner, Couchbase recognizes the need for time off when you need it. Enjoy unlimited time off (DTO), matching 401K contributions, ESPP and many other amazing benefits . See more of our recent awards to learn what makes Couchbase such a great company to work at.

Learn More About Couchbase And Our Technical Capabilities
Compare Couchbase vs. MongoDB
Compare Couchbase vs. Oracle
Browse the Developer Portal
Couchbase is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law."]

industry: Construction, Staffing and Recruiting, and Financial Services
description:
['Hays Technology is looking for a Systems and Database Technical Specialist to help our large public sector client in the Wakefield area to assist the existing team with a high-profile data project.

What you will be doing: You will be taking responsibility for the trust systems and database administration and 2nd line support. You will be responsible for application security and will support the provision of information security and database services adopting ITIL, best practices across Change, Problem Capacity and Availability Management. You will also investigate complex technical issues and enquiries providing assistance and advice as required.

Who You Will Be Working For

Our client is a large public sector employer and has a large presence both in Wakefield and the wider Yorkshire region. They are becoming increasingly more aware of the importance of data and how it is used to improve the experience of service users.

Degree in computer science/ business IT or equivalent industry experience
Knowledge of Microsoft SQL
Previous experience of working in a system and data base administration.
evidence of systems and database continuity planning and testing.
Evidence of reviewing, documenting and administering a variety of applications.

Able to provide and receive highly complex sensitive and contentious information; agreement or co-operation required; present complex, sensitive or contentious information to large groups.
