To find out more and explore this opportunity further, please apply and feel free to contact Jon MacDonald on 0113 323 9746.

We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.']

industry: Telecommunications
description:
["Our mission is to break down the barriers of today to release the potential of tomorrow. Join us today and release yours.

About This Role

Imagine a job which gives you an opportunity to have a positive impact in the economy.

We are radically changing the way how we view and use data. We produce petabytes a day, gathered from network usage to our 1000s of engineers building and maintaining networks every day.

To ensure that we provide a service to our customers that is right ‘First Time, Every Time, On Time’ we are focusing on a customer centric data revolution. This means our goal is to become an insight enabled organisation, through data-driven transformation. Fuelled by the democratisation of data, empowering our people through dedicated data literacy programmes, all underpinned by high quality analytics & data management using the latest data technology and innovative delivery methods.

You will be central to our transformation in data.

You'll Have The Following Responsibilities
Responsibility for the development, delivery and maintenance of key data sets that are then used across the business for reporting, analysis, predictive modelling, decisioning.
Provide expertise as the subject matter expert (SME) for data areas, owning associated data models, or support the capability and management of tools that are used across the data and digital community.
Ensure that the data sets delivered and maintained are of high quality and accuracy.
Ensure that any deliveries are thoroughly tested and signed off before providing to end customers.
Simplify the delivery of data management tasks by stripping out complexity, duplication and manual delivery.
Ensure fit for purpose documentation is maintained for the data assets and processing to aid control and knowledge sharing.
Uphold and advocate best practice policies and principles for data development and management.
Proactively manage the data dictionary that documents the sources of data currently available.
You'll Have The Following Skills & Experience
B.S. or M.S. in a relevant technical field with data analytics as a key competence.
2-4+ years’ work experience as a Business Analyst, preferred if related to Data Analytics or IT projects.
Be proficient, and have extensive experience, with an industry recognised data wrangling platform.
Experience in working in Agile environment – you understand the importance of continuous, iterative delivery of value, plus the tools and techniques to facilitate this. Agile certification is preferred.
Able to demonstrate a value-centric approach to work, driven by delivering measurable value to stakeholders.
Strong SQL and analytical skills, and experience of working with data driven teams.
Lean black belt certified is a plus as some projects will focus on E2E process efficiencies and lean process re-engineering.
Benefits

As well as offering a competitive base salary, you’ll also have a rewarding bonus scheme, access to equity schemes and an attractive pension offer.

We value different perspectives, skills and experiences. Diversity makes sense for us, our customers and our ambitions. We’re creating an inclusive working culture where people from all backgrounds can succeed. That’s why we welcome applications from all parts of the community.

About Openreach

Openreach Limited runs the nation’s digital network. We play a key role in British society, helping homes, schools, hospitals, broadcasters, government, businesses and more connect to the world.

We're a wholly owned subsidiary of BT Group, and our customers are the 640+ communications providers who sell phone, broadband and Ethernet services to homes and businesses. And we’re on a mission - to make the country’s digital network services faster, better and more affordable.

Our people are experienced, resourceful and innovative, working on vital projects that help support the nation at work, in learning, on the move, at rest, at play, in emergencies and much more.

So if you’d like to be a part of an exciting organisation that’s making a real difference, why not join us today? You can read more here about working at Openreach.

How To Apply

It's easy to apply online; you just need a copy of your up-to-date CV and to follow the step-by step process. Don't worry if you need to make changes - you'll have the opportunity to review and edit your work on the final page. We look forward to receiving your application!

#DataandAnalytics

Job function

Business Analysis and Planning

Main location

UK & Ireland-United Kingdom-West Midlands-Birmingham

Other Locations

UK & Ireland-United Kingdom-Suffolk-Ipswich, UK & Ireland-United Kingdom-West Yorkshire-Leeds

Schedule

Full-time

Working pattern

Standard

Salary

Up to £45,000 (plus benefits)

Closing date

Sep 23, 2021, 4:29:00 AM"]

jobtitle: Senior Data Engineer, Sky Betting & Gaming
industry: Civil Engineering, Mechanical or Industrial Engineering, and Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing
description:
["Sky Betting & Gaming

We're on the lookout for a Senior Data Engineer to become part of our Data Tribe. It's an exciting time to say you're part of Data, especially with all of the fantastic projects feeding into our migration over to Google Cloud Platform.

If you're looking for the freedom and flexibility to be your very best self, working in collaboration and learning from great people, then Data is the place for you!

The ideal candidate will be someone who actively looks to improve their engineering skills to become an expert in their tech stack! They will embrace challenges, particularly when they offer the potential to create significant impact or value to the team.

As a Senior Data Engineer, you will...
Deliver first-class software solutions, which are secure, appropriately tested, perform well, and help provide an engaging customer experience
Play a proactive part in owning your team's services; taking responsibility for support, monitoring, measuring performance and addressing technical issues when required
Contribute enthusiastically to our continuous improvement of coding practices, application quality, tooling and agile processes
Communicate constructively with peers, seniors and stakeholders in all settings
Directly contribute to the design and code of the data pipelines operating on secure, production data
Contribute to the end-to-end design and implementation of common components that improve our ability to write efficient and reliable data pipelines
Endeavour to become an expert with at least one area or domain of the code/product
Create and maintain quality technical documentation for any software you have developed, ensuring maintainability, readability and testability
Conduct code reviews, pair programming and knowledge sharing sessions, embracing feedback at every step
Involve yourself in code deployments, including raising and completing change requests to deploy to production
Help grow the engineering team's community presence through contributing to conferences, meetups, blog posts, open source projects)
Continuously evaluate the team's processes and procedures to maintain a positive and efficient engineering culture
Mentor other engineers (including peers) in your areas of specialism, helping them to work through their challenges
Take ownership and lead substantial units of work, from inception through to production
Identify and champion resolution of technical debt in the services you own
Lead on the release of code to production and demonstrate ownership of the CI platform
We're looking for someone who will think “outside of the box” to unblock yourself and other members of the Squad when challenges arise. They will be the bridge that helps your Squad engage with others, across the Tribe and the wider business as a whole.

Ideally, they will have strong software development skills in an object oriented and/or functional programming language (ideally in Scala).

Other qualities we expect from a Senior Data Engineer include...
Demonstrable experience of working with and designing a platform, implementing best practices around data processing on an industrial scale
Ability to deliver on projects of varied complexity across multiple SBG domains
Solid knowledge of data modelling principles, including data lakes and warehousing tools and techniques
Hands-on experience with ingesting and processing streamed data (e.g. RabbitMQ, Kafka, PubSub etc.) and data flow orchestration (Data Flow, Apache NiFi, Airflow, Luigi etc.)
Strong understanding of the SDLC of data products, relevant CI/CD tools (Jenkins, Spinnaker, TeamCity) and containerisation (Docker, Kubernetes, Helm)
Adapt to new technologies and technical challenges, working in a fast-paced, dynamic and agile organisation
Support project delivery with pragmatic estimates and progress tracking
Work collaboratively and support colleagues with areas of weakness
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and highly numerate
Able to learn from mistakes, embodying a “fail fast, succeed faster” mentality
See things from a range of perspectives, taking onboard the ideas of others but knowing when to be decisive
We're looking for someone who will think “outside of the box” to unblock yourself and other members of the Squad when challenges arise. They will be the bridge that helps your Squad engage with others, across the Tribe and the wider business as a whole.

Ideally, they will have strong software development skills in an object oriented and/or functional programming language (ideally in Scala).

Other qualities we expect from a Senior Data Engineer include...
Demonstrable experience of working with and designing a platform, implementing best practices around data processing on an industrial scale
Ability to deliver on projects of varied complexity across multiple SBG domains
Solid knowledge of data modelling principles, including data lakes and warehousing tools and techniques
Hands-on experience with ingesting and processing streamed data (e.g. RabbitMQ, Kafka, PubSub etc.) and data flow orchestration (Data Flow, Apache NiFi, Airflow, Luigi etc.)
Strong understanding of the SDLC of data products, relevant CI/CD tools (Jenkins, Spinnaker, TeamCity) and containerisation (Docker, Kubernetes, Helm)
Adapt to new technologies and technical challenges, working in a fast-paced, dynamic and agile organisation
Support project delivery with pragmatic estimates and progress tracking
Work collaboratively and support colleagues with areas of weakness
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and highly numerate
Able to learn from mistakes, embodying a “fail fast, succeed faster” mentality
See things from a range of perspectives, taking onboard the ideas of others but knowing when to be decisive"]

industry: Information Technology and Services, Staffing and Recruiting, and Financial Services
description:
["DWP. Digital with Purpose.

DWP is the UK's largest government department. We help people into work, and make payments worth over £195bn a year to support some of the most vulnerable people in our society.

We are looking for a Data Engineer to work with us on the design, development and deployment of innovative data products that will help to protect millions of vulnerable UK citizens against the risks of fraud and error.

You'll join our community of tech experts in DWP Digital. We're driving a once-in-a-generation transformation of government services, using fresh ideas and leading-edge technologies to create innovative, scalable and user-centric digital solutions.

The DWP products and services we maintain and modernise will be used by nearly every person in the UK, at key moments in their lives. The scale of what we do is extraordinary, and our scale and purpose is unique. We'd love you to join us.

Delivery. Work. Projects.

As a Data Engineer you'll be an integral part of the design and development of innovative data products, gathering, interrogating and drawing insight from complex data sets, utilising cloud platforms to deploy products that have a positive impact of our most vulnerable citizens. Joining our Integrated Risk and Intelligence Service (IRIS), you'll be working on projects that will help protect DWP users from the risks of fraud and error, using your experience in data solution innovation, data staging & modelling, cloud platform utilisation, rapid prototyping and ETL process design.

What skills, knowledge and experience will you need?
Designs, develops. codes, tests, corrects and documents simple programs or scripts under the direction of others.
Understands core technical concepts related to their role and is able to apply them.
Aware of the need to translate technical concepts into non-technical language and understands what communication is required to internal and external stakeholders.
Technical Specialisms - Programming Languages - Experience in one or more programming languages eg: SQL, HIVE SQL, Spark SQL, Python, Shell / BASH.
Experience of developing automated ETL / ELT pipelines (error handling, re-start, data quality, telemetry).
Experience of version control and modern deployment approaches.
Details. Wages. Perks.

You'll join us in one of our brilliant digital hubs in Blackpool, Leeds, Newcastle or Sheffield.

We also have all the tools and tech we need to enable our people to work flexibly, and many of us are working remotely at the moment due to COVID-19.

In return for your skills, we offer a competitive salary of up to £40,666 a brilliant civil service pension with employer contributions worth over 27%, and a generous leave package starting at 24 days.

We also have a broad benefits package built around your work-life balance which includes:
Flexible working, flexi hours and flexi days
Hybrid working: some time in a hub with the team, some time at home
Family-friendly policies
Time off volunteering and charitable giving
Bring your authentic self to work with 'I Can Be Me in DWP'
Discounts and savings on shopping, fun days out and more
Interest-free loans to buy a bike or a season ticket, so it's even easier for you to get to work and start making a difference
Sports and social activities
Working in an award-winning environment and culture
Professional development, coaching, mentoring and career progression opportunities.
CLICK APPLY for more information and to start your application."]

jobtitle: Energy and Climate Data Analyst, CLIMATE 17
industry: Environmental Services, Renewables & Environment, and Oil & Energy
description:
['CLIMATE 17

Our client is an independent energy & climate company who use data to drive down carbon emissions from electricity generation and phase-out coal. They gather, curate, and analyse data on the global power system – and use findings to improve energy and climate policy. Due to their sustained growth plans, they are now looking for an Energy and Climate Data Analyst who will be eager to part of an innovative team.

The new energy and climate data analyst will sit within the fossil fuels unit of the European team, reporting to the senior analyst who leads the unit. The work will primarily focus on accelerating the phase-out of fossil fuels in the European electricity sector and eliminating government subsidies for fossil fuel power. In doing so you will be helping to deliver the vision of a zero-carbon electricity system in the 2030s.

Responsibilities
Gather, curate, and analyse data on the European electricity and energy system.
Tell powerful data stories relevant to climate change which reach, inform, and challenge decision-makers. To do so, you will use a wide range of outputs including: blogs, briefings, reports, social media, and data visualisations. As well as presentations, webinars, and meetings with key stakeholders.
Proactively seek out new data sources and analysis techniques that can support climate campaigning in the power sector and develop innovative ways to communicate them.
Work collaboratively and build a wide network with European partners to share data, ideas, analysis & expertise.
Become our client’s focal point and expert on advocacy-relevant data on Europe’s fossil fuel power stations.
Key Skills And Experience
Passionate about using data to tackle climate change.
4+ years of experience in a relevant analytical role.
Skill for communicating the key insights from large datasets in an accessible way.
Solid understanding of energy & climate issues.
High proficiency in using analytical packages in R, Python or similar.
Ability to conduct independent research and get to grips with new concepts quickly.
A positive, flexible, can-do attitude, coupled with self-motivation and the ability to work independently.
Strong communication skills – written and oral. Excellent command of the English language.
Ability to develop and maintain networks.
Ability to work in a dynamic, fast paced environment.
Business proficiency in one additional European language other than English.
Deep understanding of the European electricity system and related climate issues.
Previous experience in a campaigning or policy environment.
Experience developing advanced data visualisations.
Experience using data to tell a story.
An established network in the energy & climate space.
About Us

Climate17 are recruitment specialists across Clean Energy & Environmental markets. Our extensive experience, expert market knowledge and passion for what we do stand us apart.']

industry: Consumer Goods
description:
['SQL / C# Developer - Permanent (Leeds)

An exciting opportunity has arisen due to continued growth within our organisation. We are now looking to expand our team with the addition of an SQL / C# Developer. This role will be working in as part of small but high-performance development team. You will be a self-starter, responsible, focused and capable of working at pace and under your own initiative. Capable of leading projects and overcome issues with a resourceful solution-centric approach.

Key accountabilities
Design, implementation and maintenance of SQL databases.
Develop and support eCommerce integrations in pursuit of progress/results.
Support and maintenance of existing systems/applications/interfaces.
To define, plan and manage releases of application updates.
Essential Skills & Experience
Experienced in writing SQL, T-SQL code and C#
Experience working with cloud and Azure environments.
Good MS SQL database design skills including normalisation and constraints
Experience with T-SQL (Transact SQL) stored procedures, triggers and database constraints (MS SQL Server 2008 R2, 2012, 2014, 2016)
Experience using SQL server management studio
Design, development and support experience in a highly transactional environment.
Working with 3rd party providers, Integration documentation and API’s.
Creation of appropriate documentation / records SQL developments solutions, such that others can understand and maintain code/solutions effectively.
Desirable
Experience with high volume B2B and B2C FMCG environments.
Experience of coding with object orientated languages (C# preferable).
Experience using Visual Studio & Postman
Proven Knowledge of the Microsoft stack - SSIS, SSRS, SSAS
Commercial experience developing within the BI Stack
Database design and optimisation experience
What We Offer
Permanent contract of employment
Benefits including bonus, and private medical cover
Open plan modern office
25 days of holiday allowance + bank holidays
Great working environment & supportive company culture
Free coffee, tea & fresh fruit
SharkNinja Is committed to safeguarding the privacy of individuals. Our Data Privacy Statement outlines how we will process your personal data when you apply for a role at SharkNinja or are engaged in services with one of our entities; https://www.sharkninja.com/employment-privacy-notice/

SharkNinja operates Preferred Supplier (PS) arrangements for all permanent, contract and temporary recruitment across all UK functions. As such, we would ask that agencies refrain from making contact with any of our SharkNinja colleagues and that no CVs are submitted to staff across the Business. Any unsolicited CVs and/or communications will reflect unfavourably on any potential opportunities for your agency. Any CVs will be sent at your own risk and will be interpreted as ‘gifts’ and we will reserve the right to engage with candidates directly having not, in any way, entered into your company’s Terms and Conditions of Contract. If you would like to be considered for Preferred Supplier status, please send a brief introduction to your business to llee@Sharkninja.com , clearly stating in the header of your email your company name and the discipline(s) that you specialise in. Your email will then be kept on file for consideration should we review our incumbent Preferred Suppliers. Thank you for your interest and co-operation.

At SharkNinja, our purpose is to positively impact people’s lives every day in every home around the world! We work very hard to provide our consumers with high quality, exciting 5-star products that make life easier. We thrive on passion and innovation, and are looking for great people, with great ideas, who want to build the next big thing and develop while they do. At SharkNinja, Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion is vital to our global success. Valuing each unique voice and blending all of our diverse skills strengthens SharkNinja’s innovation every day. We support ALL of our associates in bringing their authentic selves to work, making an impact, and having the opportunity for career acceleration. With help from our leadership, associates, and our community, we aim to have equity be a key component of the SharkNinja DNA.']

industry: Pharmaceuticals
description:
['We are recruiting for a STEM university or college graduate to join our team! If you have a passion for data sciences and the healthcare industry and want to kick start your career in an innovative global organisations - apply today!

Interface Clinical Services, an IQVIA business are the largest organisation within the UK healthcare sector to fully employ a team of pharmacists. Working nationally, we operate in partnership with both the NHS and healthcare industry.

The team are responsible for the delivery of remote services and working with all relevant stakeholders for the delivery of services which contain remote or technological element(s). With a focus on driving service excellence, the technician will ensure that the end product is continually improving in quality and delivered to the customer with a high degree of professionalism.

LOCATION:


Head Office (Leeds)

PRINCIPLE RESPONSIBILITIES:


Working Together
To liaise with GPs and/or Practice Managers who receive a relevant service from the company, ensuring services and their associated tools are delivered in a timely fashion.
To liaise with and develop effective working relationships with all Interface staff, particularly the head office Sales and Commercial team and in the support of the field-based pharmacists.
To communicate and liaise with several different customers/stakeholders taking into consideration their varying priorities.
To set and maintain the highest levels of professional conduct whist representing the company.

Delivering Results
To drive high quality service delivery.
Awareness of potential new and repeat services to customers, whether chargeable or free at the point of delivery, to be passed to the sales team for conversion
Confident and professional phone conversations
To work to KPI’s and targets, reporting successes and challenges to management at regular intervals.
To ensure efficient time management.
Achieve agreed service delivery targets and outcomes within schedule

Strategic Thinking
To act in a reliable and professional manner always and fulfil any other duties which may be required to benefit the company.
Co-ordinate work streams with team members and other departments, principally the Sales and Commercial department.
Keep up to date with clinical system functionality
Maintain and develop technical skills
Keep abreast of clinical and commercial activity within the NHS that may be drivers for the uptake of Interface services.

Professional Skills
To communicate information in a range of written and verbal formats to clinical, non-clinical, IT literate and non-computer competent audiences
To complete and record all personal continual professional development, in areas relevant to the services offered and relevant technical skills.
Continuously improve through feedback
To develop and maintain CLIICS as a CRM system by effective usage and reporting suggestions for improvement.

Required Skills & Experience
University or college graduate from an IT, business or Life Sciences discipline OR an apprentice with an IT/data analysis background.
Competent using Excel and analysing large and complex data sets.
Excellent stakeholder skills.
Ability to work on own initiative.
High attention to detail.
Competent in the use of Microsoft Office, to deliver professional client communications including Word, PowerPoint and Excel.

Benefits include:

25 days holiday
Private healthcare
Cycle to work scheme
Season ticket loan
Company pension plan
And many more!

At IQVIA, we believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. The advanced analytics, technology solutions and contract research services we provide to the life sciences industry are made possible by our 70,000+ employees around the world who apply their insight, curiosity and intellectual courage every step of the way. Learn more at jobs.iqvia.com.']

industry: Furniture, Consumer Goods, and Retail
description:
['Join us as a Data Analyst and you’ll become part of the Magnet family.

What you’ll be doing

Working closely with our Head of Data & Analytics, you will support our Commercial team (including Range Management, Digital and Marketing) by providing vital reports and analysis so that decisions are well informed and data-led.

You’ll manipulate data to produce and distribute reports on a weekly and monthly basis, examples of reports you’ll be producing are range sales reports, product penetration reports and website conversion reports. You’ll be expected to think outside the box and challenge and make recommendations from your analysis.

How you qualify for the role

You’ll have an analytical mindset with excellent Microsoft skills including excel and able to turn data and reports into a creative and simple way. As you will be communicating with different areas of our business, you’ll have strong communication skills with the capability of making commercial recommendations. You will naturally like to solve problems and have a good eye for detail.

We are in the process of implementing a data visualisation tool called Tableau (which you will be involved with) – experience with this or something similar would be beneficial.

What you’ll get in return

You’ll discover a rewarding team environment, excellent career and development opportunities, and a competitive salary. Benefits also include pension and life assurance, 23 days holidays rising to 25 after five years’ service, discounts with various retailers and a generous colleague discount on our kitchen products.

Who we are

With over 200 stores we are the UK’s largest kitchen retailer and while our focus is on creating the perfect kitchen, our true passion is design. As part of Nobia , Europe’s leading kitchen specialist, we’re lucky enough to have access to the very best design expertise in the industry, ensuring our kitchens are always on-trend and built for whatever life throws at them.']

industry: Staffing and Recruiting
description:
["Python Software Engineer (Junior to Mid)

Fast-growth MarketingTech Scale-up

Fully Remote Working Offered

£35,000 - £55,000

I am currently partnered with a fast-growth MarTech scale-up that helps retailers get ahead of their competition and increase revenue in the online shopping world, and they are now looking for multiple Python Engineers to join their team.

They can offer you a fully remote working role within an autonomous, relaxed, and anti-micro management team. This gives you the freedom to pick and choose the parts from many methodologies that work for you rather than following a specific way, which can't work equally with every individual. You'll also receive ongoing training and development throughout your career.

They have done incredibly well since being founded 3 years ago, achieving 100% year on year growth 2 years running. On top of this, they are also well-funded as they are backed by very well-respected investors including the Founder of one of the UK's leading travel-tech companies.

Their tech stack includes: Python, PostgresSQL, Airflow 2.0, AWS, Terraform, Gitlab, Wrike

What You'll Be Doing
Working closely with the Engineering team and PhD level researchers to identify, design and deliver data pipelines
Implementing scalable ML models
Building and maintaining APIs
Contributing ideas to new product releases and general approaches to work
What They Need From You
Good experience working with Python, Postgres and AWS
A highly focused and self-disciplined attitude, as the team have a big focus on autonomy / no micro-management
Keen interest in working with the latest technology
Background designing ETL and data warehousing solutions
What They Can Offer You
Fully remote working
Collaborative and autonomous work environment
Weekend trips away in Europe
Company events and social hours
Training and Development opportunities
If the above sounds interesting and you're keen to find out more, please apply to this job advert."]

industry: Staffing and Recruiting
description:
['Position: C++ Software Engineer
Salary: £40,000 - £60,000

These projects are truly unique and will set the industry standard moving forward. They are happy for people to take on this role on a remote basis and also happy to welcome people to one of their state-of-the-art offices if preferred.
 The successful Software Engineer will be joining a team design environment so strong communication skills and the ability to work closely with other engineers is crucial. industry: Computer Software, Internet, and Marketing and Advertising
description:
["Interested in exploring data and finding innovative ways to collect, curate, and make it easily accessible for others to use? How about doing that at scale? Yelp’s unique dataset contains billions of interactions between users and local businesses around the globe. Does working with such a vast amount of data sound exciting? Come and join us!

As a Data Engineer in the Data and Analytics Platform team at Yelp you will be responsible for building elegant and scalable data products that serve critical, up-to-date, structured information to support different types of analytics within Yelp. As a core contributor to our burgeoning data engineering efforts, you'll design and own mission-critical data pipelines to enable decision-making, all the way from enabling effective A/B testing to reporting public metrics to the Street.

Yelp engineering culture is driven by our values: we’re a cooperative team that values individual authenticity and encourages “unboring” solutions to problems. We enable all new team members to get their hands dirty in working code in their initial weeks and let them grow from there with the support of their manager, mentor, and team. At the end of the day, we’re all about helping our users, growing as engineers and scientists, and having fun in a collaborative environment.

We’d love to have you apply, even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement in this posting. At Yelp, we’re looking for great people, not just those who simply check off all the boxes.

Where You Come In
Collaborate cross functionally with other engineers and product managers to develop impactful data products.
Contribute towards improving Yelp’s internal data processing tools and frameworks.
Build effective and efficient data models optimized for top level reports and storage.
Automate and abstract data processes to enable interoperability on different platforms and systems.
Explore emerging trends and new technologies to continue to improve Yelp’s data engineering capabilities.
Manage and support infrastructure-as-code with frameworks such as Terraform.
What It Takes To Succeed
Based or willing to relocate the United Kingdom
A deep understanding of programming languages and the systems you've worked on.
Hands-on experience with Cloud Data Warehouse (Snowflake or Redshift) and Big Data technologies (e.g S3, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Flink, Kafka etc).
Passion for architecting large distributed systems with elegant interfaces that can scale easily.
Experience in areas relevant to data engineering, including data management, custom ETL design and data modeling.
As a bonus, familiarity or hands on experience with ETL tools like Informatica, Snaplogic, Fivetran.
A hunger for tracking down root causes—no matter how deep it takes you—and fixing them in systematic ways.
Proficiency with at least one object oriented programming language.
What You’ll Get
Full responsibility for projects from day one, an awesome team, and a dynamic work environment
Competitive salary with equity in the company, a pension scheme, and an optional employee stock purchase program
25 days paid holiday initially (rising to 29 with service), plus one floating holiday
Private health insurance, including dental and vision
Flexible working hours and meeting-free Wednesdays
Regular 3-day Hackathons and weekly learning groups, always with interesting topics
Opportunities to participate in digital events and conferences
£58 per month toward any wellness activity of your choice
Quarterly team offsites
Yelp values diversity. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and consider qualified applicants without regard to Age, Disability, Gender Reassignment, Marriage or Civil Partnership, Pregnancy and Maternity, Race, Religion or Belief, Sex.

Note: Yelp does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to any recruiting alias or employee. Yelp is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resume"]

industry: Information Technology and Services, Staffing and Recruiting, and Financial Services
description:
['Here at Capita we are on the lookout for a number of Software Engineers/Developer to help support with a spike in demand over an initial 6 month period .

Ideally located in Birmingham or Glasgow however the role will be remote/homeworking with a need to travel to Birmingham or Glasgow as and when business requires.

Salary: Upto £55,000 DOE

Candidates should be able to show a track record of picking up new skills and systems and the ability to work across a wide range of systems and technologies.

Job Title

Software Engineer/Developer

Job Description

In this role we are looking for individuals to deliver, support and maintain quality software solutions to the business across a range of environments and technologies. You will also assist in the co-ordination of work and provide BAU prod support to fix or assist in the resolution of complex or high severity problems in a timely manner.

What You’ll Be Doing
Use functional documents and high-level designs to produce signed off Detailed Technical Specs subjected to full review process.
Fix or assist in the fix of complex or high severity problems in a timely manner, labelling code correctly and closing Change Requests
Monitor system performance post implementation and in production.
Build effective relationship with business by maintaining regular contact with business users through the full project life cycle or with regard to production issues.
Build effective relationship with technical team members by making yourself available for enquiries and advice and by ensuring that they are aware of project goals.
What We’re Looking For
Experience in designing and coding application programs; performing testing for developed applications.
Experience in conducting analyses of organizational needs and goals for the development and implementation of application systems.
Experience in reviewing, analysing, and modifying programming systems, including encoding, testing, debugging and installing for a large-scale system.
Ensuring the operating efficiency of existing application systems. Maintaining records for documentation of systems development and revisions.
Working knowledge of financial services.
A proven track record of picking up new skills and systems
You will also need to have strong technical skills/be able to demonstrate experience in a range of the below technologies:

JCL/Cobol/DB2/CICS/VB6/VBA/Oracle database/Business Objects/MVS/TSO/Unix/ISIS Papyrus

Oracle tools - Forms, E-Business Suite AR, GL and Cash Management

PL/SQL

About Capita Regulated Services

Within Regulated Services, we’re transforming the world of life and pensions, and mortgage services. We’re delivering responsible and sustainable services, helping our clients to respond to changing market factors and adapt to the needs of their customers both now and in the future. Our teams work with clients across the UK and Worldwide, offering a range of services from end-to-end administration, digital technology and business support to lending, account and arrears management. Join us and discover better as you shape the future of regulated services.

What’s in it for you?
A competitive basic salary of upto £55,000 DOE
Remote/Homeworking
The opportunity to take a paid day out of the office, volunteering for our charity partners or a cause of your choice
Company matched pension, life assurance, a cycle2work scheme, 15 weeks’ fully paid maternity, adoption and shared parental leave, paternity pay of two weeks…and plenty more
Voluntary benefits designed to suit your lifestyle – from discounts on retail and socialising, to health & wellbeing, travel and technology.
Access to our Employee Network Groups, which represent every strand of diversity and allow colleagues to connect and learn from each other on an open, inclusive platform
You’ll get the chance to follow your chosen career path anywhere in Capita. You’ll be joining a network of 63,000 experienced, innovative and dedicated individuals across multiple disciplines and sectors. There are countless opportunities to learn new skills and develop in your career, and we’ll provide the support you need to do just that. Our purpose is to create a better outcome for you.

What We Hope You’ll Do Next

Choose ‘Apply now’ to fill out our short application, so that we can find out

more about you.

To view our Covid-19 and process adjustments information, please visit the Capita Careers site.

Equal Opportunities

We’re an equal opportunity employer, which means we’ll consider all suitably qualified applicants regardless of gender identity or expression, ethnic origin, nationality, religion or beliefs, age, sexual orientation, disability status or any other protected characteristic. We recruit and develop our people based on merit and their passion for creating better outcomes, and we’re committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. During the application process, you’ll be asked to share your personal characteristics and data with us. This helps us understand our audience so we can make sure we are doing everything we can to attract a diverse range of people and ensure our recruitment processes are fair and inclusive.

,

industry: Staffing and Recruiting
description:
['A 12 months+ opportunity for a Software Developer has arisen with the local authorities in Leeds.

This is a long term position with the possibility to become permanent.

The role is based in Leeds (though some remote working is likely) and requires technical knowledge and experience of software design, development, testing and implementation of web and windows applications.

Experience of programming languages (e.g. C#), .NET, HTML, scripting languages, XML, and general web design is necessary.

Your initial tasks will focus on providing support and enhancement to the existing systems based on MS Dynamics 365 CRM and Umbraco/Azure websites. You will also be involved with our major ICT programmes which aim to provide improved Customer access to the CA products and facilities via the web and mobile apps.

Your Key Responsibilities Will Include
Develop bespoke software applications to support organisational objectives and strategic plans and to improve processes in line with the requirements of the business.
Provide on-going technical support for business critical ICT systems, public facing websites and customer portals.
Configure and deploy software produced by third party providers.
Engage directly with key stakeholders to understand and document business, functional and non-functional requirements.
Integrating disperse systems by coding interfaces utilising various Application Programming Interfaces (APIs) and Software Development Kits (SDKs).
Provide technical expertise and recommendations in assessing new ICT technologies and initiatives.?
Hours of work are 9am till 5pm, 37 hours per week, Monday to Friday.

To apply please send your CV or email for more information.

121 Jobs is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.']

industry: Computer Games, Gambling & Casinos, and Online Media
description:
['The role We are looking for a Payments Data Analyst to join our lively and dynamic Payments Product Management team. The role will be based in Leeds or London, United Kingdom.

Are you our next star player?

We accept, manage, and payout customers funds across many countries, currencies, and payment methods. Millions of customers expect our experiences to be trustworthy, reliable, fast, and rewarding at scale.

In this role, you’ll be expected to understand our customers and help keep our finger on the pulse of our business, which is the key to success. The analytics stream brings data to life – partnering with partners to add insight and analysis to key decision-making processes. As our aspirations in international markets grow, our analytical resource within payments will grow to match!

Why we need you
Being the analytical partner for Payments Partners and the wider business
Deliver sophisticated analytical projects within a fast paced environment
Application of data to areas such as A/B testing and ROI analysis
Extract and analyse very large and multi-dimensional data sets
Strive to further our understanding of how customers engage with our products.
Lead and foster an open and trusting culture
Provide ad-hoc analysis and insights as required
Automate reporting and dashboarding (where applicable)
Who We’re Looking For
Degree in the quantitative areas (Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science) or equivalent
Knowledge of the digital products and related customer experiences
Practical experience with data and analysis tools (MicroStrategy, Python, SAS, SQL, R, KNIME, GA, etc.)
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint etc.)
Ability to deliver high quality work under time pressure
Ability to function as a self-starter, providing high quality work
Demonstrate excellent people management, interpersonal, presentation and communication skills
A passionate teammate
What’s in it for you?

Our experience-based salaries are competitive. Plus, there’s a discretionary annual performance bonus. And we provide advice and dedicated assistance to those moving to Leeds.

Your package will include
health and dental insurance for you, your partner and your children (if you all live at the same address)
the option to join our company pension scheme
looking to extend your family? You will receive a cash gift of £1,000 for your new addition whilst working for us
discounted gym membership
in-house training and development to develop your skills, progressing your career
free fresh fruit, snacks and drinks in the office
social events; including our sensational summer and Christmas parties.
What happens next?

If you’re what we’re looking for, next up will be a Zoom interview.

The Group

PokerStars is part of Flutter Entertainment Plc, a global sports betting, gaming and entertainment provider headquartered in Dublin and part of FTSE 100 index of the London Stock Exchange, which brings together exceptional brands, products and businesses and a diverse global presence in a safe, responsible and ultimately sustainable way.

We are an equal opportunity employer that values diversity. We do not discriminate on any protected characteristic as defined by applicable law.

We will look to provide reasonable accommodation for applicants with disabilities to participate in the job application or interview process. If you need assistance, please contact talent@starsgroup.com .

Please note we cannot accept general applications; this inbox is just for providing support to those who need it.']

industry: Information Technology and Services
description:
["DWP. Digital with Purpose.
DWP is the UK's largest government department. We help people into work, and make payments worth over £195bn a year to support some of the most vulnerable people in our society.

We are looking for a Senior Data Engineer to work with us on development of innovative data solutions, through robust product development strategies, ETL process design and continuous improvement of the data engineering lifecycle, that will improve DWP applications for millions of UK citizens, allowing them to access essential services and interact with DWP.

You'll join our community of tech experts in DWP Digital. We're driving a once-in-a-generation transformation of government services, using fresh ideas and leading-edge technologies to create innovative, scalable and user-centric digital solutions.

The DWP products and services we maintain and modernise will be used by nearly every person in the UK, at key moments in their lives. The scale of what we do is extraordinary, and our scale and purpose is unique. We'd love you to join us.


Delivery. Work. Projects.
As a Senior Data Engineer you'll be working on the development and delivery of complex data solutions, defining product development strategies and contributing to the continuous improvement of the data engineering lifecycle. You'll be working on ETL process design, data loading strategy and data interrogation, drawing insights and introducing new technologies and processes that will improve the way millions of users interact with DWP and its services.

What skills, knowledge and experience will you need?
Has a deep understanding of the technical concepts required in their role and understands how these fit into the wider technical landscape.
Experience in designing and building efficient, scalable, automated ETL/ELT pipelines, including data ingestion (batch/messaging/streaming), processing and storage.
Comfortable turning complex technical data into compelling, clear, concise messages, at the right level for different stakeholder groups, and using information and experience to make tactical and strategic recommendations.
Key Skills in one or more of the following:
Experience of designing and developing data solutions on AWS/Azure or GCP platforms'
Database and storage eg RDBMS/NoSql/HDFS/S3
SQL / HQL
Data modelling concepts (normalised/dimensional/noSql/Big data)
ETL toolsets e.g. Informatica
Programming Languages - SQL, Python, Shell scripting (BASH)
Experience of Distributed Version control methodologies and tooling, and CI/CD deployments eg (GitLab)
Experience of big data frameworks and associated processing and storage components eg Hadoop Cloudera/AWS EMR, Spark, HIVE, Hue

Details. Wages. Perks.
You'll join us in one of our brilliant digital hubs in Leeds, Newcastle or Sheffield, whichever is most convenient for you.

We also have all the tools and tech we need to enable our people to work flexibly, and many of us are working remotely at the moment due to COVID-19.

In return for your skills, we offer a competitive salary of up to £62,969 a brilliant civil service pension with employer contributions worth over 27%, and a generous leave package starting at \xad26 days.

We also have a broad benefits package built around your work-life balance which includes:
Flexible working, flexi hours and flexi days
Hybrid working: some time in a hub with the team, some time at home
Family-friendly policies
Time off volunteering and charitable giving
Bring your authentic self to work with 'I Can Be Me in DWP'
Discounts and savings on shopping, fun days out and more
Interest-free loans to buy a bike or a season ticket, so it's even easier for you to get to work and start making a difference
Sports and social activities
Working in an award-winning environment and culture
Professional development, coaching, mentoring and career progression opportunities.

CLICK APPLY for more information and to start your application."]

industry: Building Materials, Chemicals, and Construction
description:
['IBM Analyst Programmer

As an IBM Analyst programmer you will be working in a team of 3 to support and enhance the existing bespoke applications on an IBM power 8 system (locally termed AS400) mainly written in RPG/RPGLE and CL.

The primary functions supported on the IBM are the warehouses in Birstall and Carrickfergus Northern Ireland with interfaces to PPG’s ERP system SAP ECC & APO.

Working hours are 35.25 per week Monday to Friday, however flexibility is required to support a business that runs 24 hours 7 days per week.

Key Responsibilities, you will:-
After a period of familiarisation with the bespoke applications, connect with the business, customers, suppliers and our other IT colleagues to analyse business requirements, program the improvements as well as support issues.
Support business operations particularly in the warehouse function.
Provide backup support for existing IT team – including IBM operations and interface support.
Connect with business partners to align on business needs and transform into IT requirements.
Longer term training will be given in SAP and there will be opportunity to progress within SAP project management.

Qualifications
Previous RPG/ILE & CL programming on IBM AS400/I-Series or Power system.
Ability to work without close supervision, agile approach, with a focus on both short and long-term objectives.
Flexible attitude to support the business when required.
Experience with SAP ECC, APO or any other SAP systems including IDOC/BAPI interfaces would be advantageous.
Experience in coordinating project portfolio’s and project management, including all aspects of project development and execution.
Knowledge of business, warehouse and manufacturing process ideal!
IBM operations knowledge (system monitoring, workstation configuration, user setup etc)']

description:

industry: Market Research
description:
["About the role 

We are looking for a self-motivated and experienced Senior User Researcher to work across Retail, FMCG, Financial Services, Public Sector, Health and many more. Our projects are tailored to our clients’ needs and objectives, so you’ll be working on several different types of projects every month.  
 As a Senior User Researcher you’ll be planning, running, analysing and reporting on complex research studies across a variety of UX research methodologies including usability testing, face to face interviews, surveys, card sorts etc.   
 Role & Responsibilities: 

Working directly with clients to understand their needs, to propose and influence research study plans regarding best practice.
Planning and delivering strategic workshops about user research and user experience.
 As a Senior User Researcher you'll be leading & delivering complex user research studies, across a broad number of different research methodologies.
 Moderation / facilitation of qualitative research (remote and face-to-face). 
Design and implementation of quantitative research. 
Research study analysis & report delivery.
Contributing to agency pitches and bids.
Being an active part in building and developing a research team though recruitment and onboarding activities. 
 Essential requirements: 

5+ years commercial experience in a user research role ideally in digital UX. 
Advanced knowledge of UCD / user research techniques and practices, understands the difference between them and is competent and able to use them. 
Works autonomously to deliver and advise across a breadth of services and methodologies. 
Previous experience of writing proposals and study planning with regard to best practice. 
Experience of working within the GDS framework desired. 
Experience of planning, scripting, and conducting user research. 
Strong facilitation & moderation skills with experience of qualitative research methodologies such as in-depth interviews & usability testing. 
Knowledge and experience of running remote moderated and remoted unmoderated UX research.  
Knowledge and experience of running UX research across multiple platforms. 
A talent for translating research findings and metrics to actionable insight through recommendations to inform UX design.
Excellent written and communication skills. 
Knowledge and experience of delivering UX research as part of an Agile delivery team an advantage, working with tools such as Jira, Confluence, Slack, Trello.  
 Compensation 
Attractive base salary + Company pension and Life Assurance
Exciting career development in a fast-growing company 
25 days holiday + bank holidays 
Medicash Health Cashback scheme
LinkedIn Learning licence for you to use throughout your career with us
Cycle to Work Scheme
 Benefits 
Complimentary fruit, coffee, tea and beers on a Friday! 
All the equipment you need to succeed 
A business focused on professional development and personal growth opportunities 
The rare opportunity to impact how the Public Sector delivers services to citizens 
Smart, engaged co-workers and a culture of inclusion, innovation, and opportunity 
Great work life balance 

About SimpleUsability
 SimpleUsability is a leading behavioural research agency with a focus on user and customer experience. Based in Leeds, we run research studies across websites, mobile apps, voice UIs and more. We also provide training, strategic workshops, consultancy, and expertise to our clients throughout the user-centred design process.  Since September 2020 we are very proud to be part of CDS.
 About CDS
 CDS is a communications agency making a positive difference to the health, wealth and safety of the UK. We simplify complexity. Our unique straight-thinking process ensures the smooth delivery of business-critical projects that transform communications, change behaviours, and improve consumer, customer or citizen experiences for the better. 

We resolve complex challenges to improve business efficiency, effectiveness, and streamline business processes underpinned by the very latest technologies. For example: digitally transforming the ability to report crime online for UK police forces; building a new digital platform for the regulator Social Work England; providing behavioural analysis and insight to drive EE's evolving digital and customer service offering and providing the marketing and operational print management service for the Ministry of Defence and Transport for London. Our clients include National Rail Enquiries, the Cabinet Office, Bank of England, Open University, and Insight Investments. We also work with global brands including Coca Cola, McDonald’s and Microsoft. 
 Our inclusive Culture 
 SimpleUsability / CDS positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy and maternity. We foster an inclusive culture that enables everyone to achieve their full potential and enjoy a fulfilling career with us. "]

industry: Information Technology and Services
description:
["We are growing our Engineering Team !

It is an extremely exciting time to join us here at Crisp & although we are currently working from home full time, our company is very much continuing to thrive.

We are looking for multiple talented .NET Developers to join us and will be considering Mid level to Senior Developers....

In response to COVID -19, these roles will be WFH full time until September 2021, perhaps longer. Applicants therefore must be in a position to work from their home and have a secure workstation appropriate for home working for an extended period.

Your flexibility to work in our Leeds office will be key, as we will be gradually returning to our offices.

Although this role is remote, the right individual does need to be within an accessible distance to our Leeds offices, flexibility to attend our offices every so often will be essential.

Leading global brands and social platforms trust Crisp for Social Media Safety, safeguarding their share price and reputation by guaranteeing they are always the first to know. Which means they are always the first to act.

By combining Artificial and Human Intelligence, Crisp’s Extended Intelligence delivers 24/7/365 safety by continually fighting the weaponization of communications from whoever the source, whatever the language and whichever the online harm.

Crisp tracks and understands what ‘Bad Actors’ are saying to build accurate profiles and use predictive and behavioural analytics to identify trends and identify the “unknown unknowns”. Crisp’s proprietary technology then does the heavy lifting by scanning the web continuously, capturing billions of pieces of data on this select cohort of individuals.

Crisp currently protects over $3.6 trillion of aggregate market capitalisation across our current customer base. This demonstrates both the value and uniqueness of our service, and the trust our customers have in us to deliver that service
Requirements

As an Engineer you will analyse system requirements and write clean, testable code using C#, Python or Javascript programming languages.

Working alongside a fantastic engineering team, you will test and debug various applications and review & refactor code.
You will deploy fully functional applications & document development and operational issues.

Although we cannot tell you the detail of our projects (due to privacy and confidentiality to clients), we can tell you that you will work on exciting and interesting projects, where you will also be involved with supporting Junior Developers with their work ...

Essential Criteria
Work experience as a professional software developer
Proficiency in building web-based applications
In-depth knowledge of at least one of the following languages : C#, Javascript, or Python
Experience of using automated environment build tooling (ideally Azure Devops)
Troubleshooting abilities
Good communication skills
Desirable Criteria
Google Cloud Platform
Octopus Deploy
Agile Project delivery (ideally Kanban)

Benefits

Our rewards are as unique as our culture, and we want to attract the best people and retain them.
Not only will we ensure that your development is key, but you will be joining a fantastic team of like-minded people who work together as one team to achieve a shared vision.We offer an excellent salary and benefits package which includes:

Market competitive salary based your skills and experience
Discretionary bonus scheme / commission scheme with payment based on revenue generated as a result of generated sales leads
A generous option allocation
33 days holiday including Bank Holidays (20 days in the US)
Critical Illness insurance
Life Insurance Cover
Healthcare Cash Plan / Healthcare, dental and vision plan
An attractive pension / 401k retirement plan scheme
Cycle to Work Scheme
Employee perks schemes offering discounts, rewards, giveaways and more
Subsidised gym membership
Mental health wellbeing portal and access to an in-house clinical psychologist
Support and provision of supplies to facilitate home working
Flexible working opportunities.

Statement:
'This work meets the requirements in respect of exempted questions under the Rehabilitation of Offenders Act 1974, any applicants who are offered work for this organisation will be subject to an enhanced check from the Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS). This will include details of cautions, reprimands or final warnings as well as convictions. A criminal record will not automatically bar a person from successfully taking up this post."]

industry: Information Technology and Services
description:
['EPAM is a leading global provider of digital platform engineering and development services. We are committed to having a positive impact on our customers, our employees, and our communities. We embrace a dynamic and inclusive culture. Here you will collaborate with multi-national teams, contribute to a myriad of innovative projects that deliver the most creative and cutting-edge solutions, and have an opportunity to continuously learn and grow. No matter where you are located, you will join a dedicated, creative, and diverse community that will help you discover your fullest potential.

Description

EPAM Systems are looking to recruit (Mid-Senior) Sitecore Developer to join our rapidly growing team in the UK. We work on several different projects in a real mix of sectors. This requirement is primarily based onsite with a longstanding EPAM customer. It is an excellent opportunity is being part of something huge, a long standing digital transformation working with cutting edge technologies in a variety of sectors.

We pride ourselves on being an organisation that supports your technical growth, unleashing your real potential, whilst still nurturing the core values of what it means to be an EPAMer.

Responsibilities

Be responsible for develop new functionalities and maintenance of existing ones
Conduct code reviews
Acting as a mentor and supervise work of less experienced Developers
Build consultative client facing relationships throughout the project lifecycle from a personal and technical perspective
Write unit tests and review unit test coverage

Requirements

Good command of English (both written and spoken)
