Basic SEO/HTML meta and web analytics skills
Experience with System integrations (CRM, commerce, DAM, CDN etc.)
Knowledge of globalization/localization
Working experience with Agile methodologies

Nice to have
Experience in JavaScript and HTML/CSS is a plus
Knowledge about Multi-site Information architecture (data templates, inheritance, placeholders, insert options, rendering definitions etc.)
Familiar with:
Sitecore Helix
DI framework (Castle Windsor, Simple Injector, Unity)
Experience Editor
ORMs/T4 templates (Glass Mapper, CIG)
Dev tools (Unicorn/TDS, Sitecore Rocks, Sitecore Instance Manager)
xDB (Visitor Identification, personalization, rules engine, personas/profiles, analytics etc.)
Search (Solr, Content Search API)
Sitecore Shell (ribbon buttons, custom experience buttons etc, custom commands)
Sitecore Content Hub

We offer

We offer a range of benefits including
A competitive group pension plan, life assurance and income protection
Private medical insurance, private dental care and critical illness cover
Cycle scheme Tech scheme and season ticket loan
Employee assistance program
Various perks such as Friday lunch, on-site massage and regular social events
Unlimited access to LinkedIn learning solutions
Some of these benefits may be available only after you have passed your probationary period

Apply']

industry: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet
description:
['The Mozilla Foundation is a California nonprofit public-benefit organization. Our mission is to ensure the internet remains a global public resource, open and accessible to all! Today, this includes making sure artificial intelligence (AI) and data driven technology are more trustworthy.

Over the next few years, the majority of our internet health programs will be on ensuring more trustworthy AI. For us, this means two things: human agency is a core part of how AI is built and integrated and corporate accountability is real and implemented. As part of this effort, we are exploring projects that invite the public to participate in creating trustworthy AI by willingly creating and donating data.

Most significantly, this includes the Common Voice project, which aims to shape the future of voice AI! Voice AI leaves most languages, accents and demographics behind. This project seeks to build openly available data sets for training machine-learning driven voice technologies. The core of this project is a platform that supports language communities and individual volunteers to “donate their voice” to an open data set, which anyone can then download for commercial or non-commercial use.

This work has significant crossover with our Data Futures Lab and our Africa Mradi Innovation work.

Responsibilities And Experience

The Engineer for Common Voice will be part of a team of three engineers working directly for the project - and as this project is open source, also supported by hundreds of passionate Common Voice volunteers. You will work across the stack, but have a particular responsibility for data engineering.
Develop code Typescript, NodeJS, MySQL, Python that supports the Common Voice platform and dataset
Work directly with the Product Lead to shape and inform all aspects of the product roadmap
Partner with the community manager to understand the wide and diverse community of software engineers, language activists and data scientists globally who use and contribute to Common Voice
Collaborate with designers to build and deploy prototypes and experiments that test experience concepts. You will help plan for iterations inclusive of accessibility and responsive design standard methodologies.
Collaborate with other developers and engineers as part of a global, distributed open source development team. This will involve technical decision making, code reviews (receiving and giving), engagement with contributors, planning and other collaborative practices.
Communicate clearly, thoughtfully and regularly with your team, building a culture of trust and openness
Participate in agile software development practices such as daily standups, sprint planning meetings, demos, retrospectives and sprint-based development cycles
Required Qualifications
Passion for developing high quality, high impact products, platforms and experiences.
At least four years of professional experience in full stack web development, ideally in a product team or product-centric company.
An interest in voice technology and/or AI.
Fluency in HTML/CSS/JS/TypeScript and experience with Node.js and React.
Experience with data access and pipeline work, including designing and improving infrastructure for ingesting, storing, and transforming data
Experience with highly scalable distributed systems hosted on cloud providers (e.g. AWS and GCP)
Fluency in web application architecture, including data structures.
The ability to translate wireframes, style guides and design direction into polished, production ready visual experiences.
A user-centred approach, with a keen interest in collaborating with and serving a community’s needs.
Awareness of the need for accessibility in implementation and a willingness to collaborate with designers to deliver inclusive experiences.
Very strong communication skills -- you communicate your opinions and listen to others.
Experience working in multidisciplinary teams of technical and non-technical people, with a deep respect for the different skills that people bring.
A willingness to learn and keep growing, both professionally and personally.
Ideally, have worked on contributor or community participation technologies in the past, or have had substantial personal experience contributing to an open source project and community.
About Our Culture

The Common Voice team is spread across multiple countries. We care deeply about our mission, and value hard work. We do not value ‘facetime’, and we embrace that our colleagues have lives beyond work. You will be able to work flexibly and remotely - we welcome applications from those who are working alongside other commitments, for example responsibilities of care-giving, or creative projects.

Salary And Benefits Information

The Mozilla Foundation is dedicated to fair and equitable compensation for our staff. We aim to pay a competitive and market-based salary that takes into consideration the responsibilities and requirements of the role. The Mozilla Foundation aims to offer at the midpoint of our salary ranges for the purposes of increasing inclusivity and fairness of our offer process and ensuring internal equity. We do not ask for, or take into account, salary histories in our offer process.

The base salary ranges, along with mid-point, for this role in each of the key countries in which we employ staff is listed below. We target the 75th percentile of market pay as a salary band midpoint for all levels, with 10% either side of the midpoint to create a salary range.
Germany: €65,751 - €80,363 (mid-point: €73,057)
UK: £38,990 - £47,654 (mid-point: £43,322)
Canada: $74,438 - $90,979 (mid-point: $82,709)
US: $69,782 - $85,289 (mid-point: $77,535)
Depending on the successful candidate’s location, we may also add in a geographic differential to this base salary that accounts for local job market weighting. This differential is applied to the above ranges depending on the successful candidate’s location. Below are some of the common cities in which we hire staff along with representative examples of salary ranges, along with mid-point, with the geographical differential applied:
Inner London: £42,500 - £51,943 (mid-point: £47,221)
Toronto: $80,318 - $98,166 (mid-point: $89,243)
New York: $77,318 - $94,500 (mid-point: $85,909)
The range for your specific location will be discussed in screening conversations if your application is successful.

We Offer The Following Benefits To All Staff
Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance
Life Insurance + Accidental Death & Dismemberment
Short-Term Disability and Long-Term Disability
Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
Retirement Plan contributions
20 Paid Time Off days per year (prorated) + your birthday
Company Holidays + Shutdown
Wellness budget
Professional Development budget
Top up program for Maternity and Parental leaves
Benefits are subject to change at any time at the discretion of Mozilla Foundation.

Mozilla Foundation Hiring Practices

Mozilla understands that valuing diverse creative practices and forms of knowledge are crucial to and enrich the company’s core mission. We encourage applications from everyone, including members of all equity-seeking communities, such as (but certainly not limited to) women, racialized and Indigenous persons, persons with disabilities, and persons of all sexual orientations and gender identities and expressions.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation at accommodation@mozillafoundation.org.

Group: D']

industry: Information Technology and Services, Banking, and Financial Services
description:
["Are you an experienced Data Analyst who loves to work on their own initiative and be involved in a wide range of different projects?

Here at Leeds Building Society our Software Delivery function is an expanding area of our business and we and looking for a new Data Analyst to join us as we grow our team. You'll be based from our new Sovereign House head office in Leeds and have some flexibility for remote working.

As a Data Analyst you will provide companywide strategic, analytical, and technical support for software development activities. You'll act as an intermediary between the business community and the technical community working with IT project teams and business clients to collect, clarify, and translate business requirements into documentation and conceptual design (using appropriate tools and models) from which applications and solutions are developed. You'll also be heavily involved with the distribution and successful delivery of all BI reports.

Ideally, you will have the following skills and experience in order to be successful in this newly created role:
Intermediate SQL skills
Proven ability to quickly learn new applications, processes, and procedures
Able and willing to collaborate in a team environment and exercise independent judgment
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to form good partner relationships across functions
Strategic, intellectually curious thinker with focus on outcomes
Advanced knowledge of relational databases
Significant experience of working collaboratively with internal and external customers
Demonstrated experience in writing software requirements and test specifications
Experience working on data warehouse deployments
A good working knowledge of Microsoft Office products
Why is Leeds Building Society a great place to work?

We're a mutual not a bank, which means we're owned by our members and are run exclusively in their best interests. In fact, our business is built on the idea of people helping people, whether that's saving for the future or buying their own home.

We're proud to be the first financial services organisation to be awarded Leaders in Diversity. We don't believe in a ‘one size fits all' approach when it comes to working here so we provide a flexible inclusive working environment that suits all colleagues. We're a 2019 Sunday Times Best Company to work for, which reflects our commitment to support our colleagues with the environment, tools and training they need to be able to excel in their careers.

We're committed to doing what's right for our members, colleagues and communities. We were the first national high-street financial institution to be awarded the Fair Tax Mark, we buy 100% renewable electricity for all our sites and have a charity partnership with Dementia UK. In addition every colleague has 14 hours volunteering each year. Our culture and colleagues are at the heart of everything we do.

Interested in applying?
Click “Please Apply” below.
Leeds Building Society is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact us."]

industry: Information Technology and Services
description:
['The UK Government National Security Mission is what excites us at Applied Intelligence. We endeavour to work at the very core of our customer’s mission and as technology develops, data is becoming an ever more essential feature of working in this sector. At a high level, the need for bigger, better and faster data is vital. Our ever expanding team of passionate Data Scientists and Engineers are the reason we are able to contribute to the success of our customer’s mission. Data Science will continue to play a pivotal role in expanding our capability to deliver solutions to our customers for years to come.

Data Engineer

We are looking for experienced Data Engineers to join our team following continuous growth and success in the UK Government sector.

Our people are what differentiates us, they are resourceful, innovative and dedicated. We have a mix of generalists and specialists and recognise that this diversity contributes to our success. We recognise the benefits of forming teams from a mix of disciplines, which allows us to come up with cutting edge, high quality solutions.

Our breadth of work across the Public Sector provides diverse opportunities for our people to develop their careers in new areas of expertise and with new clients. Our projects are spread across the Data Science lifecycle from delivering Research and Proof of Concept models, to building and delivering operational solutions.

What You Could Be Doing For Us
Design, develop, test and support data collection, data integration and ETL applications to make information and data available to key client stakeholders and technical interfaces
Model data requirements, data sources and data flows to bring order and structure to programmes of work
Defining how and where data is created, mastered and destroyed to ensure proper control over the lifecycle of corporate data assets
Using categories of products that can be used to collect, integrate, store, visualise and govern data and metadata
Define metadata to provide searchability and governance (including Records Management) for unstructured data.
What background are we looking for?
Data Engineering, Analysis or Science, with a solid understanding of programming languages along with experience of applying them in your previous role
Experience in using Data Engineering tools and technology ETL tools including Python and a number of the Big Data Applications. Rather than specifying a list of technologies we look for, demonstrable ability in what you have used previously, along with adaptability and willingness to learn is what we value
A good understanding of Open Source software for Data Engineering and can evaluate these platforms against products. Given a customer problem you can analyse and evaluate options and recommend solutions.
An understanding of maintaining and applies up to date, specialist knowledge of database concepts (including unstructured, NoSQL and ”big data” platforms), object and data modelling techniques.
Previous experience working in the domain of Cyber Security and Intelligence is desirable, but not essential.
How We Will Support You
Work-life balance is important; you’ll get 25 days holiday a year and, via our flexible benefits package the option to buy/sell and carry over from the year before
You can work around core hours with flexible and part-time working
Our flexible benefits package includes; private medical and dental insurance, a competitive pension scheme, cycle to work scheme, taste cards and more
You’ll have a dedicated Career Manager to help you develop your career and guide you on your journey through BAE
Don’t know a particular technology? Your learning and development is key to your future career
You’ll be part of our bonus scheme
You are welcome to join any/all of our Diversity and Support groups. These groups cover everything from gender diversity to mental health and wellbeing.

#regular

#hiring

#AIcareers

Life at BAE Systems Applied Intelligence

We are embracing Hybrid Working. This means you and your colleagues may be working in different locations, such as from home, another BAE Systems office or client site, some or all of the time, and work might be going on at different times of the day. By embracing technology, we can interact, collaborate and create together, even when we’re working remotely from one another. Hybrid Working allows for increased flexibility in when and where we work, helping us to balance our work and personal life more effectively, and enhance wellbeing.

Diversity and inclusion are integral to the success of BAE Systems Applied Intelligence. We are proud to have an organisational culture where employees with varying perspectives, skills, life experiences and backgrounds – the best and brightest minds – can work together to achieve excellence and realise individual and organisational potential.

About BAE Systems Applied Intelligence

We use our intelligence-led insights to help defend Governments, Nations and Societies from cyber-attacks and financial crime. Our customers depend on our evolving capabilities to help them safely grow their organisations. Our unprecedented access to threat intelligence, world-leading analysts and market-leading technology means we can help them to adapt, evolve and stay ahead of the criminals.

Division overview: Government

At BAE Systems Applied Intelligence, we pride ourselves in being a leader in the cyber defence industry, and Government contracts are an area we have many decades of experience in. Our Government business unit houses four of our critical client groups: UK National Security, Global National Security, defence and central government. Government and key infrastructure networks are critical targets to defend as the effects of these networks being breached can be devastating.

As a member of the Government business unit, you will defend the connected world and ensure the protection of nations. We all have a role to play in defending our clients, and this is yours.']

jobtitle: Senior Data Scientist - All locations considered (1757)
industry: Banking, Insurance, and Financial Services
description:
["Are you a Data Scientist who thrives on growth and change? Do you enjoy working with and learning new tech? Do you have strong stakeholder management skills?

If your answer is 'yes' to all of these, then we'd love to hear from you.

Want to know a little about us?

Every day, over a million people and businesses across the UK, trust us to provide financial solutions to realise their ambitions. We help people like you finance furniture, home improvements, and cars. We help companies of all sizes fund growth and innovation, whilst working to build a sustainable future for all.

What does the role involve?

A business as diverse as ours is powered by data, and we need someone like you to help us on our journey to transform data ingestion, quality, analytics, and reporting.

Responsibilities

You'll achieve this by carrying out a range of responsibilities including

As a Senior Data Scientist, you play an integral role in taking our existing data capabilities and solutions on a journey to the next level. You will expand our data science and complex data analysis capabilities across Hitachi Capital UK by working with our business units to provide detailed data analysis to explore and identify opportunities to improve our business systems and processes.
Providing expert data-driven problem solving utilising mathematical skills, programming capabilities and a thorough understanding of business and financial logic.
Identify innovative opportunities to improve our capabilities; making recommendations to introduce what is appropriate and will improve our business.
Use multiple advanced computational analysis methods to enable effective data-driven decision making by stakeholders throughout the business.
Evidence that our business rules and logic adhere to regulations and demonstrate how system calculations work in response to audits.
What are we looking for?

You're enthusiastic about delivering data solutions that empower business to grow and improve. You've got a good technical grounding and a desire to learn more.

In particular, we're looking for knowledge and experience of the following:
Data and statistical analysis tools and techniques
Cloud based analytic and integration toolsets (such as Microsoft Azure and AWS)
Big Data manipulation and analysis, including the use of appropriate tools (such as Hadoop, Hive and Spark)
Ability to use one or more programming languages (e.g. SQL, Python)
Strong communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to translate and communicate technical solutions to non-technical stakeholders.
What can we offer you?

In Addition To An Excellent Salary, Bonus, And Pension, We Offer

We're passionate about looking after our people at Hitachi Capital UK, as we know that looking after you means that you will look after our customers.
Car allowance, or cash alternative
25 days' holiday, plus bank holidays and the option to buy/sell
Wellbeing support including BUPA, Babylon Health, eyecare, employee assistance programme, and free yoga classes
Life assurance, critical illness cover, and free financial advice
In addition to our core package, we offer a range of flexible benefits, including cycle to work, discounts on loans, insurance, new, and used vehicles.

What's the next step?

Like the sound of what we have to offer? Apply today, and we'll be in touch.

Hitachi Capital UK is proud to be a Top 50 Inclusive employer. We're committed to encouraging an inclusive culture where all colleagues can thrive and bring their whole selves to work."]

industry: Staffing and Recruiting, Financial Services, and Real Estate
description:
['Job Title

Analyst - Property Data Excellence

Job Description

Job Description Summary

Analyst - Property Data Excellence

Location – Leeds

We have an opportunity for Analyst to come and join our team in Leeds, you will join the Property Research & Support team and will report directly to the Director, EMEA Property Data Excellence.

You will be responsible for gathering, validating, & aggregating specific datasets, which will include documenting sources, validating data, and integrating data into Cushman & Wakefield databases.

You will work closely with the local research teams and market experts across countries and across service lines.

Key Responsibilities
Assists with updates to proprietary commercial real estate database
Execute processes to gather datasets across a variety of internal and external sources
Aggregate, validate and cleanse data for implementation into C&W databases
Work with internal and external data providers to refine and streamline processes
Physically canvas and phone canvas buildings and tenants in order to populate tenant and building database ensuring consistent and quality capture on all pertinent fields
Proactively and routinely updates and maintains property databases
Captures lease and sale comparable information performing research where possible and sending local Research teams’ questions where needed to ensure full capture
Maintains exclusive listings
Follows up on availability, lease, and sale surveys by doing Internet research and calling other commercial real estate agents to ensure proper capture of all required fields
Assist in the quarterly reporting process including the collection of quarterly market data from local teams across EMEA, ensuring data is of required quality and added into relevant internal systems to required timescales
Demonstrated Experience Should Include
Experience in commercial real estate industry, property markets or research-related field preferred
Experience in data entry/data management and data quality
Ability to aggregate, harmonize and rationalize various data sources
Awareness of Business Intelligence tools
If you are keen to join us, then get in touch and apply today!

Cushman & Wakefield provides equal employment opportunity. Discrimination of any type will not be tolerated. Cushman & Wakefield is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by state, federal, or local law.']

jobtitle: Chief of Staff to the Cofounder/CTO
industry: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services
description:
['👋 Hi there, I’m Jonas, cofounder and CTO at Monzo.

I’m looking for a right hand person to help me scale myself, my team and help me run my organisation. You should have a technical background, be a good communicator, good at running teams and interested in tech startups. Beyond that I am flexible 😀I am happy to chat to consider people at different stages in their career and can imagine it being a good fit for a wide range of career paths such as engineering, engineering management, product management or data science.

I think of this as a rare chance to be part of the leadership team that takes a growth stage, pre-IPO tech company to the next level. This could come in handy if you're looking to start a tech startup one day. Or if you have done so in the past and want to see what the growth stage is like before trying again. Whatever it is that you're looking to do after Monzo, I'll be happy to help you onwards on that path.

On a given day, you might
talk to people in the organisation to see where we can do more to help them
facilitate organisation-wide goal-setting, planning and decision making processes
help me hire key roles in the organisation
draft strategies, responses to regulators, board updates, announcements, etc
represent me in meetings when there are scheduling conflicts
mediate (or pre-empt!) misunderstandings between people in and outside of Monzo
manage the budget and financial plan for my organisation
brief me before meetings with board, investors or regulators
With that in mind, I’m looking for somebody who
is passionate about making money work for everyone What we have achieved over the last six years as a business was considered extremely unlikely when we set out. We obtained a banking license (even though we were mostly a bunch of programmers who never worked in banking), grew to 5m+ customers, have the highest growth and customer satisfaction in the UK market, built an organisation of 1500+ people and grew revenues to £100m+/year.
In order to achieve Monzo's mission of making money work for everyone, we will need to achieve equally unlikely things successfully for many more years. I'm looking for somebody ambitious who is motivated by that challenge.
has a technical background It is important to me that you are deeply familiar with the work of building software and systems and can independently form an opinion of a technical approach and organisational structure. It's not a dealbreaker if you haven't developed software personally, but in that case please focus on how else you picked up this skill in your answer (e.g. maybe as a PM or data scientist working closely with engineers).
You should also be able to self-serve basic data analytics tasks using SQL. This way you will never be blocked on "waiting for data" from anyone, which will make it much easier to build an intuition about the business.
can run teams or projects efficiently This means running rituals such as planning, proactively updating stakeholders, prioritising the work we do in the CTO Office and more generally that we set good goals and then achieve them.
I'm not super structured, so a key part of your responsibilities will be to make sure nothing falls through the cracks and that I'm always thinking about the most important things.
has a deep interest in what makes some companies more successful than others How come companies like Google, Amazon or Facebook have been orders of magnitude more successful than other companies - including legacy banks - over the last 20 years? What can we learn from them - both as a company and for our engineering organisation? What can we learn from the next generation of technology startups? From Airbnb or Stripe or Spotify? What can we do to do even better than even those companies?
I'm not expecting you to have the answers (because there are no clear answers!), but you should be deeply interested in these questions and have formed some independent opinions on them. More generally I'm looking for somebody opinionated who will tell me when I'm wrong.
works well with many different stakeholders In this role you will need to work with a huge range of different stakeholders. Folks in junior and senior roles at Monzo, folks with very different degrees of technical understanding, people with or without Monzo context. A big part of this is being able to clearly communicate ideas verbally and in writing at the right level of abstraction for your audience.
On a related note, everyone in my team is really lovely and I'd like to keep it that way. Please don't apply if you see other people as resources to be used to further your own goals, rather than as humans to connect with, understand and support 🙏

Hopefully we can chat soon!

Jonas

Logistics

Location:

Anywhere in the UK, Ireland, France or Germany (as we have payroll in those countries) but you need to be able to spend at least a few days a month in our office in London. We can pay for relocation and sponsor a visa.

Compensation

Depending on experience £75k - £160k/year cash plus meaningful stock options

Process

I’ll review all applications personally and the first call you’ll have is with me. If you don’t have an “up-to-date” CV, just write a few sentences about yourself and point me in the direction where I can learn more about you.

Following that there will be a series of in-person/video interviews, as well as a written take-home task.

Due to the amount of applications, I unfortunately won't be able to give feedback on the applications - as much as I'd like to.

Equal Opportunity Statement

At Monzo, embracing diversity in all of its forms and fostering an inclusive environment for all people to do the best work of their lives with us. This is integral to our mission of making money work for everyone.

We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, family or parental status, national origin, veteran, neurodiversity status or disability status.']

industry: Research, Biotechnology, and Pharmaceuticals
description:
['ICON plc is a world-leading healthcare intelligence and clinical research organisation. From molecule to medicine, we advance clinical research providing outsourced services to pharmaceutical, biotechnology, medical device and government and public health organisations.

With our patients at the centre of all that we do, we help to accelerate the development of drugs and devices that save lives and improve quality of life.

Our people are our greatest strength, are at the core of our culture, and the driving force behind our success. ICON people have a mission to succeed and a passion that ensures what we do, we do well.

As a Data Scientist, you will be dedicated to one of our global pharmaceutical clients, a company that values performance, recognizes merit and has a high focus on quality. This environment encourages innovation, individuality and embraces people that want to be a part of it.

The Data Scientist is responsible for contributing to the development of the strategy for Analytics, Reporting and Metrics building, in line with overall Business Information Services strategy, leveraging visualization tools/business intelligence platforms. Your role will include the following:-
Liaising, advising and negotiating with key customer groups on requirements and proposing innovative solutions to meet their data modelling requirements
Coordinate with different functional teams to develop custom data models and algorithms, and monitor outcomes.
Applying analytical and statistical methods to solve identified use cases in an agile manner using various data sources and analytical tools
Providing specialist support for development, interpretation and application of machine learning models
Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyse model performance and data accuracy.
Leveraging business intelligence tools i.e. Spotfire for analysis and review.
Ensuring systems code and documentation are inspection ready
please note this position can either be offered as fully home-based anywhere in the UK or office-based in Livingston
You Are

A solutions orientated, analytical and customer focused individual with a global business mind set and a strong background in operational excellence!

To Enable Success In This Position You Will Have
We’re looking for someone with 3-5 years of experience manipulating data sets and building statistical models, has a Master’s or PHD in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science.
Experience using statistical computer languages to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets
A strong knowledge of Python is essential, while SQL is useful and R also beneficial
Experience working with and creating data architectures.
Experience of clinical data and domains (Experience working within Clinical Trials or the wider Pharmaceutical industry) preferable but not necessary
Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.
Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams.
A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.
ICON is an equal opportunity and inclusive employer and is committed to providing a workplace free of discrimination and harassment. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.']

industry: Construction, Information Technology and Services, and Computer Software
description:
['Role:Structural Analysis Software Developer

Location: Leeds,UK

We are looking for a Structural Analysis Software Developer to join our team in Leeds, UK . You will focus on developing analytical capabilities of our products, using your knowledge of the theories behind structural analysis to deliver practical solutions to structural engineers using our software.

Trimble is an exciting, entrepreneurial company, with a history of exceptional growth coupled with a disciplined and strategic focus on being the best. Our solutions are used in over 140 countries and we have incredibly diverse lines of business. Our employees represent this diversity and can be found in over 30 countries, working closely with their colleagues around the world. Due to our geographic, product and customer reach, there is plenty of room at Trimble for exceptional people to grow. Come position yourself with an innovative industry leader and position yourself for success.

Join our team!With us you will work in a diverse, open and innovative high-tech environment. You have the possibility to develop core functionalities in Trimble software within a challenging and inspiring environment. You will work with other highly talented developers, with plenty of opportunities for you to learn and share your learnings. You know that teamwork is a key to success!

As a company we offer possibilities to grow inside the company, with the opportunity to take on responsibility within a supportive and collaborative development team.

Your Role Is To
Work with a domain specialist at Imperial College, London, to develop innovative and unique solutions to complex structural analysis problems
Work with application domain experts to plan and implement solutions in Tekla products
Perform thorough testing to ensure that requirements are met reliably and robustly
Work with support teams and customers to advise and assist with structural analysis problems as necessary
Create technical documentation for internal and external use
We Expect You To Have
Demonstrable strong understanding of structural analysis concepts
Keen interest and knowledge of structural engineering and structural analysis
A desire to provide cutting-edge solutions to our customers
Excellent communication, to be able to explain complex problems with clarity
Fluent written and spoken English
Ability to learn and adapt fast to changes and new environments
Strong collaboration skills and the ability to work with colleagues around the world
Positive attitude, active and enthusiastic about software engineering
Programming experience in Fortran, C# or C++ would be beneficial but not essential
There is still a huge amount of unreleased productivity potential in the construction industry and we need great people to help us unleash it! If you want to join our team , send your application and résumé via the APPLICATION FORM as soon as possible.

Trimble Inc. is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, gender, age, color, religion, national origin, marital status, disability, sexual orientation, status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws, or any other protected factor. EOE/M/F/V/D

industry: Computer Games, Gambling & Casinos, and Online Media
description:
["The role Azure Data Engineer

We are looking for an Azure Data Engineer to join our lively and dynamic Business Intelligence - Data Platform team!

Why we need you

We’re on the lookout for an Azure Data Engineer to contribute to the Stars Group growing data and analytical needs. Be part of the team that looks to build out our next-generation hybrid data platform, using new technologies and techniques to improve the value out of our data assets and empower employees to innovate.

The Azure Data Engineer is responsible for the successful delivery of business intelligence solutions to the entire organization and is experienced in BI development and implementations, data architecture and data warehousing.

You`ll be choosing the right technology and proper data design and implementation in various projects and solutions. You`ll demonstrate hands-on skills in processing large data sets, expertise in data structure, data access patterns, Big Data concepts, cloud computing and optimization techniques. You`ll build robust end-to-end systems with long term maintenance and support of the application in mind. You`ll use reusable code modules to tackle problems across the team and organization. The Framework you`ll build will be of significant complexity and an internal team of data engineers (both full-time associates and/or third-party resources) will be there to help you achieve this.

Who we're looking for

3+ years of experience in implementing large scale data projects within the cloud environment (Azure). 3+ years of experience with Cloud databases – Azure Synapse (Azure SQL DW) or similar. 3+ years of experience in developing data ingestion, data processing and analytical pipelines for Big Data, relational databases, NoSQL, data lake solutions in Azure Data Platform. You will need to demonstrate strong programming skills using Python.

Experience with developing Streaming and batch mode processes.

As the ideal candidate, you will have

Experience in high volume systems. Experience with streaming technologies such as Kafka. Experience with data migration to cloud based environment. Experience with Databricks/Spark. Microsoft certification will also be considered a strong advantage.

What’s in it for you?

Our experience-based salaries are competitive. Plus, there’s a discretionary annual performance bonus. And we provide advice and dedicated assistance to those moving to Leeds.

Your package will include
health and dental insurance for you, your partner and your children (if you all live at the same address)
the option to join our company pension scheme
£1,000 as a congratulations if you have a baby whilst you work for us
discounted gym membership
in-house training and development to develop your skills, progressing your career
free fresh fruit, snacks and drinks in the office
social events; including our sensational summer and Christmas parties.
The Group

PokerStars is part of Flutter Entertainment Plc, a global sports betting, gaming and entertainment provider headquartered in Dublin and part of FTSE 100 index of the London Stock Exchange, which brings together exceptional brands, products and businesses and a diverse global presence in a safe, responsible and ultimately sustainable way.

We are an equal opportunity employer that values diversity. We do not discriminate on any protected characteristic as defined by applicable law.

We will look to provide reasonable accommodation for applicants with disabilities to participate in the job application or interview process. If you need assistance, please contact talent@starsgroup.com .

Please note we cannot accept general applications; this inbox is just for providing support to those who need it."]

industry: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet
description:
['Hi, we’re Hippo.

We’re a digital service design consultancy who work closely with our clients to create digital products and services that work for everyone.

People are at the centre of everything we do. We support and grow the people we work with and come together as a community to solve problems.

We take a common sense approach to getting things done. We do not abide by dogma. We get things wrong and that’s ok. We learn from it and adapt. We stay curious and never stop learning.

About The Role

Do you enjoy working collaboratively within multidisciplinary teams? Do you have great consultancy skills, caring about your client’s needs and motivations? Do you love getting to the root of issues and helping to improve user experience?

We are looking for a User Researcher to join the team on a permanent basis, so keep reading

What You Will Do
Plan, design, prepare and execute a range of user research activities to support the design, development and continuous improvement of client products
Identify the most appropriate research methods depending on the phase of the service lifecycle, such as quantitative and qualitative research, ethnographic research methods, usability testing and A/B tests
Provide insights on the user’s behaviour, motivations and end goals that will inform the design decisions made throughout the project’s progress
Help the team to build empathy for the service users
Support usability evaluation sessions in different environments or remotely
Use a range of tools to collect data, and write research reports supported by the evidence, such as video, graphs, tables and pictures
Effectively present your findings and related design/business recommendations and customer insights to stakeholders
Engage with agile, multidisciplinary teams with a user-centred design process
Learn from insights from user research and metrics to define and improve the service, and explain your decisions clearly
Run workshops with your team and stakeholders
Work with the Hippo research and design community to share best practice to ensure high standards
Requirements
Experience of working with managers as required to devise appropriate research strategies to generate focused insights and to convert concepts into high quality stimulus material
Experience of using different methods to achieve insights (both qualitative and quantitative) for example sampling, questionnaire design and analysis, interviews, ethnographic observations, facilitating workshops, focus groups and other types of group discussion, and managing stakeholder engagement sessions
To understand user centred design principles and practices
Be able to understand the strategic objectives of the organisation and how the insights will help them
To be comfortable having your findings challenged by stakeholders and the ability to clearly explain the insights
Salary £36,000pa - £50,000pa

How Hippo Digital Embraces Diversity & Equal Opportunity

Hippo Digital are committed to diversity, equality and inclusion. For us diversity and inclusion are not just a tick-boxing activity, but a chance for us to make long-term meaningful change. A diverse workforce means that we’re able to unlock our ability to innovate, be creative, be better problem solvers and provide an inclusive environment for everyone and we encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply.

We invite candidates to apply from anywhere in the UK who can be flexible regarding location. Our offices are based in Leeds and Coventry but due to the nature of our business you may be requested to work from our various client locations and/or work from home.']

industry: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services
description:
["Location: Remote/Leeds

Initial Duration: 6 Months

Rate: £465PD

IR35: Inside

Task Description

As a User Researcher you'll generate new and useful user insights and translate them into features and actions. You will lead the formal usability testing process for a digital service - from developing user recruitment briefs through to test moderation, analysis and report writing.

This Includes
Planning, designing and conducting in-house research to test new service ideas and concept development
Working closely with the team to turn user data into actionable user stories that influence product/service direction and prototype development
Managing ad-hoc qualitative/quantitative research projects such as proposition development, visual identity and customer experience mapping
Presenting findings, recommendations and customer insights to senior decision makers
Sharing knowledge of tools and techniques with technical and non-technical team members in the wider digital team and across government
Technologies
Experience of delivery using an iterative/agile methodology (e.g. Agile/SCRUM)
Experience of agile collaboration tools (e.g. Atlassian Jira, Agile for Scrum, Confluence)
Mandatory Technical Skills
Understanding of agile delivery techniques e.g. Continuous Delivery/Integration, Test Driven Development, and associated tooling
Mandatory Business Skill
Good facilitation and influencing skills
Excellent problem-solving and interpersonal skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills - able to work with large groups of customers of varying levels of seniority from user to board level
This role will involve working with various UK Government clients at locations across the UK, so you must be mobile and willing to work away from your base location"]

industry: Staffing and Recruiting
description:
['User Researcher, Yorkshire. £40,000 -45,000

RP is delighted to be working exclusively on behalf of an organization with a strong social purpose. We are looking for an experienced User Researcher with a passion for iterating products based on user needs. 

This is a hands on role where you will be speaking users and advocating their voices through the products you design. You will naturally have very good listening and analytical skills along with a confident personality to advocate effective change on behalf of users. You will be passionate about user-centred solutions and comfortable working in an agile way. 

In this role you will lead on user research (qualitative and quantitative) activity across the range of our clients digital products. Working with Product Owners you will design and analyse quantitative user research activities including surveys, card sorts, and Google Analytics reviews.
  We are looking for candidates with knowledge and experience of user research methodologies and techniques including user interviews, accessibility tests and workshops and can choose appropriate methods for user research.
  Working with a diverse range of users this is an exciting role with a feel good factor due to their strong social purpose.
  Our client offers hybrid working therefore you location can be flexible. Please get in touch ASAP to find out more this is an exciting role that I would love to tell you more about!']

industry: Human Resources
description:
['My client is looking for Cloud Data engineers with high level of coding experience in SQL and Python. You must have recent demonstrable experience of Python, Pyspark, Hadoop, HDFS and Hive.

Experience on Power BI, basic understanding on UNIX scripting, R and Data Science will give an added advantage

Skills:
Python, PySpark, R
Hadoop - HDFS and HIVE
Power BI
Data Science
Basic Unix Scripting

Must have:
Min 5+ years experience
2-3 large projects in the specified area
Transformational projects experience']

industry: Information Technology and Services
description:
["Description

User Researcher

AND Introduction

At AND, we accelerate the development of digital capabilities. In practice, that means helping ambitious leaders and organisations build the teams, products, processes and even operational structures they need to close the digital skills gap within their organisation today, so that they thrive tomorrow.

Clients rely on our experience, agility and craft skills across tech and business strategy, software development and product management to address some of the toughest challenges facing their businesses.

We bring aboard thinkers, tinkerers, passionate software craftspeople and inspiring technologists to help us solve these challenges. Together, we’re united by a sense of pragmatism, purpose and a deeply-held belief that digital products and technology alone won’t transform a business or save the world: it’s the people that count.

About You

As a User Researcher, you plan, design and carry out research activities with users that help teams get a deep understanding of the people who use government services. This research will inform policy, proposition, service, content and interaction design so that services work for users and achieve policy intent. As a result, you will need to be able to:
Turn research data into clear findings that inform decisions and involve colleagues in analysis and synthesis to increase consensus and challenge assumptions.
Understand the diversity of users of government services.
Choose the appropriate methods for different stages of the product life cycle and situations and you know how to apply methods correctly.
Understand the social and technological context for government services.
Implement user-centred design practices and know how to embed them into an Agile workflow to deliver timely findings.
To Do That, It's Essential You Bring The Following
Knowledge of the technologies used to build and operate digital services, understanding the different technical roles in a multidisciplinary team.
You know how to include all kinds of users in appropriate research activities to help teams deliver accessible services.
Able to help colleagues understand how digital technology is changing user behaviour, and the challenges and opportunities for government services.
Able to align user research activities with objectives to create strategic insights that inform policy and propositions.
Ability to work in an open, iterative and collaborative way in a multidisciplinary team.
Joining AND

From the work we deliver, to the way we serve and support our people, we work hard to ensure that there’s nowhere quite like AND. But joining a company is a two-way street: the fit has to work on both sides. So before you apply, here’s three key things to understand about us:
We’re built for people - like, real humans. Not ‘resources’ or ‘staff’. That means happiness and wellbeing really do matter to us, and we hate unnecessary hierarchy and bureaucracy.
There’s no well-trodden path ahead: AND is growing fast and forging a new trail. That’s exciting, and gives us all the autonomy and opportunity we love - but bear in mind it also demands focus, patience and resilience.
Diversity is a priority. After all, to build great products that a wide variety of different people love to use, we need a wide variety of people to help us build them. So diversity is more than a policy or a word: it’s business critical for us.
Still sound good? Great! Fill out the short application form below and we’ll be in touch."]

industry: Marketing and Advertising, Staffing and Recruiting, and Financial Services
description:
["15ten15 are currently recruiting for a software developer on behalf of a leading software development company based in Wakefield.

What We're Looking For

Exciting opportunity to work within a growing and dynamic software development company based in Wakefield. Working within a small development to an Agile process on greenfield projects and enhancing existing products to utilise the latest coding technologies. A great opportunity to mentor junior members of the team will also be available within this role.

Responsibilities
Write clean readable code which is well document
Provide mentoring support for junior members of the development team
Provide feedback of work via code reviews to other members of the development team
To work closely with the Team Lead Developer to effectively plan sprints
THE IDEAL CANDIDATE

Essential Skills
At least 3 years C# experience
At least 3 years MVC 5 experience
At least 3 years SQL Server experience
At least 3 years RESTful API experience
At least 1 years Xamarin Forms experience deploying Android & IOS Apps
Proven experience of work in an Agile environment
Desirable Skills
DevExpress MVC Components
Xamarin
AngularJs 1.7
.Net Framework and .Net Core
Google Maps API Integrations
Sage X3 Integrations
Google Material Design
Microsoft Azure
Unit Tests
Visual Studio TFS Online (Azure DevOps)
Continuous Integration
JIRA
Desirable Experience
Transport solution
Healthcare systems
Tracking & mapping systems
Facilities Management
Machine learning / AI methods
WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?

WORKING HOURS - Monday to Friday 09:00 to 17:00 with half hour break

SALARY RANGE - £30,000 to £35,000 dependant on experience

BENEFITS - 25 days holiday plus bank holidays, pension, social events, flexible hours, home working"]

industry: Information Technology and Services, Insurance, and Financial Services
description:
['Primary Details

Time Type: Full time

Worker Type: Employee

12 month FTC

QBE’s European Operations, which accounts for over 27% of QBE Group turnover, is a leading specialist in London market and European commercial lines business. Active in both the Lloyd’s and company market, QBE offers considerable diversity to the broking community. We are a socially responsible company and give our customers the ability to invest a portion of their premiums in environmentally and socially beneficial projects.

The Opportunity:

As a Finance Data Analyst you will provide support to the Balance Sheet Control team. This will involve data collection and data manipulation from various sources. You will also be required to analyse and reconcile all data sources and identify any issues. This includes liaising with the relevant departments to correct core systems and ensuring the core systems have the correct position recorded once correction are processed.

Your responsibilities for this role may include, but are not limited to:

Reconciliation Quality control
Assisting in Reconciliation improvements.
Liaise with other departments to obtain relevant information
Manipulate data into a workable format
Assist in the reconciliation of data
Reconcile all data sources
Identify mismatches of data
Liaise with business to clear mismatches of data

You will need to be able to display you have the following qualifications and experience:

Experience in producing MI reporting
Ability to extract data from multiple systems
Stakeholder management experience
Good Excel skills
Ability to work well within teams

At QBE, we view our people as our most precious asset. We understand the importance of fostering a work environment that is responsive to the changing needs of today's workforce. QBE aims to build a workplace that is fair and inclusive because we want to attract and retain the best people to do the job. We’re ‘Happy to talk Flexible Working’.

How to Apply:

To submit your application, click "Apply" and follow the step by step process.

Equal Employment Opportunity:

QBE is an equal opportunity employer and is required to comply with equal employment opportunity legislation in each jurisdiction it operates.']

industry: Financial Services
description:
["Varied opportunity
Flexible working

About Our Client

This is a well established, international insurance brand,who are looking to revolutionise their technology offering by going digital. This is an opportunity to really get involved in a large digital change and transformation programme by playing a key role in offering valuable statistics in order to deliver the best service possible to both customers and work colleagues in this environment. Understanding market trends, and relaying, in lamens terms what these figures highlight will allow the business to create the best change and adoption methods possible to achieve the best output.

Job Description

Proactive in problem solving
Prioritisation and workload/time management
Delivery focused with excellent attention to detail and strong drive to resolve issues;
Strong team working and collaboration skills;
Analytical thinking and numerical skills;
Resilience and ability to adapt in an ever changing environment;
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Use/experience of either service now or power BI

The Successful Applicant

We would like to see someone who can work on their own initiative, think outside of the box and is heavily customer focused. If you are passionate about delivering a good service and can display this during the interview process then we want to speak with you.

You must be able to give solid examples where you have used a data platform to produce and present reports to and audience that has made a significant difference to company and business results.

What's On Offer

Flexible working environment.

Strong well established brand to work with.

Good salary and benefits package inc-
1 x eye care voucher per year
1 x flu vaccination per year
Access to discounted retail vouchers and gym memberships

Contact: Gemma Fox

Quote job ref: JN-062021-2932608"]
