industry: Consumer Goods
description:
['SharkNinja is the company behind the hugely successful Shark Floorcare and Ninja Kitchen brands. From our European Head Office in Leeds and Design Office in London SharkNinja has rapidly carved out a significant market share in the housewares industry, becoming one of the leading companies in this sector.

About The Role

SharkNinja are looking for an experienced UX Researcher to join their expanding eCommerce team. The successful candidate will be able to consolidate various sources of data into insights that guide optimisation opportunities.

Your Role As a UX Researcher Will Be To

▪ Cover both qualitative and quantitative research for the e-commerce websites

▪ Analyse GA data for a variety of projects and campaigns

▪ Review, create and develop user personas

▪ Arrange, conduct and review usability sessions

▪ Heuristic review of multiple eCommerce websites

▪ Report on A/B and multivariant experiment results

▪ Create user journey maps to identify pain points

▪ Identify and prioritise areas to optimise

▪ Manage and share behavioural insights (Hotjar)

▪ Conduct onsite surveys to gather user feedback

Required Skills

▪ Direct experience from the eCommerce retail industry

▪ Ability to communicate user stories with data

▪ Strong analytical skills

▪ Understating of UX psychology and online customer journey mapping

▪ Confident presenting results and ideas to colleagues and stakeholders

▪ Organised and self-motivated

▪ An expert using Google Analytics

▪ Experience using Hotjar or similar software

Good To Have

▪ Website coding knowledge

▪ Design experience

▪ Experience using experimentation software (Monetate, Google Optimize or similar)

SharkNinja Is committed to safeguarding the privacy of individuals. Our Data Privacy Statement outlines how we will process your personal data when you apply for a role at SharkNinja or are engaged in services with one of our entities; https://www.sharkninja.com/employment-privacy-notice/

SharkNinja operates Preferred Supplier (PS) arrangements for all permanent, contract and temporary recruitment across all UK functions. As such, we would ask that agencies refrain from making contact with any of our SharkNinja colleagues and that no CVs are submitted to staff across the Business. Any unsolicited CVs and/or communications will reflect unfavourably on any potential opportunities for your agency. Any CVs will be sent at your own risk and will be interpreted as ‘gifts’ and we will reserve the right to engage with candidates directly having not, in any way, entered into your company’s Terms and Conditions of Contract. If you would like to be considered for Preferred Supplier status, please send a brief introduction to your business to llee@Sharkninja.com , clearly stating in the header of your email your company name and the discipline(s) that you specialise in. Your email will then be kept on file for consideration should we review our incumbent Preferred Suppliers. Thank you for your interest and co-operation.

At SharkNinja, our purpose is to positively impact people’s lives every day in every home around the world! We work very hard to provide our consumers with high quality, exciting 5-star products that make life easier. We thrive on passion and innovation, and are looking for great people, with great ideas, who want to build the next big thing and develop while they do. At SharkNinja, Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion is vital to our global success. Valuing each unique voice and blending all of our diverse skills strengthens SharkNinja’s innovation every day. We support ALL of our associates in bringing their authentic selves to work, making an impact, and having the opportunity for career acceleration. With help from our leadership, associates, and our community, we aim to have equity be a key component of the SharkNinja DNA.']

industry: Information Technology and Services, Insurance, and Financial Services
description:
["About The Role

We’ve created a cutting-edge cloud-based (AWS) Analytics & Data Science platform to truly unleash the value of our data assets and implemented a new Data Governance squad to drive best practises.

Whether it's working with the business to identify critical data terms, assisting with the creation of metadata models and catalogues, analysing data profiling and proposing data rules, investigating data quality issues or assisting our multiple Data Stewards and Consumers you have the opportunity to work on scheduled and a multitude of exciting new data governance projects.

What We're Looking For

Effective team players who are humble, hungry and people smart, who also have a broad range of skills and knowledge so that you can work closely and partner with the business to drive best practises in relation to data governance. You’ll flourish in an agile environment and be familiar with the associated methodologies of this way of working.

You’ll Need Experience In
Participating in the initiation of a data governance practise and partnering with the business to facilitate the best approach to data governance.
Be well versed in data profiling using tooling like Informatica IDQ and reviewing the results that will drive conversations around best approach to governing and ensuring adequate data quality is maintained.
Experienced both interpreting and creating Data Governance and Quality dashboards within a Data Governance tool.
An ability to interpret complex relational and non-relational data schemas, Metadata modelling and use this knowledge to create new Data Domains, Terms and create the required relationships with a Data Governance tool.
Who You'll Be Working With

You will work as part of a squad dedicated to supporting Data Governance best practises, we work within an agile framework and you will work across multiple squads assisting the delivery of products required by our business partners like Marketing, Pricing and Underwriting, Claims and many more. We appreciate the knowledge and skills that each one of us brings to the business. It’s hard not to be encouraged by the things that make us unique. You will report to a Chapter Lead within Data.

What You'll Be Doing
Maintaining our Data Catalogue and recording Data Domains, Catalogue Terms, Data Quality Rules, Roles and Responsibilities, linking data terms and create lineage, recording business roles and responsibilities within out Data Governance tooling.
Partner with the business to understand and promote the benefits of data governance practises.
Prepare Data Governance Materials and present these at Data Quality and Data Governance Working Groups.
Ensuring the ethical use of data by complying with core DLG policies, statutory and regulatory framework(s).
Analysing data profiling results within our Data Quality tooling and utilising this information to assist conversations with Data Stewards about the changes and potential rules that could be created to maintain the most fit for purpose data we can strive for.
Reporting on risks, issues and performance to the relevant data governance members, working groups and forums.
What We'll Give You

We have a strong focus on developing you and your skill set and work hard to give you the tools to do so. In addition to this we also offer a generous benefits package including 25 days annual leave, family and work life balance focused options such as: fully paid maternity leave and parental leave, flexible working, insurance savings for you as well as a range of other optional benefits!"]

industry: Staffing and Recruiting
description:
['Do you love data?

Do you love working with messy data and cleaning it up?

Do you love building super-efficient repeatable processes for migrating data between applications?

For the next 6 months we’ll be migrating our core in-house developed property management system to a COTS solution. Our current application has been running for 7 years and has got itself in a bit of a mess. We need to export all of this data (which covers customers, property listings, applications, tenancies, financials etc), de-duplicate it, clean it up, re-format it for the new application and prep the import files for load. Rigorous testing, comparison and reconciliation needed throughout.

Initially this is a contract role for 6 months, with an extension to 9 months if needed. However, post implementation, there is the potential for this to become a full time role and look at other areas of the business that need some data TLC, particularly in BI and Analytics.

Benefits: Salary to £40k, mobile phone, laptop, 23 days holiday + your birthday

Skillsets of Interest
Experience supporting and configuring MS-SQL servers and databases (excellent T-SQL skills essential - no drag/drop point/click here)
Solid understanding of relational databases
Must have completed at least two large data migration projects, and have the stories to tell
Comfortable with Visual Studio Code, Git and Jira
Excellent general IT Skills - Excel, Word and Access
Experience documenting processes and configurations e.g. Confluence, LucidChart
Excellent level of attention to detail
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Enthusiastic, self-motivated team player with the ability to work under own initiative and autonomously
Logical & flexible approach work']

jobtitle: Data Engineer - Up to GBP55, 000 - Remote Opporunity
industry: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Human Resources
description:
["Data Engineer - Up to £55,000

Energy company desiring a Data Engineer who'd be joining the Data Team and working hard to collect, secure, transform, store, analyse and present data from their various business teams. Their teams persistently works on a backlog of data sources and integrations with third party vendors and suppliers to create a data warehouse within the AWS eco system.

Your Responsibilities

You'd be helping to increase their pace of delivery, managing a continuous integration and deployment tools, helping them to define infrastructure as code, and help with estimating system requirements, as well as monitoring efficient operations.

You are
Experienced in Python
Understanding of common data query languages for relational and document databases
Background in developing REST APIs.
Understanding Cloud specifically AWS

Get in touch: m.ford@nigelfrank.com & 0191 500 8478"]

industry: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Human Resources
description:
['Data Analyst - Fully remote - up to £50,000

Expanding at a rapid pace where the data team needs to keep up with the business growth..

You will report to the Head of Data with a team based across multiple countries including UK, US and Canada.

The team currently consists of Data Engineers, who generally carry out database responsibilities and preparation of Data Pipelines. The Data Analysts will then organise the reporting, insights and liaising with the wider business.

The tech they use is a Snowflake data warehouse alongside Looker for data reporting. However, they have data stored in a variety of systems including SQL, Azure, PostgreSQL, Maria DB. Therefore, you need to be comfortable working with data from a variety of sources.

What you will need for this role:C
Consideration to see candidates who have experience with different data visualisation tools outside Looker, e.g. Power BI.
Must have strong experience in writing complex SQL queries, strong experience creating reports and delivering insights
Strong experience working without defined processes and with numerous data sources and potentially "messy" data pipelines.
Strong coding experience and the ability to play around with the data to create reports from it.
Data migration experience

The type of person they need:
You will have sufficient development/coding experience for someone that enjoys data analysis
You will LOVE data
Up for a challenge, many aspects of the business have never been reported on. You will be responsible for pioneering this new part of the business
Thrives on taking a lead, working autonomously and independently
An understanding of payment processing is a nice to have but not required.
Snowflake knowledge is nice to have

The role is fully remote and therefore my client will provide you with a £500 allowance to kit out your home office!

Contact Cameron Spencer for more details - c.spencer@nigelfrank.com - 0191 223 5303']

jobtitle: Senior Consultant - People Analytics - People Advisory Services (UK&I) - Open to Flexible Working
industry: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services
description:
['Organisations are having to become much more adaptable to change as they face new workforce challenges as a result of globalisation, changing demographics, emerging technology, innovation and regulatory demands.

We believe the People Agenda is at the heart of successful change. EY People Advisory Services (PAS) help organisations to put humans at the centre of their transformation agenda enabling them to align culture and leadership to their purpose, develop necessary skillsets and mindsets, and build adaptability through continuous change and learning.

We are a global network with more than 11,000 employees in more than 130 countries, offering deep industry knowledge and experience to more than 2,000 corporate clients worldwide. Within the UK, we have over 330 consultants advising clients across the private, public and not-for-profit sectors on their most challenging workforce problems.

We are growing fast and looking for those, who share our values, believe in the importance of the people agenda and have experience in organisation and workforce transformation and transactions, change experience and learning, culture and leadership, digital HR, rewards and people mobility, to join us in PAS.

The opportunity

We continue to experience tremendous appetite from organisations keen to leverage their HR data assets. However, many of these organisations are not yet equipped to be able to deliver insights needed to tackle their most prominent workforce issues. In short, the requirement for enhanced workforce reporting and capabilities has never been as pressing.

Our team works directly with clients or alongside client data teams to deliver solutions in the areas of strategic workforce planning; talent acquisition & workforce migration; workforce performance; diversity & inclusion; learning & development; and retention.

This is an opportunity for you to work with a broad set of clients including major private corporate organisations through to government departments and other public sector bodies. Your work will have a high degree of complexity and at times, uncertainty, since you will be working with multiple stakeholders, some of whom will have limited analytics exposure and understanding.

Due to the nature of our projects you will have the opportunity to showcase your strong client management and communication skills, in addition to your rigorous analytical techniques and excellent data handling abilities.

Working alongside and collaborating with experienced workforce planning and talent analytics consultants you will bring your experience of working with large client datasets to help build analytical models; leverage data transformation and visualisation packages; as well as testing your experience of programming and statistical tools (such as R and Python) to derive insight through data modelling and simulations.

All of the above will allow you to construct a narrative that provides real impact using data to drive action.

Your Key Responsibilities
Supporting people analytics enabled business transformation projects – from generating insight to the identification of changes to people programmes and workforce structures
Involvement with programmes to evaluate people capability; build business cases for change; establish HR Analytics functions or centres of excellence; implement new people programmes and workforce structures; workforce demand and skills assessments; data selection and cleansing
Design and build complex database models and insightful visualisation dashboards to perform analysis on large diverse datasets
Contributing to the development of people strategy, people value propositions and business case for improvements/change for the clients.
Understanding and experience of how key systems or tools are used in this space for data extraction and visualisation (for example applications including; SuccessFactors, Workday, Tableau, SAS, SPSS/ Cognos)
Involvement with designing machine learning solutions, undertaking proof-of-concepts, and implementing these solutions to help clients to be effective in this dynamic environment

Skills And Attributes For Success
Highly numerate with a strong technical knowledge and experience of applying analytical and modelling techniques to provide insights to business issues
Ability to work with clients and model users, identify their particular use case requirements, design appropriate solutions to load data, perform complex calculations, derive corollaries and deliver interface tools to provide repeatable visual output
Strong oral and written communication skills

To qualify for the role, you must have
Previous experience working in a data analytics, data modelling or data scientist capacity either in a professional services environment or corporate inhouse analytics function
Experience working with large datasets (creating databases, architecting efficient structures and writing optimised stored procedures & queries)
Experience in applying analytical techniques to calculate problems such as predictive forecasting, prescriptive action, capacity planning

Ideally, you’ll also have
Experience of working in a professional services environment, including exposure to high profile strategic workforce planning and talent analytics projects
A relevant primary degree and any post graduate degrees and professional qualifications are desirable but not critical e.g. Computer Science, Organisational Psychology, Operational Research, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering or Actuarial Science
Experience in building models in R, and Python programming languages and libraries.
Visually creative, with a good understanding of UX aesthetics
Experience of working with visualisation tools including Tableau, Tibco Spotfire, Power BI and QlikViewExperience in SQL Server, MS Excel and VB

What We Look For

We are looking for people who can demonstrate real impact within talent insights for our clients. We require people who can build our service offerings, understand client needs, grow our internal capability and connect effectively across our global PAS network to maximise our global knowledge and experience in supporting clients to build and develop their talent pool.

What Working At EY Offers

We offer a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. Our comprehensive Total Rewards package includes assistance for flexible working and career development, and with FlexEY you can select benefits that suit your needs, covering holidays, health and well-being, insurance, savings and a wide range of discounts, offers and promotions. Plus, we offer:
Coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around
Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you

About EY

EY is a global professional services organisation providing advisory, assurance, tax and transaction services. We are dedicated to doing our part in building a better working world for our people, our clients and our communities. And we are united by our shared values and a dedication to delivering exceptional client service

We make sure our people succeed. The networks you build and the experiences you have with us will help define and accelerate the rest of your career. Last year in the UK, nearly 2,000 of our people were promoted or progressed within their grade, and we are significantly increasing the number of partners in the UK. So, when you build something better at EY, we make sure you’re rewarded.

Our People Advisory Services practice has over 10,000 practitioners operating within a globally integrated team, bringing their skills, insights and experience to support our clients.

Driven by our focused insight and innovation, PAS is best positioned to advise and influence our client’s activities at senior leadership level to respond to the scale and complexity of how and where our clients work globally, making us the trusted advisor of choice to our clients and creating more opportunities for our people. As a result, we’re continually seeking new markets, new perspectives and better ways to deliver value.

EY is dedicated to being an inclusive employer and we are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. We strive to achieve the right balance for our people, enabling us to deliver excellent client service whilst allowing you to build your career without sacrificing your personal priorities. While our client-facing professionals can be required to travel regularly, and at times be based at client sites, our flexible working arrangements can help you to achieve a lifestyle balance.

If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

Make your mark.

Apply now.']

industry: Information Technology and Services, Staffing and Recruiting, and Financial Services
description:
['We’re supporting our clients as they adapt to a new world in the wake of COVID-19. We’re now recruiting for roles which will help our clients to deliver vital services and to resume business wherever possible.

Job Title

Software Developer -(PHP)

Job Description

Software Developer (PHP, HTML5,CSS3)

You will be developing and maintain our flagship benchmarking and analytics software. This software interrogates 2.5bn health records to allow our clients to gain meaningful insight into their data. In the future there are exciting new projects planned that involve rewriting other aging products and prototyping new ones, which you will be integral in delivering.

CHKS offers you a challenging and exciting opportunity to join a dynamic organisation which will allow you to broaden and develop your experience, knowledge and skills.

Location - Home-Based Remote with occasional travel requirement as and when required

What You’ll Be Doing
Carry out all development within a version controlled environment to defined coding standards.
Deliver high quality web front-end software using a PHP back-end with HTML5 and CSS3.
Contribute ideas to the user interface design process.
Adopt and maintain an agile test-driven development approach.
Know and use Design Patterns and make use of accepted PHP best practices, for example using composer for dependency management and techniques such as dependency injection.
To work with Benchmarking consultants as part of a wider team in developing our products and services.
To attend project meetings and provide updates against project plans.
Engage stakeholders through the design, inception and delivery phases of the project, anticipating and shaping requirements for the purpose of optimising results.
Developing Solutions With

What we’re looking for:
PHP and MySQL
PHP MVC frameworks - ideally Laravel/Lumen
JavaScript frameworks - ideally Vue.js
HTML5 and CSS3
An excellent understanding of object-oriented programming
Ability to develop responsive web-applications using OO PHP and ideally Laravel, Git
Proven in-depth knowledge of any modern relational database, preferably MySQL
A good understanding of software design patterns (e.g., MVC etc.)
Ability to effectively communicate technical matters to other developers
Ability to identify practical solutions
Ideally a Degree in Computer Science / Software Engineering or similar
Desired Skills
JWT authentication
API creation
Unit testing
a Linux development environment
About Capita Healthcare Decisions -CHKS

A t Healthcare Decisions, we’re transforming healthcare to create sustainable health services for tomorrow. Our decision support software and programmes enable public and private healthcare providers and insurers to make better decisions for their customers. As part of our team you’ll help to empower people to take control of their own health and wellbeing.

CHKS is a leading provider of healthcare intelligence and quality improvement services. Since 1989 we have been developing solutions for healthcare organisations in over 20 countries and have worked with over 400 clients worldwide. Our ambition is to support our clients in delivering real improvement in core areas of quality, safety and efficiency. We focus on Creating Better Outcomes for our client.

Our market-leading programmes include our hospital benchmarking system - iCompare, supported by NHS-experienced consultants who turn data into actionable information that drives decision making. We bring insight and expertise to help you deliver cost-effective, safe care and provide assurance that you are committed to the highest levels of quality and improvement.

What’s in it for you?
A competitive basic salary
23 days’ holiday (rising to 27 ) with the opportunity to buy extra leave
The opportunity to take a paid day out of the office, volunteering for our charity partners or a cause of your choice
Company matched pension, life assurance, a cycle2work scheme, 15 weeks’ fully paid maternity, adoption and shared parental leave, paternity pay of two weeks…and plenty more
Voluntary benefits designed to suit your lifestyle – from discounts on retail and socialising, to health & wellbeing, travel and technology
Access to our Employee Network Groups, which represent every strand of diversity and allow colleagues to connect and learn from each other on an open, inclusive platform
You’ll get the chance to follow your chosen career path anywhere in Capita. You’ll be joining a network of 63,000 experienced, innovative and dedicated individuals across multiple disciplines and sectors. There are countless opportunities to learn new skills and develop in your career, and we’ll provide the support you need to do just that. Our purpose is to create a better outcome for you.

What We Hope You’ll Do Next

Choose ‘Apply now’ to fill out our short application, so that we can find out more about you.

We’re an equal opportunity employer, which means we’ll consider all suitably qualified applicants regardless of gender identity or expression, ethnic origin, nationality, religion or beliefs, age, sexual orientation, disability status or any other protected characteristic. We recruit and develop our people based on merit and their passion for creating better outcomes, and we’re committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

All interviews, assessments and background checks will continue to take place online, to completely remove the need for face-to-face contact. All Capita colleagues who can work from home should do so; and where it is not possible for colleagues to work remotely, we have taken important steps to protect those working from Capita’s offices. Social distancing, enhanced hygiene and safety measures are already in place at all Capita locations that are open to protect our colleagues and manage the risk of COVID-19. The welfare of our people is of paramount importance to us, and we’re doing everything we can to keep our colleagues and customers safe during this time.

Location:

Home-Based - GBR

,

United Kingdom

Time Type

Full time

Contract Type

Permanent']

industry: Computer Software
description:
["At GitHub, our mission is to be the home for all developers. More than a billion people in the world live with disabilities and we are determined to build a GitHub that is inclusive. 

GitHub is seeking a software engineer to join a new Accessibility team within our UI Platform team. The UI Platform team extracts patterns and best practices from our engineering organization and builds frameworks that enable the next generation of interactive experiences that our internal and external developers use every day in their development workflows. 

The new Accessibility team will not only work to make sure GitHub achieves and maintains compliance, but also enforce accessibility as a core fundamental for all of our frontend frameworks. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work with a distributed and passionate team delivering features and improvements to our frontend platforms. 

Responsibilities:
You will help build better process and tooling to ensure all code shipped at GitHub meets our accessibility standards 
You will help address accessibility bugs and improve the process to reduce our turnaround time
You will directly engage with teams to guide their accessibility fixes and improve our OSS guidance for building UI with Primer
You will collaborate with our Design Systems team to build and implement accessibility as a core requirement for our Primer component libraries
You will write, review and maintain code primarily in Rails and JavaScript
You will collaborate closely with engineering, product, and design team members
You will document the systems you help build
You will coordinate with engineering and product leadership to define and prioritize projects that help us meet business objectives
You will work with support to triage and debug technical support requests
You will participate in on-call rotations with your team and actively improve service health 



Minimum Qualifications:
Strong communication skills both written and verbal
3 years building and maintaining web applications
3 years of experience writing JavaScript, Ruby or similar programming experience
Passionate about building accessible and inclusive products
Experience with Git
Experience with relational databases
Experience with API design
Experience with production system monitoring & observability
Passionate about healthy team culture and collaboration



Preferred Qualifications:
Experience writing code that meets accessibility standards such as the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG). 
Experience analyzing or auditing code for accessibility issues
Remote work experience
Experience maintaining a public API
Experience building highly available distributed systems
Prefer impact rather than activity



Who We Are:

GitHub is the developer company. We make it easier for developers to be developers: to work together, to solve challenging problems, and to create the world’s most important technologies. We foster a collaborative community that can come together—as individuals and in teams—to create the future of software and make a difference in the world.

Leadership Principles:

Customer Obsessed - Trust by Default - Ship to Learn - Own the Outcome - Growth Mindset - Global Product, Global Team - Anything is Possible - Practice Kindness

Why You Should Join:

At GitHub, we constantly strive to create an environment that allows our employees (Hubbers) to do the best work of their lives. We've designed one of the coolest workspaces in San Francisco (HQ), where many Hubbers work, snack, and create daily. The rest of our Hubbers work remotely around the globe. Check out an updated list of where we can hire here: https://github.com/about/careers/remote

We are also committed to keeping Hubbers healthy, motivated, focused and creative. We've designed our top-notch benefits program with these goals in mind. In a nutshell, we've built a place where we truly love working, we think you will too.

GitHub is made up of people from a wide variety of backgrounds and lifestyles. We embrace diversity and invite applications from people of all walks of life. We don't discriminate against employees or applicants based on gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, religion, age, national origin, citizenship, disability, pregnancy status, veteran status, or any other differences. Also, if you have a disability, please let us know if there's any way we can make the interview process better for you; we're happy to accommodate!

Please note that benefits vary by country. If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to ask your Talent Partner.

industry: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Management Consulting
description:
['User Researcher
Leeds (Hybrid Working Post Covid)
Permanent

The UK’s #1 Digital Solutions Provider for Design & Build are currently on the lookout for a passionate and experienced User Researcher to join the company’s award winning and globally renowned Digital Services Capability as it looks to expand its Design Practice across the UK. Your job will be to spend time with the people who are at the hearts of products and services to gain an in-depth understanding of their pain points and empathise with their needs. Translating and identifying their current digital challenges to build a bespoke and tangible digital experience.

This Times Top 100 Company and AWS/Microsoft Gold Partner of the Year 2021 operate primarily across the public sector, leading on a number of revolutionary projects through the digitisation of Government Services including the HM Passport Service, DVSA Driving Test digital transformation, Cabinet Office Register to Vote Service and the NHS App to name but a few. The business however also maintains a myriad of commercial sector partners including Netflix, Booking.Com & Diageo to deliver innovative and user centered digital services which transform and accelerate enterprise operations and categorically improve the lives of citizens across UK.

User Researcher Responsibilities Include:
• Operating within a key role as part of a multi-disciplined agile team 
• Planning, designing and conducting user research focusing on the client/end user’s needs
• Contributing to the usability testing process from developing user recruitment briefs through to test moderation, analysis and report writing
• Presenting findings and design/business recommendations to project stakeholders at all levels
• Providing rapid, light weight sketches and scamps
• Working with designers to develop content which simplifies complex languages and processes
• Facilitating a consistent research approach through working collaboratively with other user researchers
• Applying knowledge in human factors, rapid ethnography, and the user-centred design processes to product and service design
• Communicating effectively with a range of digital delivery disciplines both internally/externally 
• Complying with all confidentiality and non-disclosure policies and/or agreements, ensuring security of information at all times

Essential User Researcher Skills & Experience:
• Previous experience within a User Researcher role as part of a full service digital agency
• Proven experience of gathering and delivering actionable insights
• Demonstrable knowledge in user centred design practices
• Qualitative research methods (user requirements gathering, early stage concept, prototype testing, guerrilla research)
• Strong understanding of using artefacts to share and communicate insights (user flows, experience maps, experience blueprints, prioritised user needs, user profiles, and test results)
• Understanding of information architecture, interaction design, and visual design principles
• Excellent understanding of Agile delivery methodology
• Degree in Interaction Design, Product Design, Industrial Design, Graphic Design, or related field
• Must be flexible to travel up to 2 days per week post Covid!

Career Progression:
With a tailored training and development program the company offer accelerated career growth; promoting 25% of its entire staff in 2020 through providing each employee with 2 Pay Reviews and 1 Position Review annually whilst optimising and validating your technical expertise through paid training/certifications and one to one mentoring from some of the industry’s leading minds, whilst working on large scale E2E Digital Transformation programmes across multiple industry verticals.

User Researcher Benefits Package: 
• Negotiable Base Salary of up to £65,000 (Dependant on Experience + Interview Performance)
• 35 Days Annual Leave (Including Statutory Public Holidays + Buy and Sell up to 10 days per year)
• Company Shares Scheme
• Pension: 5% + Group Personal Pension Plan
• Life Insurance (4x your salary)
• Travel Expenses Covered (In House Travel Booking Team will arrange your travel if and when necessary i.e. Trains, Flights etc.)
• Regular Salary/Position Reviews (Every 6 Months)

If you are interested in applying for the User Researcher position and joining this award winning Digital Consultancy then please apply below or contact me directly.

Contact: 02077806706
AMC*GBA*UR.17.08.21
User Researcher']

industry: Research, Biotechnology, and Pharmaceuticals
description:
['ICON plc is a world-leading healthcare intelligence and clinical research organisation. From molecule to medicine, we advance clinical research providing outsourced services to pharmaceutical, biotechnology, medical device and government and public health organisations.

With our patients at the centre of all that we do, we help to accelerate the development of drugs and devices that save lives and improve quality of life.

Our people are our greatest strength, are at the core of our culture, and the driving force behind our success. ICON people have a mission to succeed and a passion that ensures what we do, we do well.

The Data Engineer is responsible for contributing to the development of the strategy for Analytics, Reporting and Metrics building in line with overall Business Information Services strategy leveraging visualization tools/business intelligence platforms.

Your role will include the following: -
Responsibility for handling routine and adhoc data-provisioning requests for complex downstream analysis
Ensuring data is prepared & structured based on scope of requirements and creating the model for delivery
Performing exploratory analysis and determining patterns in the data that may present problems during analysis in its native form.
Determining outliers within the data and adjusting, removing or inputting missing data to ensure data is clean and fit for analysis
Key customers/consumers internally within the global pharma company will include multiple Data Science teams located across the business
Leveraging business intelligence tool i.e Spotfire for exploratory analysis and data review
Liaising, advising and negotiating with key customer groups on requirements and proposing innovative solutions to meet their data modelling/data provisioning requirements
Responsible for the development and implementation of capabilities to make provisioning of requests more routine, structured and efficient
Contributing to initiatives that enable faster and more effective data modelling/analysis and provisioning
Ensuring systems, code, and documentation are inspection ready
This position can be based in either our Livingston office or can be fully remote/home-based in the UK.

You Are

A solutions orientated, analytical and customer focused individual with a global business mind set and a strong background in operational excellence!

To Enable Success In This Position You Will Have

Here at ICON we want our employees to succeed and ensure that they are set up for this success through constant training, development and support.
A Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Math’s, Statistics, Science or Computer Science
Advanced skills in R or Python are essential - we are looking for an expert in these area
Clinical Trials experience is essential - we will not consider applicants from other industries for this position
ETL (Extract Transfer & Load), SQL and Data Warehouse experience preferred
Experience of Data Wrangling, Data modelling, Data Analysis/Data Quality
Understanding of statistical principles/analysis
Experience or familiarity with business intelligence visualization tools a business intelligence visualization tool, from MS Excel through to Spotfire / Tableau / Power BI, would be an advantage
Interest in or Understanding of Data Science techniques would be an advantage (machine learning, AI etc.).
ICON is an equal opportunity and inclusive employer and is committed to providing a workplace free of discrimination and harassment. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.']

industry: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet
description:
['Hi, we’re Hippo!.

We’re a digital service design consultancy who work closely with our clients to create digital products and services that work for everyone.

People are at the centre of everything we do. We support and grow the people we work with and come together as a community to solve problems.

We take a common sense approach to getting things done. We do not abide by dogma. We get things wrong and that’s ok. We learn from it and adapt. We stay curious and never stop learning.

About The Role

Do you enjoy working collaboratively within multidisciplinary teams? Do you have great consultancy skills, caring about your client’s needs and motivations? Do you love getting to the root of issues and helping to improve user experience?

We are looking for a User Researcher to join the team on a permanent basis, so keep reading

What You Will Do
Act as engagement lead or site delivery lead for projects and support new business activity
Lead collaboration with various skill sets and provide a high level of support for clients and colleagues within Hippo
Define the recruitment processes for user researchers, advise on suitability of candidates and lead recruitment interviews
Plan, design, prepare and execute a range of user research activities to support the design, development and continuous improvement of client products
Identify the most appropriate research methods depending on the phase of the service lifecycle, such as quantitative and qualitative research, ethnographic research methods, usability testing and A/B tests
Provide insights on the user’s behaviour, motivations and end goals that will inform the design decisions made throughout the project’s progress
Help the team to build empathy for the service users
Support usability evaluation sessions in different environments or remotely
Use a range of tools to collect data, and write research reports supported by the evidence, such as video, graphs, tables and pictures
Effectively present your findings and related design/business recommendations and customer insights to stakeholders
Engage with agile, multidisciplinary teams with a user-centred design process
Learn from insights from user research and metrics to define and improve the service, and explain your decisions clearly
Run workshops with your team and stakeholders
Recruit, coach and support the professional development of a range of disciplines
Define the recruitment processes for user researchers, advise on suitability of candidates and lead recruitment interviews
Work with the Hippo research and design community to share best practice to ensure high standards
Requirements
You are an expert practitioner with broad industry experience
You have experience being accountable for relationships with senior stakeholders and overcoming challenges to enable service delivery
You have extensive experience presenting your work to clients and managing engagement with stakeholders
You can manage relationships effectively, building long-term, strategic partnerships that involve regular and clear communication
You have advanced experience with Agile, GDS standards and service principles
Experience of using different methods to achieve insights (both qualitative and quantitative) for example sampling, questionnaire design and analysis, interviews, ethnographic observations, facilitating workshops, focus groups and other types of group discussion, and managing stakeholder engagement sessions
To understand user centred design principles and practices
Be able to understand the strategic objectives of the organisation and how the insights will help them
To be comfortable having your findings challenged by stakeholders and the ability to clearly explain the insights
Salary £66,000pa - £80,000pa

How Hippo Digital Embraces Diversity & Equal Opportunity

Hippo Digital are committed to diversity, equality and inclusion. For us diversity and inclusion are not just a tick-boxing activity, but a chance for us to make long-term meaningful change. A diverse workforce means that we’re able to unlock our ability to innovate, be creative, be better problem solvers and provide an inclusive environment for everyone and we encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply.

We invite candidates to apply from anywhere in the UK who can be flexible regarding location. Our offices are based in Leeds and Coventry but due to the nature of our business you may be requested to work from our various client locations and/or work from home.']

industry: Information Technology and Services
description:
['EPAM is a leading global provider of digital platform engineering and development services. We are committed to having a positive impact on our customers, our employees, and our communities. We embrace a dynamic and inclusive culture. Here you will collaborate with multi-national teams, contribute to a myriad of innovative projects that deliver the most creative and cutting-edge solutions, and have an opportunity to continuously learn and grow. No matter where you are located, you will join a dedicated, creative, and diverse community that will help you discover your fullest potential.

Description

Are you a Data Engineer with Azure cloud experience, and looking for your next exciting career move? Look no further than EPAM where we live and breathe technology. In this role you will design ETL processes, participate in data migration projects with our team and build components for data platforms during our client project.

What You’ll Do

Design and build ETL processes
Productionise solutions with security and monitoring best practices
Innovate and create custom solutions/workarounds
Actively lead in sprint planning and assigning tasks
Influence ways of working within development teams
Contribute to design and decision making

What You Have
5+ years developer experience on commercial projects
Skilled in SQL or Python development
Familiar with BI tools Power BI/Qlikview/Tableau
Strong communicator verbal and written
Able to articulate complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences
Ability to work with clients and engage across teams/disciplines
Competent with Azure DevOps, project setup, repos, builds and release pipelines
Experience in Azure tools and services: ADFv2, Azure Databricks, Storage, Azure SQL and Synapse, Analysis Services
Good working knowledge of security, AAD, Service Principals, KeyVault
Experience of Web Apps/.NET/Azure functions/Automation/Logic Apps/Event Hub desirable but not essential
The following certifications you may have are non-essential but highly desirable for the position:
Exam DP-201: Designing an Azure Data Solution
Exam DP-200: Implementing an Azure Data Solution
Databricks Certified Associate Developer for Spark 2.4/3.0

We offer

We offer a range of benefits including
A competitive group pension plan, life assurance and income protection
Private medical insurance, private dental care and critical illness cover
Cycle scheme Tech scheme and season ticket loan
Employee assistance program
Various perks such as Friday lunch, on-site massage and regular social events
Unlimited access to LinkedIn learning solutions
Some of these benefits may be available only after you have passed your probationary period

Apply']

industry: Computer Software
description:
['Becoming a Software Developer (Integration) with Servelec

Not sure what skills you will need for this opportunity Simply read the full description below to get a complete picture of candidate requirements.

Working as part of the Architecture, Integration and DevOps team for Servelec you will focus on integration and interoperability for the Health, Social Care, and Education markets.

As a Software Developer, you will be responsible for the development of our APIs across the suite of Servelec products. Helping to make real word impacts to people lives, connecting the market sectors covered by Servelec (Healthcare, Social care, Education and Youth Services), you will have the opportunity to work with many technology stacks, venders and projects at both local and national level.

What You Will Do

Develop and nurture key relationships with teams across the Servelec Business and with external Technical Stakeholders.

Managing, driving, and successfully delivering a programme of projects through the full life cycle to time, cost, and quality.

Working with the Integration team’s architects and to propose designs for integrations.

Developing new and maintaining existing APIS

Working with C#, JavaScript, Mirth, Java & SQL Server, and related technologies to allow the creation of and the support of new or existing integrations.

Creating, maintaining and versioning APIs in our Cloud platform

Use and examine current transformation technologies such as XML, JSON, CSV, HL7 and SQL

Creating error logging and reporting solutions and delivering to customers and partners

Prepare required documentation.

Your Experience Will Include

Integration and transformation experience and/or strong backend API based development experience.

JavaScript, C# and/or Java Experience

Experience of architecting transformation and connectivity solutions using 3rd party tools.

Experience with SQL, XML, JSON and XSLT

Understanding of security aspects, SSL/TLS authentication, OAuth 2

Knowledge of writing complex and efficient SQL for relational databases

Experience using ORMs such as NHibernate.

Written and verbal communication skills

Agile/scrum experience

HL7 (Desirable)

About Servelec

We are transforming care and connecting communities with software and services that make a real difference to the people who need it most. Busy social workers, critically ill patients, NHS workers, anxious parents, and vulnerable young people. Wherever you work in our business, you will be helping us improve lives with technology that matters. We care for our people, so they can help us care for others. We encourage flexible working and remote working and support everyone with the tools they need to make a real difference. We welcome all types, from innovative thinkers and problem solvers to dynamic deliverers, straight-talkers, and team-players. And we value voices from every level. We are one inclusive team where everyone can share their ideas to improve the way we work. We are together for Digital Care.

Find out more at www.servelec.co.uk

What will you get in return?

Our benefits include a competitive salary, flexibility of working hours, ability to work remotely, 25 days holiday increasing to 28 (after 5 years’ service) + bank holidays, ability to buy extra holiday up to 40 days holiday or sell down to 20 days holiday! Company pension, 4x life insurance and a health cash plan which offers cash contributions towards some medical costs such as eye care or dental treatment and a range of options to support wellbeing.

At Servelec, we do not just accept difference - we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products, and our community.

Servelec is proud to be an equal opportunity employer regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion and belief, sex, and sexual orientation.

What We Hope You Will Do Next

Help us find out more about you by completing our short application process - click apply now.

|Together for Digital Care|

Click apply for full job details

Remote working/work at home options are available for this role.']

jobtitle: Data Engineer - Up to £55,000 - Remote Opporunity
industry: Information Technology and Services, Staffing and Recruiting, and Human Resources
description:
["Data Engineer - Up to £55,000

Energy company desiring a Data Engineer who'd be joining the Data Team and working hard to collect, secure, transform, store, analyse and present data from their various business teams. Their teams persistently works on a backlog of data sources and integrations with third party vendors and suppliers to create a data warehouse within the AWS eco system.

Your Responsibilities

You'd be helping to increase their pace of delivery, managing a continuous integration and deployment tools, helping them to define infrastructure as code, and help with estimating system requirements, as well as monitoring efficient operations.

You are
Experienced in Python
Understanding of common data query languages for relational and document databases
Background in developing REST APIs.
Understanding Cloud specifically AWS
Get in touch: m.ford@jeffersonfrank.com & 0191 500 8478"]

industry: Civic & Social Organization and Nonprofit Organization Management
description:
["Your new role

As Implementation Specialist you will install, upgrade, configure, troubleshoot and support secondary care, Ascribe, software applications, tools and interfaces. The role will often involve data migration and synchronisation working with very sensitive data.

As Implementation Specialist you work autonomously and in line with priorities assigned by the Deployment and Migration Manager and in context of a 20+ person Solution Delivery department where varying technologies are employed. Much of the work will be in co-ordination with staff from other departments such as support and product specialists as well as customers. You will manage and work within a project team to complete tasks as detailed within the project plan, and develop and maintain relationships with end users and to be the main point of contact for users during the implementation phase of a project.

This is a UK based, home working role with a limited requirement to travel.

What you’ll bring

Experience of SQL - configuring, writing and running scripts

Time spent installing and configuring of a SQL server database based applications

Strong personal organisational, documentation, stakeholder management and communications skills

The ability to understand complex technical requirements and relay these to less technical teams

Strong problem solving techniques

The ability to work confidently and effectively on site and as part of a project team

Demonstrate an understanding of interfacing with a focus on; Interface communication types (tcp ip, wcf), HL7 and its standards and XML - desirable not essential

An understanding of Windows networks and the policies, security and architecture that make them up with a particular focus on; IIS, SQL and other enterprise services, Windows Event and failure logging, Resilience and disaster recovery architecture and N3 and spine services - desirable but not essential

About Us

Want to be part of something really exciting? We are transforming the way health and care is delivered. Working with our customers, we are leading the way in the delivery of patient-centred, connected, digitally enabled health and care services.Our customers and partners are using our solutions in all health and care settings, from GP surgeries and community care to high street pharmacies, hospitals, clinics, not for profit organisations, and specialist services. We are committed to developing the next generation of healthcare technology that will truly make a difference.

What we'll give youIn return, you’ll receive a competitive salary and practical things like 25 days holiday, pension, lifestyle savings and a healthcare cash plan, so whenever the time comes and you need some help with your health, we’ll make sure you’re not out of pocket and life assurance will be there to give you some peace of mind.#LIremote"]

industry: Information Technology and Services, Financial Services, and Hospital & Health Care
description:
['LM/21003915
Data Science Lead
Pre-Award Feasibility – Site and Patient Access
EU Office based / Home based
Permanent
Site Patient Access Data Science Lead
Come discover what our 25,000+ employees already know: work here matters everywhere. We’re a growing and evolving biopharmaceutical industry leader, which means you’ll have endless opportunities to work with experts around the world and build the career you’ve dreamed of.
As a part of the Syneos Health team, you’ll help us deliver results for a rewarding reason – we improve patients’ lives around the world. Because to us, a patient isn’t just a number, they’re our family, friends, and neighbors.
Why Syneos Health
• #SyneosHealthLife means we’re committed to our Total Self culture – where everyone can authentically be themselves. Our Total Self culture is what unites us globally, and we know every person’s unique contributions make a difference.
• We believe our success is a direct result of the people who are driving it – you! We value your dedication to care for our customers and patients, so we want to focus on taking care of you. That’s why we offer a comprehensive benefits program encompassing your total health - physical, mental and financial.
• We are continuously building the company we all want to work for and our customers want to work with. Why? Because when we bring together diversity of thoughts, backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives – we’re able to create a place where everyone feels like they belong.
Job responsibilities
• Works independently to assess the level of data required and approaches for RFPs and individual paid feasibility assessments. Ability to manage a small to average number of assignments at the same time. May coordinate work of other team members. Proactively identifies solutions to non-standard requests. Applies knowledge/skills to a range of moderately complex activities.
• Independently liaises with internal stakeholders to review sponsor requirements, protocol, and timelines for individual RFPs. Upon discretion of a line manager, may participate in and support activities related to department staff operations.
• No project oversight expected, some limited mentoring upon discretion of the Line Manager may be expected.
• Supports department management in development of group and achieving business objectives.
• Liaises with Business Units, Business Development, Medical Directors, Business Analysts, and other members of the team to review sponsor requirements, protocol, and timelines for individual RFPs.
• Independently manages and performs research of scientific literature using internet and internal facilities to provide background information.
• May support the preparation of material for and attends bid defense teleconferences and meetings, under review and supervision of a line manager or delegate.
• Actively participates in developing relevant metrics to measure the impact of protocol feasibility assessments, recruitment support, site identification and selection activities.']

industry: Computer Software
description:
["Do you want to be part of the team that builds the future of planning and tracking work at GitHub? Our team enables customers to bring their ideas to life, innovate and collaborate throughout the whole project lifecycle. GitHub Issues is a market-leading service to manage and track work right where it happens.

Learn more about GitHub’s project management tools: h ttps://github.com/features/issues

Enhance the project management experience at GitHub by working closely with a community of engineers and designers with a distributed, diverse and passionate team delivering the services that millions of developers depend on. In this role you will design, prototype, implement, ship and support highly performant and inspiring user experiences with your team. 

We are looking for creative problem solvers and diverse thinkers, people who care about culture as well as customers and features. We believe that how we do things is as important as what we do. Big vision, a common purpose, passion for quality, curiosity, dedication, and investment in fun and collaboration are what lead to great results. Great products reflect the teams that build them.

A day in the life:

Our team is distributed worldwide, which means we work asynchronously most of the time. Your typical week would include:
Collaborating with design, analytics, support, and product management to understand the problems we want to solve and exploring how we can solve them
Discussing and collaboratively solving engineering and product problems with collaborators in Slack or Zoom
Opening a Pull Request to implement the next most important feature or fix the most critical bug
Trying to reproduce a reported bug and responding to issues we’ve received from the community
Reviewing your teammates' Pull Requests and providing helpful feedback
Working with your engineering manager in your one-on-one meetings to grow your team and career



Responsibilities:
Scope out and implement technical solutions that scale across multiple GitHub services
Become intimately familiar with the systems you build and take pride in writing maintainable code
Write, review and maintain code primarily in JavaScript (React, TypeScript) and Ruby
Write architecture briefs and proposals, carry out code experiments, and build prototypes to learn how we can achieve planetary scale with our systems
Provide technical leadership, mentorship, pairing opportunities, and code reviews to encourage the growth of others



Minimum Qualifications:
5+ years of experience as a software engineer.
3+ years of hands-on experience in modern web stacks (e.g. Rails, Go, React, mySQL, ...).
2+ years of experience in technical leadership.  This includes driving technical decisions and guiding broader project goals. 
You have excellent analytical skills as well as communication skills both verbal and written. We’re a distributed team that often works asynchronously so we’re extra mindful about communication.
You are a clear and effective communicator, be it when you write code, write emails, or explain complex technical issues to non-technical co-workers.
You are passionate and self-motivated, with a demonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced environment



Preferred Qualifications:
1+ years of experience working remote as part of a software engineering team.
1+ years of experience working in React.
You have experience in building top-notch, design-driven user interfaces
You have strong data analytics skills
You have experience in designing and writing real-time web applications.



Who We Are:


GitHub is the developer company. We make it easier for developers to be developers: to work together, to solve challenging problems, and to create the world’s most important technologies. We foster a collaborative community that can come together—as individuals and in teams—to create the future of software and make a difference in the world.


Leadership Principles:


Customer Obsessed - Trust by Default - Ship to Learn - Own the Outcome - Growth Mindset - Global Product, Global Team - Anything is Possible - Practice Kindness


Why You Should Join:


At GitHub, we constantly strive to create an environment that allows our employees (Hubbers) to do the best work of their lives. We've designed one of the coolest workspaces in San Francisco (HQ), where many Hubbers work, snack, and create daily. The rest of our Hubbers work remotely around the globe. Check out an updated list of where we can hire here: https://github.com/about/careers/remote


We are also committed to keeping Hubbers healthy, motivated, focused and creative. We've designed our top-notch benefits program with these goals in mind. In a nutshell, we've built a place where we truly love working, we think you will too.


GitHub is made up of people from a wide variety of backgrounds and lifestyles. We embrace diversity and invite applications from people of all walks of life. We don't discriminate against employees or applicants based on gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, religion, age, national origin, citizenship, disability, pregnancy status, veteran status, or any other differences. Also, if you have a disability, please let us know if there's any way we can make the interview process better for you; we're happy to accommodate!


Please note that benefits vary by country. If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to ask your Talent Partner."]

industry: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet
description:
['Hi, we’re Hippo.

We’re a digital service design consultancy who work closely with our clients to create digital products and services that work for everyone.

People are at the centre of everything we do. We support and grow the people we work with and come together as a community to solve problems.

We take a common sense approach to getting things done. We do not abide by dogma. We get things wrong and that’s ok. We learn from it and adapt. We stay curious and never stop learning.

About The Role

Do you enjoy working collaboratively within multidisciplinary teams? Do you have great consultancy skills, caring about your client’s needs and motivations? Do you love getting to the root of issues and helping to improve user experience?

We are looking for a User Researcher to join the team on a permanent basis, so keep reading

What You Will Do
Plan, design, prepare and execute a range of user research activities to support the design, development and continuous improvement of client products
Identify the most appropriate research methods depending on the phase of the service lifecycle, such as quantitative and qualitative research, ethnographic research methods, usability testing and A/B tests
Provide insights on the user’s behaviour, motivations and end goals that will inform the design decisions made throughout the project’s progress
Help the team to build empathy for the service users
Support usability evaluation sessions in different environments or remotely
Use a range of tools to collect data, and write research reports supported by the evidence, such as video, graphs, tables and pictures
Effectively present your findings and related design/business recommendations and customer insights to stakeholders
Engage with agile, multidisciplinary teams with a user-centred design process
Learn from insights from user research and metrics to define and improve the service, and explain your decisions clearly
Run workshops with your team and stakeholders
Work with the Hippo research and design community to share best practice to ensure high standards
Requirements
Experience of working with managers as required to devise appropriate research strategies to generate focused insights and to convert concepts into high quality stimulus material
Experience of using different methods to achieve insights (both qualitative and quantitative) for example sampling, questionnaire design and analysis, interviews, ethnographic observations, facilitating workshops, focus groups and other types of group discussion, and managing stakeholder engagement sessions
To understand user centred design principles and practices
Be able to understand the strategic objectives of the organisation and how the insights will help them
To be comfortable having your findings challenged by stakeholders and the ability to clearly explain the insights
Salary £51,000pa - £65,000pa

How Hippo Digital Embraces Diversity & Equal Opportunity

Hippo Digital are committed to diversity, equality and inclusion. For us diversity and inclusion are not just a tick-boxing activity, but a chance for us to make long-term meaningful change. A diverse workforce means that we’re able to unlock our ability to innovate, be creative, be better problem solvers and provide an inclusive environment for everyone and we encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply.

We invite candidates to apply from anywhere in the UK who can be flexible regarding location. Our offices are based in Leeds and Coventry but due to the nature of our business you may be requested to work from our various client locations and/or work from home.']

jobtitle: Senior Platform Software Engineer - Data Streams (Remote)
industry: Computer Software, Internet, and Marketing and Advertising
description:
["Are you the person who leads their team in replacing an aging system, or dives into the guts of a running system to fix that bug everyone is happy to gloss over? Do you love making complex systems easy to use, resilient, and scalable? Keep reading.

Yelp connects people with great local businesses, but who connects search queries to 180M+ reviews on millions of businesses in under 400 milliseconds? Who selects the perfect ad from millions of options in the blink of an eye? And after that user has found the perfect restaurant and is happily munching on their quinoa salad, who makes sure our logs are transported, transformed, and indexed so we can do even better next time? We do! The platform engineers at Yelp make these systems work fast, efficiently, and at scale.

We’re looking for experienced engineers to join our team and build elegant, scalable platforms that bring the potential of data streams to Yelp’s features teams. From transporting events reliably between services and datastores with Kafka to processing massive streams of data in real-time with Flink and Beam, our team offers simple abstractions to power a whole host of personalized experiences for Yelp’s users and drive optimizations for Yelp’s advertising businesses.

Yelp engineering culture is driven by our values: we’re a cooperative team that values individual authenticity and encourages “unboring” solutions to problems. New hires are expected to deploy working code their first week, and your impact will only grow from there with the support of your manager and mentor. At the end of the day, we’re all about helping our users, growing as engineers, and having fun in a collaborative environment.

Where You Come In
Build platforms that can effectively store and crunch terabytes of data and power amazing experiences for Yelp’s users 24/7 at ever increasing scale
Learn the fine art of balancing scale, latency, and availability depending on the problem
Participate in a light on-call rotation, handing off to US-based teams during the night time; no getting woken up in the middle of the night by a 3am page!
What It Takes To Succeed
Based or willing to relocate within Germany or United Kingdom
Several years of relevant industry experience building large scale distributed systems
Experience operating web-scale deployments of distributed systems such as Apache Kafka, Apache Flink, Apache Beam, Apache Spark or Kubernetes
Experience operating TB scale data warehouse or data lake technologies such as AWS Redshift, AWS Athena / Apache Presto, AWS S3 and so on
A deep understanding of programming languages and the systems you've worked on
A passion for architecting large systems with elegant interfaces that can scale easily
A hunger for tracking down root causes—no matter how deep it takes you—and fixing them in systematic ways
A love for writing beautiful code -- we use Python, Java & Scala; you don’t need to be an expert, but experience is a plus and we will expect you to learn them on the job
Comfort running services or batches in a Unix environment
A minimum BA/BS degree in Computer Science, Math, or related degree
Excellent written and interpersonal communication skills and willingness to uphold Yelp’s deeply held values
What You'll Get
Full responsibility for projects from day one, an awesome team, and a dynamic work environment
Competitive salary with equity in the company, a pension scheme, and an optional employee stock purchase program
25 days paid holiday initially (rising to 29 with service), plus one floating holiday
Private health insurance, including dental and vision
Flexible working hours and meeting-free Wednesdays
Regular 3-day Hackathons and weekly learning groups, always with interesting topics
Opportunities to participate in digital events and conferences
£58 per month toward any wellness activity of your choice
Quarterly team offsites
Yelp values diversity. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and consider qualified applicants without regard to Age, Disability, Gender Reassignment, Marriage or Civil Partnership, Pregnancy and Maternity, Race, Religion or Belief, Sex.

Note: Yelp does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to any recruiting alias or employee. Yelp is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resume"]

industry: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services
description:
["Do you want to keep kids, online users and brands safe online? Crisp is looking for an expert in machine learning technology to join our expanding engineering team.

You will be responsible for creating artificial intelligence algorithms that will classify various risks associated with social media, in the form of text, images, videos, audio or aggregated content. As such this role is well suited to someone with a strong background in AI and machine learning through their work experience or postgraduate degree/research.

Responsibilities include researching, developing and deploying machine learning models and implementing retraining systems. To do this job successfully, you need exceptional skills in statistics and programming, as well as sound knowledge of implementing models into ongoing operations. If you also have knowledge of data science and software engineering, we’d like to meet you.

In this role you will
Create, update and improve our ML classification capabilities
Deploy new models into production on a weekly/daily basis
Investigating any performance issues and bottlenecks
Testing new ML architectures
Understanding the underlying nature of our data and how best to design systems around it
Run machine learning tests and experiments
Perform statistical analysis and fine-tuning using test results
Keeping abreast of the latest developments in the area of Machine Learning
Applying the latest technologies to our data in order to create performant classifiers
Working with the rest of the Machine Learning team to ensure that everyone is working together with the right tools and technologies
Responding quickly to the automation needs of the company
Requirements

Machine Learning experience
RNNs Long Short Term Memory and Gated Recurrent Units
Transformers
CNNs
Graph Neural Networks
Programming experience
Python
PyTorch (or TensorFlow, Keras, Caffe, ONNX)
Scikit-learn
Git
Docker
Cloud
Google Cloud Platform
Amazon Web Services
Databases
BigQuery
ElasticSearch
SQL
Neo4j
Desirable
Genuine interest in digital transformation
Relationship Building skills
Great Communication (written, spoken, listening, presentations)
Practical operational awareness
Aware of digital disruption and the growing concerns of dealing with large audiences online
Self-management / Organisational Skills
Resourceful / Problem Solving / Creativity
Insight, Data and Analytical Skills
Thirst for knowledge
In response to COVID -19, these roles will be WFH full time until 2022, perhaps longer. Applicants therefore must be in a position to work from their home and have a secure workstation appropriate for home working for an extended period.

Benefits

Our rewards are as unique as our culture, and we want to attract the best people and retain them.

Not only will we ensure that your development is key, but you will be joining a fantastic team of like-minded people who work together as one team to achieve a shared vision. We offer an excellent salary and benefits package which includes
Market competitive pay rates based your skills and experience
Discretionary bonus scheme / commission scheme with payment based on revenue generated as a result of generated sales leads
A generous option allocation
33 days holiday including Bank Holidays (20 days in the US)
Critical Illness insurance
Life Insurance Cover
Healthcare Cash Plan / Healthcare, dental and vision plan
An attractive pension / 401k retirement plan scheme
Cycle to Work Scheme
Employee perks schemes offering discounts, rewards, giveaways and more
Subsidised gym membership
Mental health wellbeing portal and access to an in-house clinical psychologist
Support and provision of supplies to facilitate home working
Flexible working opportunities
About Crisp

Crisp provides 24/7/365 early-warning risk intelligence as a service for leading brands, global enterprises and social media platforms, providing customers with a real-time risk defence, and with intelligence and compliance solutions guaranteed to ensure our customers are always the first to know and act. These risks can take many forms, including activist attacks, hate speech, threats, fake news, false rumours, illegal content, compliance failures and many more. Fuelled by the increased popularity of closed social media groups and messaging apps, this harmful content can now spread virally, at scale before it reaches mainstream media channels.

The relentless focus on helping to create a digital world that is safe for everyone has been Crisp’s mission from day one. Today that passion extends to working with leading brands, global enterprises and social media platforms.

Statement

'This work meets the requirements in respect of exempted questions under the Rehabilitation of Offenders Act 1974, any applicants who are offered work for this organisation will be subject to an enhanced check from the Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS). This will include details of cautions, reprimands or final warnings as well as convictions. A criminal record will not automatically bar a person from successfully taking up this post."]

industry: Information Technology and Services, Staffing and Recruiting, and Human Resources
description:
