industry: Information Technology and Services
description:
['Description

Our aim is to transform banking - we believe in making banking 10x better for customers, banks and society. At the heart of our platform is the 10x SuperCore™. With its transformational end-to-end architecture, everything has been designed from first principles to bring forward a new way of banking. We enable our client banks to engage their customers with more timely, relevant and personalised experiences when it comes to managing money.

About The Role

The CRM & Comms team uses Salesforce to provide our client’s contact centres with a best of breed banking CRM. The Salesforce system integrates with the rest of the 10x core banking platform using a suite of APIs that provides all the customer data and allows relevant transactions to be performed. The Comms services respond to events within the core banking platform to send alerts to customers (via Adobe campaign) and cases to the CRM (Salesforce).

We work in a dynamic and exciting environment where we are constantly looking for new ways to measure the performance and quality of our service and use that data to drive continuous improvement.

About You

As a Salesforce Software Development Engineer, you are an experienced Salesforce developer who has used Lightning to code high quality Salesforce solutions, providing users with elegant solutions to help answer their customers questions quickly and efficiently yet in a controlled way.

You will be keen to solve problems beyond the borders of your immediate team and demonstrate that you can think on multiple levels; from strategic and tactical to driving operational excellence and system availability. You are adept at building and designing Salesforce systems that are able to exceed the exacting demands of our clients. You will have good written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present complex technical information in a clear and concise manner to a variety of audiences.

Requirements

Ideally you will have…
Built successful systems using Salesforce Lightning
A deep understanding of Salesforce
Experience of using RESTful APIs
Demonstrated your delivery ability which delights clients and other stakeholders, preferably in an Agile manner
Experience of other Customer Relationship Management (CRM) systems and the ability to bring diverse thinking to 10x

If you also have experience with any of the following, we’d love to hear from you…
Experience of Test-driven Development
Kafka, Kinesis, Spark, or other big data streaming technologies
SQL databases e.g. CockroachDB, MySQL, PostgreSQL
An understanding of retail financial services would be beneficial but is not essential

Benefits
25 days holiday and an extra day off on your birthday plus Bank/Public Holidays
Pension scheme
Private Health Care via AXA PPP, with the option to add your family
Life Assurance
Income Protection
Headspace subscription
Flexible benefits to suit your lifestyle via salary sacrifice
Enhanced parental policies, dependent on tenure
Regular company-funded socials
All the latest tech you need to enable you to deliver excellent output
You will also be eligible for any additional employee benefits that the Company may introduce in the future

More About 10x

Our home is in London but our 10x teams work around the UK and Australia provide our clients with deep and relevant experience amassed from multi-billion-dollar businesses, challenger brands, disruptors and start-ups.

At 10x you work alongside innovators and leaders in banking and financial services, big-technology and consumer-focused industries – proven practitioners who understand how to meet the evolving needs of businesses and consumers. Our engineers, product specialists and developers are leaders too, drawing on experience from within and outside financial services to deliver transformational new digital solutions.

We are driven by the belief that whatever we do as a business has to be done in the right way. Our three core values amid this are fundamental to our 10x approach: Transformation, Integrity and Impact.

Learn more at www.10xbanking.com

Equal Opportunities for All

Equality, Diversity and Inclusion are priorities for us here at 10x – we welcome and promote diversity amongst our people and if we are to solve the legacy problems for our clients and their customers around the world, our team has to represent the people we serve. We are committed to ensuring that all job applicants are treated equally. All applicants will be treated fairly and will be considered for employment without discrimination because of ethnicity, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or gender reassignment, family or parental status, pregnancy or maternity, marital or civil partner status, national origin, age, veteran, neurodiversity status or disability status.

As part of the application process we may ask you to voluntarily provide information relating to your personal attributes for the purposes of reporting and monitoring only. The capture of this information will not influence the hiring process but will help us monitor progress against our diversity and inclusion ambitions.']

industry: Staffing and Recruiting
description:
['Position: GPU Software Developer
Salary: £30,000 - £50,000
Office Location: Huddersfield
Location of work: This role will be predominately office-based role
 The Role: An exciting, ambitious technology led company in the Huddersfield area are again growing their software team, this time looking to add a GPU Software Developer to the team. You will be joining a small development team and take responsibility for the development, maintenance and optimisation of GPU based processing tasks.

You will ideally have a relevant degree within computer science and be able to illustrate experience within a similar role particularly focused on GPU development using CUDA or OpenGL, whilst experience with image processing or 3D development would make your CV stand out. The successful Software Developer can expect their role to involve developing new GPU processing tasks, porting existing CPU code, testing and continuous integration. You will be working in a team environment and can expect to work closely with software, electronics and application engineers.

Skills and Experience Required:
GPU Development
CUDA or OpenGL
Multi-threading experience
C++ Windows development
A degree within mathematics or computer science related field
 Desirable Skills and Experience:
3D Development or image processing
OpenCV
QT/QML
Python or JavaScript
 If you feel you match these criteria and are keen to embark on a fresh new challenge contact Laurence Powell or Andrew Knight at KO2 for immediate consideration']

industry: Information Technology and Services
description:
['Sudlows work throughout the UK and have a growing portfolio of clients globally.

Take the next step in your career now, scroll down to read the full role description and make your application.

We have over 200 staff and have achieved recent growth with ongoing expansion plans.

We are an equal opportunities employer and value diversity in our workforce.

Within our Enterprise Services division we have an exciting career opportunity for an experienced and enthusiastic Data Cabling Engineer.

Our Enterprise Services Division creates high performance unified business infrastructures and reliable network projects to ensure that the most forward-looking, well-prepared businesses are building environments for the future.

Enterprise Services comprises of three distinct areas; Connectivity, Electrical and Retail Support.

Our Enterprise Services include;
Structured Cabling Systems
Blown Fibre/Conventional Fibre
Electrical solutions
Retail Operations Support
Wi-Fi Connectivity We are looking for a number of data cabling engineers who have a good knowledge and experience of data network cabling Cat 5e/6/6a, CW1308 along with containment systems is preferable.
Experience in installing, terminating and testing conventional and blown fibre systems is desirable.

Must be polite, friendly with an enthusiasm to learn and develop new skills']

jobtitle: Data Engineer - Remote - SQL, Database Management
industry: Public Policy, Public Relations and Communications, and Public Safety
description:
["Exciting time to join as the organisation begin a major digital transformation
Extremely generous pension contribution and other great benefits

About Our Client

The client are a large central government scientific body who operate across the UK. This role can be offered largely remote, with occasional working from one of their local offices - Liverpool, Leeds or Sheffield. They can offer a competitive salary and some excellent benefits.

Job Description

Data Engineer - Remote - SQL, Database Management

In this role you would be part of a team responsible for managing the data estate, ensuring that data remains confidential, integral and available, and relevant to business requirements.

This role will monitor all data flows and the use/re-use of data across the organisation to ensure that systems, business analytics and business intelligence are appropriate supported.

This role will manage data bases to ensure they remain secure, preventing unauthorised access, data exchange and data loss. This role will engage with users, supporting their needs and ensuring that a high quality customer-focused service is delivered.

Key Responsibilities
Deputise for the Senior Data Engineer
Support the planning, budgeting and accounting for all Data Engineering work
Support the Senior Data Engineer and Data Architect in designing and implementing a Data Strategy and data architectures to deliver business priorities and objectives
Support the development and implementation of data governance
Continuously monitor databases and applications ensuring applications remain available, perform to SLAs/OLAs, and delivering a good user and customer experience
Proactively identify and resolve databases issues before they impact the user/customer

The Successful Applicant

The successful candidate will need to be a highly technical, data driven Engineer who can demonstrate the following skills/experience:

Essential Skills And Experience
Experience with SQL
Experience of monitoring databases and delivering database support services
Experience of recommending and implementing changes to databases to improve performance
Experience of delivering Information Systems development projects
Excellent oral and written communications
Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office

Desirable Skills And Experience
Experience with Oracle, Ingres and Agresso
At least one development language from X++, C#, Java, Python, PowerShell, .Net
Experience with ODS, ADS, Data Marts, Data Warehouses and Data Lakes
Experience with relational, Hadoop and OLAP database engines
Familiarity with QlikView and PowerBI

What's On Offer

Starting Salary: £31,500 - please note that all successful candidates automatically start a tthe beginning of the this salary banding and that salary is non negotiable on this occasion.

Pension: 27% employer contribution

Annual leave: 25 days (rising to 30 with service)

Plus a range of other benefits aimed at supporting financial and health wellbeing.

Data Engineer - Remote - SQL, Database Management

Contact: Katie Maloney

Quote job ref: JN-072021-2943184"]

industry: Computer Software
description:
["GitHub is changing the way the world builds software, and we want you to help build GitHub. We’re looking for a few software engineers to join a passionate, collaborative, distributed group of engineers on our team.

The Heart Services team is responsible for core features and services that are essential to the GitHub product. The challenge of this work is not for the faint of heart. Our team embarks on expeditions long thought impossible to bring order, stability, and harmony to the code base. Our work is messy and demanding, but also rewarding and valuable to all 40 million GitHub users.

Stack: Heart Services works in all parts of the GitHub stack, including Ruby on Rails, Docker, MySQL, and Golang.

A day in the life of a team Software Engineer:

Our team is fully remote and distributed across Europe, Canada, and US which means we work asynchronously most of the time. Your typical week would include:
Collaborating with engineers throughout GitHub to understand the problems we want to solve, exploring how we can solve them, and what our users have said about the problems and solutions so far
Discussing and collaboratively solving engineering problems with engineering collaborators in GitHub Issues and PRs, Slack, or Zoom
Opening a Pull Request to implement the next most important task, or fix the most critical bug and resolving suggestions in your code reviews
Responding to issues and review requests from other teams at GitHub
Reviewing your teammates’ Pull Requests and providing helpful feedback
Working with your engineering manager in your one-on-one meetings to grow your team and career
Rotating responsibilities for oncall



Responsibilities:
Pick new work autonomously and code solutions, working to unblock yourself when stuck either by reaching out for help or finding other solutions in an asychronous, remote, distributed culture
Write clear documentation, tests, and recommendations for technical problems
Collaboratively define, scope, prioritize, and estimate work
Drive helpful conversations around technical issues and engineering practices, suggesting improvements and ideas as you see them
Review code and provide thoughtful, constructive feedback during code reviews
Triage, reproduce, and debug issues reported by other coworkers for our areas of responsibility
Give and receive feedback to grow yourself and the team
Provide compassionate technical mentorship, pairing opportunities, and code reviews to encourage the growth of others
Deliver complex code/features with quality and supportability



Qualifications:

There are only a handful of folks who meet all qualifications. We care more about hiring developers that have a track record of caring deeply about shipping software that helps people with their work than checking all of the qualifications off. So whether you meet all the qualifications or a partial set, either way, we want to hear from you.

Minimum Qualifications:
Strong written communication skills
High degree of empathy
3+ years experience as a full-time professional coder
Experience with Ruby on Rails and/or Docker
Familiarity with Git
Ability to learn and think critically about both system design and software engineering concepts and blend those perspectives pragmatically based on project needs



Preferred Qualifications:
Experience working asynchronously on a remote, distributed team (does not have to be professional experience)
Experience building, operating and maintaining resilient, scalable distributed services
Experience building highly available services at scale
Experience with MySQL or Golang
Knowledge of testing, profiling, and debugging practices



Who We Are:


GitHub is the developer company. We make it easier for developers to be developers: to work together, to solve challenging problems, and to create the world’s most important technologies. We foster a collaborative community that can come together—as individuals and in teams—to create the future of software and make a difference in the world.


Leadership Principles:


Customer Obsessed - Trust by Default - Ship to Learn - Own the Outcome - Growth Mindset - Global Product, Global Team - Anything is Possible - Practice Kindness


Why You Should Join:


At GitHub, we constantly strive to create an environment that allows our employees (Hubbers) to do the best work of their lives. We've designed one of the coolest workspaces in San Francisco (HQ), where many Hubbers work, snack, and create daily. The rest of our Hubbers work remotely around the globe. Check out an updated list of where we can hire here: https://github.com/about/careers/remote


We are also committed to keeping Hubbers healthy, motivated, focused and creative. We've designed our top-notch benefits program with these goals in mind. In a nutshell, we've built a place where we truly love working, we think you will too.


GitHub is made up of people from a wide variety of backgrounds and lifestyles. We embrace diversity and invite applications from people of all walks of life. We don't discriminate against employees or applicants based on gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, religion, age, national origin, citizenship, disability, pregnancy status, veteran status, or any other differences. Also, if you have a disability, please let us know if there's any way we can make the interview process better for you; we're happy to accommodate!


Please note that benefits vary by country. If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to ask your Talent Partner."]

industry: Staffing and Recruiting, Retail, and Financial Services
description:
['Job Advert

Your Role

We are looking for an Azure Platform Engineer to join our Future Data Program. The role will be responsible for building new CI/CD and DevOps architecture and optimized release process for both infrastructure and data pipelines.

Skills Needed

About You:
Data Ingestion and Storage including Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, Azure Data Lake, Kafka and Spark Streaming, Azure EventHub/IoT Hub, and Azure Stream Analytics
Azure Monitoring, Key Vaults, Azure DevOps and CI/CD
Working experience with Visual Studio, PowerShell Scripting, and ARM templates
Knowledge of Lambda and Kappa architecture patterns
Working experience on Azure Security Model.
Understanding of Microsoft Identity and Access Management products such as Azure AD, ADFS, Azure AD Connect, Conditional Access, Azure AD Proxy, SAML and Active Directory Domain Services.
Deployment orchestration and configuration management tools (Azure DevOps, Jenkins, Chef, Puppet, Terraform, Kubernetes).
Knowledge of Microsoft Azure and 3rd party Security products such as Checkpoint, Fortigate, Cisco ASA, Azure NSG, Azure WAF and Azure Security Centre
If flexible working is important to you, then look no further! At Asda, we are proud of our culture and our commitment to flexible working. This role is based at Asda House, Leeds with the flexibility to work from home 2-3 days per week

You Will Also Get An Excellent Benefits Package Including
Company car or £5,700 car allowance, plus discretionary company bonus
Company pension up to 7% matched
10% colleague discount, free parking and many additional rewards.
We want all colleagues to be able to bring their best and true selves to work, every day. Simply put, we want our colleagues to be Proud to be Asda and proud to be themselves.

If you have any questions, then please email Edward.simpson@asda.co.uk']

industry: Environmental Services and Hospital & Health Care
description:
['Position Purpose

Execute all regular transaction processes necessary to maintain operations records and databases. Perform extracting, importing, and exporting of data in various database applications. To develop and maintain service level agreements for escalated support requests pertaining to Data Management Support. In line with business requirements, maintain data integrity, governance and security for existing and future systems.

Key Job Activities

Manage the organisations intersystem information flow, including the integrity, efficiency, and availability of data.

Establish an enterprise data governance roadmap including strategic priorities for development of information-based capabilities.

Maintain data integrity, system governance, and security within Stericycle systems by developing & maintaining an inventory of the enterprise information assets, including authoring systems, owners, approvers and stewards.

Analyse, coordinate and perform mass data changes by developing queries to resolve data quality discrepancies.

Perform data integrity gap analysis of key problem areas to assist in root cause analysis.

Audit data on a regular basis to ensure data integrity and quality.

Identify and develop metadata relating to the organisations data domains.

Develop reports as required to help business users understand and monitor data quality issues.

Education

Bachelors or master’s in computer science or any other Information Technology related discipline.

Experience (EMEAA)

Targeted experience with financial systems, transportation logistics, warehousing, and/or telephony systems are desirable.

Two plus years of experience. Broad extensive knowledge of theories and techniques.

Proficient in MS Office (Excel, Access, Word etc.).

Demonstrating a knowledge and understanding of SQL.

Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio.

Source Control/Microsoft Team Foundation Server (Desirable).

Benefits

Certifications and/or Licenses:

Disclaimer

The above description is meant to provide a summary of the nature and level of work being performed; it should not be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and requirements of the job or person. This document does not create an employment contract, implied or otherwise. Stericycle will consider requests for workplace accommodations for protected physical or mental limitations in accordance with its human resources policies and local laws.To the extent permissible under local law, and consistent with business necessity, Stericycle reserves the right to modify the content formally or informally, either verbally or in writing, at any time with or without advance notice.']

industry: Information Technology and Services and Retail
description:
['Are you a HR Service Delivery Senior Developer with a passion for delivering excellence?
Do you enjoy working in a fast-paced environment, helping our clients deliver mission-critical complex projects?
Are you a ServiceNow HR Delivery Expert & looking for a new exciting role?
If you answered yes to the above, then we would love to hear from you!

As a HR Service Delivery Senior Developer, you will be joining our Team in Leeds, UK. This is a permanent role.
 Key Responsibilities:
Lead and Manage the ServiceNow transformation and transition for small to large scale international implementations
Ability to articulate the objective and business benefits with clients, during transition and transformation phases
Responsible for resolving any issues with configuration in integration tasks
Responsible for adhering to TCS and customer standards and timelines
Lead solution / functional architecture components of major business & system transformation efforts across the enterprise within a business.

Person Specification:
Significant IT Experience
Experience in HR ServiceNow as a Developer
High proficiency in ServiceNow Design and Configurations
Must have worked in HR Service Delivery who has specifically implemented “ServiceNow HR”
Should have done at least 2 full cycle implementation projects on ServiceNow HR.
Experience implementing the following Core Process Areas: Case, Incident, Problem, Change, Service Catalog, Request
Understanding various scripts types in ServiceNow including AJAX scripts, Business Rules, Client Scripts, Script Includes, Workflow Editor, as well as familiar with Server and Client glide records
Experience with Web technologies such as Javascript, UI,SQL,Jelly, HTML,CSS, AngularJS, Ajax, JQuery
Experience building workflows and automated scripts 
Strong experience on integration of ServiceNow with other tools Knowledge and understanding of Database hierarchies
ServiceNow certification on Administration and / or development and / or implementation (on any module)
Strong experience and ability to translate business requirements to system configuration
Should have ServiceNow Implementation experience on at least one application (ITSM / ITBM / ITOM)
Experience leading HRSD project and end to end development cycle in ServiceNow
Experience implementing: Case and Knowledge Management, HR agent workspace, virtual agent, ESC, Employee document management etc.
ITIL certification
ServiceNow system administration certification
Scripting knowledge in Python, Jelly, JQuery
Having a good understanding of HR processes is a big plus



Explore the world of TCS here: https://www.paperturn-view.com/?pid=MTA108652


Due to a high volume of applications, we will be unable to contact each applicant individually regarding the status of their application. If you have not received a direct response within 30 days then the application should be deemed unsuccessful.']

jobtitle: Senior Cloud Support Engineer - Data Platform
industry: Computer Software
description:
['There is only one Data Cloud. Snowflake’s founders started from scratch and designed a data platform built for the cloud that is effective, affordable, and accessible to all data users. But it didn’t stop there. They engineered Snowflake to power the Data Cloud, where thousands of organizations unlock the value of their data with near-unlimited scale, concurrency, and performance. This is our vision: a world with endless insights to tackle the challenges and opportunities of today and reveal the possibilities of tomorrow.

As a Senior Cloud Support Engineer, your role is to delight our customers with your passion and knowledge of the Snowflake Cloud Data Platform. Customers will look to you for technical guidance and for advice in addressing their product usage and issue needs. You will be the voice of the customer into Snowflake’s product and engineering teams for product feedback and improvements. You will play an integral role in building knowledge within the team and be part of strategic initiatives for organizational and process improvements. Ideally, you have worked in a 24x7 environment, handled all tiers of support issues, been on-call during weekends, and familiar with Salesforce Service cloud.

Skills

An experienced Senior Cloud Support Engineer has arguably one of the most impressive confluence of holistic skills in all professions, all of which directly translate to other career choices either within or outside Support, including
Strong Customer Advocacy skills
Strong communication skills in English, both written and verbal
Strong troubleshooting skills to logically go about solving problems
Subject Matter Expertise in one or more technical area(s)
Strong teaming skills in a highly collaborative environment and the ability to function in global arenas
You Will
Provide email, web, and phone support to Snowflake customers and partners
Utilize Snowflake environment, connectors, 3rd party partner software, and tools to investigate issues
Document known solutions to internal and external knowledge base
Submit well-documented bugs and feature requests arising from customer submitted requests and work with Engineering towards a resolution.
Participate in weekend on-call support rotation
Work on technical and non-technical projects
Our Ideal Senior Cloud Support Engineer Will Have
B.S. or M.S degree in CS, MIS or equivalent discipline
6-10 years experience in a Technical Support or similar function.
Experience in a designated customer-focused support role providing a personalized support experience with deeper knowledge of customer environment
Good understanding of Amazon AWS(SQS, SNS, API Gateway, S3, Route 53) and/or similar services in Microsoft Azure ecosystems , Google Cloud.
Experience in ETL, ELT tools like AWS Glue, EMR, Azure Data Factory, Informatica, Data Pipelines.
Experience in SPARK, KAFKA systems.
Experience in using 3rd Party troubleshooting tools like Wireshark, Fiddler, Process Monitor/Explorer.
Experience in analyzing the tcpdump, Fiddler Trace.
Capturing the heap dump and analyzing the heap dump.
Capturing the Stack trace and analyzing the trace.
Foundational SQL experience/usage.
Experience troubleshooting database connectivity issues using a variety of methods (client software, drivers/connectors).
Experience in Configuring\Troubleshooting Drivers like ODBC, JDBC, GO, .Net .
Excellent ability to troubleshoot on a variety of operating systems (Windows, Mac, *Nix)
Good understanding of the technical fundamentals of the Internet. You should have sufficient knowledge of internet protocols such as TCP/IP, HTTP/S, SFTP, DNS as well as the ability to use diagnostic tools to troubleshoot connectivity issues.
Scripting/coding experience in Python, Java.
Excellent writing and communication skills with an attention to detail.
Nice To Haves
Experience working with big data and/or MPP (massively parallel processing) databases.
Understanding of Data Warehousing fundamentals and concepts
Database migration and ETL experience.
Scripting/coding experience In any of the following: .Net, NodeJS, R, GO.
Experience supporting applications running on either Amazon AWS or MS Azure.
Experience with virtualization solutions (vmware, docker, virtualbox, etc)
Understanding of cloud computing security concepts
Snowflake is growing fast, and we’re scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake.

How do you want to make your impact?']

industry: Computer Games
description:
['Come join Team17 where we work on award winning indie games, in a friendly, inclusive environment where you can learn, and collaborate with some of the most talented people in the industry, and get to work and collaborate with developers from around the globe!

We are in the amazing position of building strong dynamic teams across the business right now, going through our biggest period of growth we have seen to date.

Team17 are known for developing and publishing a wide range of games at the highest quality including The Escapists, Overcooked!, Hell Let Loose and of course the Worms franchise.

If you work for us, you will get to work as part of our programming team on any number of challenging projects. We are looking for individuals who can work well with other disciplines and understand the benefit of close collaboration, production of quality systems and code runs alongside this to ensure that game features are delivered to agreed schedules and quality.

Being involved with the programming team means you will also benefit from highly experienced staff who are there to help train and mentor you to ensure you are improving your own skills and looking to further yourself within the team, so we are looking for people that are just as passionate about their careers who also want to share their enthusiasm and skill base with their peers.

In This Role You Will Be Responsible For
Planning, writing, debugging code for project features to ensure they are delivered to the desired quality
Assessing project bug database for issues and being proactive to address them where necessary.
Work with other disciplines to understand their requirements and work proactively with them to ensure any limitations are clearly communicated and understood.
Assessing task/timings to assist in schedule production
Carry out assigned tasks within the time scheduled for them and reporting progress to your Lead Programmer and/or Producer
The skills and experience you will need to apply for this role include:
A strong background of Games Development experience or a demonstrable passion for Games Development
Experience developing games with Unity, Unreal Engine or a custom engine Experience with one of the following languages: C++ or C#
Good written and verbal communication skills to ensure clarity and accuracy of communication.
Desirable
A passion to learn and further your own skill set Knowledge of developing games on a console platforms - Xbox One, PS4, Switch
Team17 is committed to building a diverse workforce and therefore we embrace a culture reflecting a variety of perspectives, insights and backgrounds making us a very innovative business to join!']

industry: Information Technology and Services, Staffing and Recruiting, and Human Resources
description:
['- FULLY REMOTE

Up to £65k DOE

My client are seeking a talented individual to help increase their delivery, managing a continuous integration and deployment tools, helping to define infrastructure as code, and with estimating system requirements, as well as monitoring smooth operations.
You will work with external and internal stakeholders as well as team members when capturing and documenting IT requirements.
You will show attention to detail and show strong problem solving skills when helping to spec out projects and infrastructure.
You will help with the development of data pipelines, setting up data lake and data warehousing infrastructure.
You will help creating new integrations with third party providers and external data sources.
You will help with the development of dashboards and other reporting tools.
You will be comfortable working to Agile principles and development methodologies.
Your Skills

Required
Excellent knowledge of Python
You will know common data query languages for relational and document databases.
Experience working with version control tools, understand the importance of code reviews and coding standards).
Experience with Messaging queues and event driven development (eg. Rabbit MQ, SQS).
Experience setting up data pipelines, data extraction, transformation and load processes.
Experience developing REST APIs.
Understanding of common cloud metrics and alerting within AWS.
Desirable
Experience with Apache Spark and Databricks.
Experience using the AWS eco system, especially VPC, EC2, RDS and Redshift and the AWS Cloud Development Kit, Lambda.
Experience with workflow management tools (eg. Airflow, Luigi).
Experience working with continuous integration, CI/CD processes.
Experience with orchestration tools (eg. Cloud formation, Kubernetes, etc).
To apply or for more info contact o.king@jeffersonfrank.com or call 0191 814 7785.']

industry: Staffing and Recruiting
description:
["Full Stack Software Developer / Consultant

Location: Leeds (Hybrid Remote)

Salary: £50,000 - £70,000 (DOE) + A range of company benefits.

A digital consultancy client of ours based in Leeds are looking for a number of versatile full stack developers to join their ever-growing dev team.

Working as a software development consultant, the ideal candidates will go that extra mile for end clients. Interacting with key stakeholders to understand and facilitate the needs, requirements and motivations of each client.

What can you expect in this role?
Development of bespoke software solutions for the consultancy's end clients.
Creation of public facing web applications based on research undertaken within the community/demographic.
Working within an agile, versatile team.
Take part in the creation phase of projects, working with designers to prototype products before the hands-on development phase.
Implement best practice and maintain high standards when problem solving within the team.
Build rapport with key stakeholders to ensure needs are met.
Become a brand ambassador for the consultancy and demonstrate high standards within their community
What are the core requirements for this role?
Experience in delivering user-facing digital applications for a variety of user groups
Previous experience in an environment focused on user-centred development
Leverage the consultant title to explain technical problems/solutions to a wider audience of stakeholders
Comfortability working in collaboration with a team of subject-matter experts
An appreciation for sharing your expertise with each client, allowing them to continuously tweak/improve their product.
Ability to work in sprint cycles.
Min. 2 years of commercial experience
What are the desirables for this role?
Cloud experience (AWS or Azure)
Experience of creating services in alignment with Gov standards.
Inclination to share expertise with junior team members and the rest of the wider team
Aspirations to keep up to date with and work with new technologies where required"]

industry: Staffing and Recruiting, Retail, and Financial Services
description:
["Job Advert

Your Role

We are looking for an Azure Data Engineer to join our Future Data Program. The role will be responsible for building new data pipelines and optimizing data flows using the Azure cloud stack.

The ideal candidate will be an experienced data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys building data products from scratch. The data engineer will need to support Business Analysts and Data Architects with discovery and best practices. He/She must be self-directed and comfortable supporting the data needs of multiple teams, systems and products.

Skills Needed

About You
Advance Azure knowledge and experience working and migrating data products from on-prem to Azure.
Experience building and optimizing ‘big data' data pipelines, architectures and data sets using Py-spark.
Experience building real-time data pipelines using Event-hub, storage queues and Azure stream analysis.
Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.
Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.
Cloud Big Data Analytics in Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Analysis Services
Data Ingestion and Storage including Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, Azure Data Lake, Kafka and Spark Streaming, Azure EventHub/IoT Hub, and Azure Stream Analytics
Experience with Bigdata Tools: Hadoop Spark, Kafka
Experience with Stream processing systems: Spark-streaming, Kafka
Experience with Object-oriented/ object function scripting languages: Python preferred.
If flexible working is important to you, then look no further! At Asda, we are proud of our culture and our commitment to flexible working. This role is based at Asda House, Leeds with the flexibility to work from home 2-3 days per week

You Will Also Get An Excellent Benefits Package Including
Company car or £5,700 car allowance, plus discretionary company bonus
Company pension up to 7% matched
10% colleague discount, free parking and many additional rewards.
We want all colleagues to be able to bring their best and true selves to work, every day. Simply put, we want our colleagues to be Proud to be Asda and proud to be themselves.

If you have any questions, then please email Edward.simpson@asda.co.uk"]

industry: Information Technology and Services, Staffing and Recruiting, and Financial Services
description:
["DWP. Digital with Purpose.

DWP is the UK's largest government department. We make payments worth over £195bn a year to support some of the most vulnerable people in our society. We deliver products and services that are used by millions of people in the UK, every day and at key moments in their lives.

We are looking for a talented Lead Security Data Scientist to work with us on data-driven initiatives to augment the abilities of our specialist colleagues in teams such as Security and Fraud Monitoring, Threat Intelligence, and Incident Response, developing repeatable procedures in code combined with deep contextual data analysis as part of our highly innovative Cyber Resilience Centre.

DWP Digital is our community of digital experts. Using fresh ideas and leading-edge technologies - and putting the user at the centre of everything we do - we create innovative, scalable digital solutions that make a difference to the lives of our 22 million users and our amazing DWP colleagues.

Delivery. Work. Projects.

As a Lead Security Data Scientist, you'll be leading and defining initiatives to provide platforms that support modern Data Science workflows integrated directly into automated security pipelines, driving quality and impact of analytics strategies. You'll also be building and expanding the data science, machine learning and AI capabilities, keeping up to date with the latest transferrable market and industry trends, emerging technologies and delivery accelerators.

What skills, knowledge and experience will you need?
Deep expertise across cybersecurity, fraud, and internal abuse and significant experience delivering targeted interventions to deal with specific adversary tools, techniques and procedures in these areas.
Excellent stakeholder management with the ability to influence others and build momentum for change.
A strong technologist with an acknowledged reputation for thought leadership, knowledge and insight. A highly driven, collaborative, analytical and problem-solving leader with an entrepreneurial streak.
Significant experience in Strategy, Delivery and Operations in a large public or private sector organisation.
Experience in building skills and capability successfully in large, complex public or private sector organisations.
High levels of personal drive to be the best and the ability to create a results focussed environment.
Details. Wages. Perks.

You'll join us in one of our brilliant digital hubs in a location most convenient for you in London, Manchester, Blackpool, Leeds, Newcastle or Sheffield.

We also have all the tools and tech we need to enable our people to work flexibly, and many of us are working remotely at the moment due to COVID-19.

In return for your skills we offer competitive salary up to £87,933 a brilliant civil service pension with employer contributions worth over 27%, and a generous leave package starting at 25 days.

We also have a broad benefits package built around your work-life balance which includes:
Flexible working, flexi hours and flexi days
Family friendly policies
Time off volunteering and charitable giving
Bring your authentic self to work with 'I Can Be Me in DWP'
Discounts and savings on shopping, fun days out and more
Interest-free loans to buy a bike or a season ticket, so it's even easier for you to get to work and start making a difference
Sports and social activities
Working in an award winning environment and culture
Professional development, coaching, mentoring and career progression opportunities.
CLICK APPLY for more information and to start your application."]

industry: Computer Games, Gambling & Casinos, and Online Media
description:
["The role Data Engineer Team Lead

We are looking for a Data Engineer team lead to join our busy and dynamic team in Leeds.

Why we need you

We’re looking for a Data Engineer team to contribute to the Stars Group growing data and analytical needs. To lead a team that looks to build our next-generation hybrid data platform, leveraging new technologies and techniques to maximize the value out of our data assets and empower employees to innovate.

The Data Engineer Team Lead is responsible for the successful delivery of business intelligence solutions to the entire organization and will have experience in BI development and implementations, data architecture and data warehousing.

Responsibilities include
Developing team strengths and improve weaknesses
Coach team members to achieve goals and organise the team initiatives and workloads.
Manage the delivery of multiple complex projects from design through to release.
Be capable of understanding and contributing to the technical solution from design through code level
Provide regular effective progress updates to and work closely with Data Product Owners to ensure the management of any delivery risks or issues
Take responsibility for ensuring risks and issues are identified and managed closely to deliver on time and to required quality standards.
Who We're Looking For
A minimum of 2 years of experience in people management with the ability to lead and influence others.
Proven ability in leading and managing a delivery of an enterprise data solution in a structured environment
Demonstrated experience with Agile development methodology
Experience in both architecture and implementation of data pipelines and strong facilitation and coaching skills.
Ability in developing Streaming and batch mode processes in a Cloud Data platform is a must.
Experience in high volume systems.
Knowledge & experience with streaming technologies such as Kafka.
Experience with data migration to cloud based environment.
What’s in it for you?

Our experience-based salaries are competitive. Plus, there’s a discretionary annual performance bonus. And we provide advice and dedicated assistance to those moving to Leeds.

Your package will include
health and dental insurance for you, your partner and your children (if you all live at the same address)
the option to join our company pension scheme
looking to extend your family? You will receive a cash gift of £1,000 for your new addition whilst working for us
discounted gym membership
in-house training and development to develop your skills, progressing your career
free fresh fruit, snacks and drinks in the office
social events; including our sensational summer and Christmas parties.
What happens next?

If you’re what we’re looking for, next up will be a Zoom interview.

The Group

PokerStars is part of Flutter Entertainment Plc, a global sports betting, gaming and entertainment provider headquartered in Dublin and part of FTSE 100 index of the London Stock Exchange, which brings together exceptional brands, products and businesses and a diverse global presence in a safe, responsible and ultimately sustainable way.

We are an equal opportunity employer that values diversity. We do not discriminate on any protected characteristic as defined by applicable law.

We will look to provide reasonable accommodation for applicants with disabilities to participate in the job application or interview process. If you need assistance, please contact talent@starsgroup.com .

Please note we cannot accept general applications; this inbox is just for providing support to those who need it."]

industry: Staffing and Recruiting
description:
["Assistant Researcher
 Location – Leeds (with agile working).
Salary - circa £23,000 (depending on experience) plus bonus and an excellent benefits package.
 We find and develop leaders that shape a better society
 Established in 2002, GatenbySanderson are the largest provider of Executive Search services to Local and Central Government, Health, Education, Not for Profit and the broader public sector in the UK and Ireland.
We're seeking Assistant Researchers to join our growing organisation. You will be responsible for finding, attracting and engaging candidates for senior roles that are being managed by our Partners and Consultants. This is a fantastic opportunity if you are looking to build a career in Executive Search, working in a commercial yet values-driven environment where curiosity, courage and collaboration are celebrated. We have an agile working culture where regular home working and flexible hours are the norm, in addition to office working nationally.
 What you’ll do in this role:
Find, attract and retain senior talent for a range of compelling and important roles within the public sector
♦Thorough market mapping, to ensure clients receive excellent quality longlists and shortlists
♦Qualify and engage with candidates throughout the process, providing a thorough overview of the role
♦Keep Consultants regularly up to date on projects, and produce high quality written reports for our clients
♦Stay up to date with trends in the sector, and share such findings with colleagues across the business
♦Ensure that all candidate Information and market intelligence is captured and accurately recorded on our CRM system.
 To be successful in this role you will bring:
♦Excellent communication skills, both verbally and in writing
♦The ability to think laterally and creatively to deliver positive outcomes
♦Exemplary analytical skills, able to assimilate and articulate information at pace
♦The ability and confidence to use your judgement to provide insight and inform decision making
♦Excellent time management skills coupled with the ability to effectively prioritise tasks across a   range of projects
 Whilst not essential, the following is desirable:
♦Previous recruitment experience would be advantageous
♦Experience working with a CRM system
 Why GS?
 GatenbySanderson is a progressive, values led people business. You'll be joining a team of innovative and collaborative high achievers and will be working with colleagues of national repute in their field. We are proud to have developed a reputation for outstanding candidate and client care (world class as assessed by a global metric), thoughtful, lateral and thorough search and above all, commitment and collaboration.
At GatenbySanderson, everyone is valued and treated with respect. In addition to a truly inclusive and mature culture, you will be working on some of the most high-profile roles within the public sector – roles that will help to shape our society.
In addition to full training in your role, we also provide the opportunity for our Assistant Researchers to gain experience in every Practice as part of their induction. This will enable you to develop valuable insight into of each of our sectors, allowing you to gain a real breadth of understanding of our business as well as our clients. We offer a clear and visible progression structure and our people are fully supported to shape their careers in a flexible way, according to their key areas of strengths and enjoyment.
 What our employees have to say about working for us:
 “I started working at GatenbySanderson during the third Coronavirus lockdown, and I can honestly say the organisation has been fantastic. From the recruitment process, the onboarding and induction right through to four months down the line. They have such a collaborative working environment, and although everything has been remote, there is still a feeling of connectivity.”
 “In Research there is a defined career pathway, with great opportunities for professional development. My experience has been that my manager and consultants are supportive and genuinely committed to my development.”
 “I have recently been promoted with GS and was so pleased with the time that was spent by my managers on my development within the company. I initially started on a 12 month contract which was made permanent and I'm so happy I decided to remain.”
 “GS are a refreshingly modern executive search firm working with some of the most high profile employers in public life. There is a real commitment to being the best in the industry from the top down, and they aren't afraid to challenge the status quo to get there.”

To see more employee reviews, please follow this link to our company listing on Glassdoor https://www.glassdoor.co.uk/Overview/Working-at-GatenbySanderson-EI_IE1060808.11,27.htm

We encourage applications from everyone. We're actively building diverse teams to reflect our society, and an inclusive environment where we can all thrive.
 For an exploratory conversation or to obtain a more accessible version of the role profile please contact Eleanor Lawrence on 07900601622 or Eleanor.Lawrence@gatenbysanderson.com"]

jobtitle: Director of Data Analysis and Technology
industry: Hospital & Health Care and Information Services
description:
['NHS Digital
Director of Data Analysis and Technology   
Salary: To £125,000
Location – London or Leeds with opportunity for flexible working

NHS Digital is the national digital, data and technology delivery partner for the NHS and social care system. We create powerful tools and services that support NHS staff at work, help people get the best care, and use the nation’s health data to drive research and improve services.
The scope of the products and services we provide is vast, from building and running the core IT and data infrastructure, platforms, live services and cyber operations on which the NHS and social care system relies, through to designing and delivering innovative data products and services of critical importance to the health and care system and which support world class pioneering research across the health and life-sciences sectors. Importantly, our technology also serves to keep the nation’s healthcare data safe, helping us to fulfil our responsibilities as the National Legal Custodian for Patient Data.

During the pandemic, NHS Digital has played a crucial role, working around the clock to deliver data and insight used by key decision makers to tackle the pandemic and to plan for recovery. With a new CEO and Executive Leadership for Data Services, we are entering a new, exciting phase in our development as a trusted delivery partner to the NHS and all those who rely on the unparalleled breadth and depth of critical services it provides. Central to achieving our ambitions for the future is our bold Data Services strategy and mission, positioning NHS Digital to become the data provider of choice for health and social care in England and harnessing the power of information, data and technology to improve health and care.

The Role 
As part of our vision to increase our reach and impact on health and care outcomes, the Data Services Directorate is redesigning the way we operate to deliver an enhanced range of products and services for a growing and diverse spectrum of users based on their needs and with an increased focus on cross sector, partnership working.
Reporting to the Executive Director of Data Services, the Director of Data Analysis and Technology is fundamental to achieving this ambition, transforming our technical capabilities to unlock the potential of data to derive best value from it, drive actionable intelligence and to inspire novel analyses, ultimately leading the way for better health and care outcomes. Additional key requirements of the role include:
Providing inspiring vision and leadership to a significant scale, multi-skilled Data Analytics and Technology function, building and maturing the capability and capacity of the combined team to deliver exemplary data analytics and data services on an industrial scale.
 Collaborating with subject matter experts throughout NHS Digital and the wider health and care system, to contribute to advancements in our data analytics capability, and support the move from dissemination of data to access in secure, trustworthy environments.
Leading the Directorate’s new Analytics Insight Service, directing and overseeing the development of robust, user-centred, re-usable data products and services, including integration with new industry standards and terminologies. 
Providing industry leading platforms and tools to underpin delivery of all data services, driving commonality, capacity and convergence across programmes, data sets, tools and processes, thereby reducing technical debt.
Effectively managing change in ensuring the Data Analysis and Technology teams work together, such that developments in our analytics space are enabled by our technology, and in turn inspire further developments in our technical platforms and capabilities.
Drive strong and consistent operational performance from the Data Analysis and Technology team, defining and embedding customer service excellence through the establishment of appropriate governance and service frameworks in support of a highly responsive and pro-active service.
Defining and delivering the plan for the iterative development of our data analytics capability to meet current and emerging analytics needs across NHS Digital and the wider health and care economy.
 The Person
Joining a fresh and committed Data Services Executive Management Team, you will be a progressive, persuasive, inclusive data and technology expert leader, who can offer:

Proven ability to set strategic vision based on a user-centred ethos, alongside the operational experience to lead delivery of multiple programmes and diverse large teams in a complex, ambiguous and fast paced, data-rich environment, with experience gained in either the public and/or commercial sector.
Deep data knowledge and expertise encompassing advanced data analytics, the supporting infrastructure, automation, AI and application technologies, and how they can be used for transformative benefit.
Detailed knowledge and understanding of the benefits and value that the effective use of data can bring to the life of our citizens and how technology can enable its delivery.
Demonstrable experience in Agile Delivery and of successfully driving change and transformational programmes in large/ complex organisations, including championing and embodying cultural change, working in tandem with multi-disciplinary teams.
Ability to establish NHS Digital as a strategic partner for the delivery of data solutions for the health and care system, with proven ability to manage and influence senior stakeholders (technical and non-technical) at all levels.
Strong commercial mindset, with significant experience of partnership working with a wide variety of data and technology delivery partners, harnessing collective effort to deliver shared value.
An understanding of the political, economic, social, technological, legal and environmental factors that may have implications for NHS Digital’s Data Services and the health and care system.

To apply
To find out more about the role click on Apply.
For a confidential discussion, please contact our advising consultants at GatenbySanderson:
Adrian Barlow on M: 07393 011150, or Sundas Gull on M: 07545 318869. 
 Closing Date: Sunday 19 September 2021 (23:59).']

industry: Research, Financial Services, and Hospital & Health Care
description:
['Data management
Takes lead role for overall data management, overseeing data collection methods and practices for the CIMS Teams.
Lead on the analysis of legacy data and the preparation for migration including the production of reconciliation reports for post migration quality checks.
Develop and maintain the data system and tools for analysis on an ongoing basis, such that the system can respond to requests for information, data extraction and analysis, and reporting any need for system updates
Responsible for data quality for the CIMS.
Identifies the need for new requirements, working with internal and external teams as required, to develop new data modelling and reporting.
Assist the CIMS team with complex user support questions where there is a data element involved.
Data collection, analysis, interpretation and presentation

Write queries to obtain and validate data from multiple sources.

Undertake, maintain and develop regular and ad-hoc reports using a broad range of tools and techniques.

Take responsibility for data extraction for surveillance purposes.

Assess and respond to data requests, ensuring the prompt provision of information, data, to enquirers.

To develop and maintain the appropriate systems for managing data requests, data extraction and analysis in association with relevant specialists.

Liaise with local stakeholders and networks to gain and maintain local data sources. This will include engagement with internal and external teams.

Stakeholder liaison

Builds strong, multi-disciplinary relationships with clinicians and epidemiologists, seeking advice and input to ensure quality assurance of the data.

Links with CIMS users across PHE to specify and create reports.

Responsibilities

Information Governance

Maintains the confidentiality and security of all communications and data handled, adhering to PHE’s policies and procedures for Information Governance.

Takes responsibility for the team’s secure handling and storage of data, ensuring compliance with national requirements for confidentiality and Information Governance, providing assurance to national bodies as required.

Supervisory role

Deputise in absence of senior management as and when required.

Overseeing the work of other internal teams, setting priorities and allocating work to ensure that deadlines are met.

Supports other internal teams on data processing, advising on coding as required.

Knowledge

To develop and maintain an accurate, in-depth working knowledge of disease management coding systems and be prepared to advise on inclusion criteria.

Acquire and maintain an in-depth knowledge of the current principles and procedures of disease.

Attend training as required, including attendance at national study days and regional training sessions.']

industry: Research, Biotechnology, and Pharmaceuticals
description:
['CK Group are recruiting for a Data Analyst to join a company in the pharmaceutical industry on a 9-month contract basis, working remotely.

The Main Purpose Of The Role Will Be To
Work with conceptual data models, defining data needs
Apply understanding of clinical study development, whether from the clinical or regulatory perspective
Complete a full data analysis of the CTR (Clinical Trial Regulation) data requirements
Further responsibilities will include:
Working with the Global process Owners (GPOs) and Business Process Owners (BPOs) to ensure any business process updates to be compliant with Clinical Trial Regulation, are in line with the data lifecycles and accountabilities
Developing data standards (including revisions), agreeing on the source of truth / system of record and developing of business rules and / or data quality checks.
Assisting with ensuring the data submissions for CTR are of good data quality.
To succeed in this role, you will come from past experience working with conceptual data models, defining data needs and have an understanding of clinical study development, whether from the clinical or regulatory perspective

You will need experience in Data Quality, Data modelling (not essential), Data Standards (not essential), as well as an understanding of clinical study development.']

description:

industry: Information Technology and Services
description:
['Who we are:

With TCS you will be exposed to the future of technology, work with some of the brightest global minds in the industry, and support many of the biggest brands in the UK and worldwide. Recognized as an employer of choice, having won numerous awards in the UK and beyond, TCS is a fast-growing global IT powerhouse at the forefront of innovation and transformation

What we need:

We are looking for an experienced in Azure Cloud Data Vault Engineer. Candidate will be responsible to lead a team of BI cloud engineer to build end-to-end Datawarehouse design and solution in Azure.

Key skills & Experiences required for this role are:

Data Vault, Azure Synapse, Azure Data Factory, Databricks, HD Insight ,HDFS/Gen2 Data Lake, OLTP, OLAP, DW and NoSQL data storage technologies such as SQL Server, Azure SQL, Azure SQL DW, PostgreSQL, CosmosDB, RedisCache, Azure Data Lake Store, Hadoop, Hive, MongoDB, MySQL, Neo4j, Cassandra, HBase.

Very good understanding of Data & Analytics landscape (Azure Synapse, Azure Data Factory, Databricks, HD Insight ,HDFS/Gen2 Data Lake) and associated architecture patterns.
Working knowledge of the pros, cons and usages of various ML/DL applications (such as Keras, Tensorflow, Python scikit learn and R).
Understanding of infrastructure (including hosting, container-based deployments and storage architectures) would be advantageous.
Demonstrate ability to rapidly learn new and emerging technologies and developing a vision of their suitability and role as a new product within a platform & product landscape.
Must have domain knowledge in Customer - segmentation, analysis, marketing, customer profiling.
Large scale design, implementation and operations of OLTP, OLAP, DW and NoSQL data storage technologies such as SQL Server, Azure SQL, Azure SQL DW, PostgreSQL, CosmosDB, RedisCache, Azure Data Lake Store, Hadoop, Hive, MongoDB, MySQL, Neo4j, Cassandra, HBase

Key Responsibilities:

This role will be responsible for implementing robust data pipeline using Microsoft Stack. · Experience and expertise in for creating reusable and scalable data pipelines. ·
Experience and expertise in for building OLAP Ecosystem in Azure.. · Prior experience on Azure BI services for development of Big Data Platforms, experience on deploying AI algorithms. · Experience in Dimensional modelling in azure data platform.
Work closely with the Product Owners and Architects to develop Azure Data Platforms including Machine Learning.
Experience and expertise in positioning and architecting innovative Data, BI and AI/ML solutions for large, diverse enterprises preferably in Retail Industry ·
Prior experience defining and evolving a Data operating models across the enterprise, within and beyond the boundaries of IT ·
Experience in delivering Data solutions, which includes End to End Data Architecture, Engineering and Data Lifecycle (including non-functional requirements, security requirements and operations)

What you get

TCS is one of the fastest growing in the UK, joining TCS at this pivotal time will expose you to numerous domains and projects. We are consistently voted number one in customer satisfaction and Top Employer in the UK and globally.

We provide competitive salaries which include pension, health care, life insurance, laptop, phone, access to extensive training resources, and discounts within the larger Tata network.

Our internal volunteering and social network allowing you to take at least one paid volunteering day per year, as well as take part in social networks, Health and wellness initiatives such as fit4life and purpose4life internal sports events, we also sponsor Marathons internationally, Initiatives in mental health, LGBTQ among other diversity and inclusion awareness and support.

Learn more about Tata Consultancy Services - who we are, what we do for our customers, our people, and our communities. 

Explore the world of TCS through this Link :
https://www.paperturn-view.com/?pid=MTA108652
TCS - Introduction for you... - Flipbook - Page 1
TATA CONSULTANCY SERVICES Introduction for you… TCS Confidential']

industry: Information Technology and Services, Staffing and Recruiting, and Financial Services
description:
['We are working with a large Government department who are looking to recruit a user researcher on a contract basis to start ASAP. You will be working closely with the Product Owner, the lead Business Analyst and a UX Design Researcher, the key focus will be support the discovery phases of projects and programmes of work.

The Role Will Include
qualifying user need and identifying patient journeys
qualifying system design that reflects user profiles and supports user need
supporting the design of the service, focusing on user need to deliver the required outcomes including supporting co-design workshops throughout departments
working closely with a business analyst to feed user need to support elicitation of required user stories
proactive engagement with the design group MDT, sharing concepts and focusing on value
These outputs will support the design and development of the required service.
Experience of conducting research with a design or user experience focus, especially within the GDS standards framework.
Considerable experience of implementing the full research lifecycle from designing research, to planning, implementation, recruitment, conducting research, analysing data, eliciting findings and communicating recommendations
Demonstrable experience of conducting discovery research as well as research to test hypotheses and prototypes
Proven ability to communicate confidently within the scope of the role’s responsibilities by using appropriate tools and language (this may be of a technical nature) to a varied audience of internal and external stakeholders
Can prioritise findings and work with the product team to identify actions and recommendations
Ability to present research and communicate findings to non-researchers
Experience of conducting research with diverse populations
Ability to support co-design workshops
Ability to use a range of software, tools and methods (to conduct user research analysis in order to make robust recommendations)
Ability to understand business issues and uses that understanding to design research that supports the realisation of business objectives.
Confident in presenting research findings to non-research colleagues
Experience of conducting research within an agile multi-disciplinary team with product owners and various specialism of designers,
Experience of conducting usability testing sessions: designing tasks and scenarios, using a range of tools to collect data and providing recommendations supported by evidence such as video, graphs, tables and pictures.']

industry: Information Technology and Services
description:
['Our aim is to transform banking - we believe in making banking 10x better for customers, banks and society. At the heart of our platform is the 10x SuperCore™. With its transformational end-to-end architecture, everything has been designed from first principles to bring forward a new way of banking. We enable our client banks to engage their customers with more timely, relevant and personalised experiences when it comes to managing money.

About The Role

The CRM & Comms team uses Salesforce to provide our client’s contact centres with a best of breed banking CRM. The Salesforce system integrates with the rest of the 10x core banking platform using a suite of APIs that provides all the customer data and allows relevant transactions to be performed. The Comms services respond to events within the core banking platform to send alerts to customers (via Adobe campaign) and cases to the CRM (Salesforce).

We work in a dynamic and exciting environment where we are constantly looking for new ways to measure the performance and quality of our service and use that data to drive continuous improvement.

About You

As a Salesforce Software Development Engineer, you are an experienced Salesforce developer who has used Lightning to code high quality Salesforce solutions, providing users with elegant solutions to help answer their customers questions quickly and efficiently yet in a controlled way.

You will be keen to solve problems beyond the borders of your immediate team and demonstrate that you can think on multiple levels; from strategic and tactical to driving operational excellence and system availability. You are adept at building and designing Salesforce systems that are able to exceed the exacting demands of our clients. You will have good written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present complex technical information in a clear and concise manner to a variety of audiences.

Requirements

Ideally you will have…
Built successful systems using Salesforce Lightning
A deep understanding of Salesforce
Experience of using RESTful APIs
Demonstrated your delivery ability which delights clients and other stakeholders, preferably in an Agile manner
Experience of other Customer Relationship Management (CRM) systems and the ability to bring diverse thinking to 10x
If you also have experience with any of the following, we’d love to hear from you…
Experience of Test-driven Development
Kafka, Kinesis, Spark, or other big data streaming technologies
SQL databases e.g. CockroachDB, MySQL, PostgreSQL
An understanding of retail financial services would be beneficial but is not essential
Benefits
25 days holiday and an extra day off on your birthday plus Bank/Public Holidays
Pension scheme
Private Health Care via AXA PPP, with the option to add your family
Life Assurance
Income Protection
Headspace subscription
Flexible benefits to suit your lifestyle via salary sacrifice
Enhanced parental policies, dependent on tenure
Regular company-funded socials
All the latest tech you need to enable you to deliver excellent output
You will also be eligible for any additional employee benefits that the Company may introduce in the future
More About 10x

Our home is in London but our 10x teams work around the UK and Australia provide our clients with deep and relevant experience amassed from multi-billion-dollar businesses, challenger brands, disruptors and start-ups.

At 10x you work alongside innovators and leaders in banking and financial services, big-technology and consumer-focused industries – proven practitioners who understand how to meet the evolving needs of businesses and consumers. Our engineers, product specialists and developers are leaders too, drawing on experience from within and outside financial services to deliver transformational new digital solutions.

We are driven by the belief that whatever we do as a business has to be done in the right way. Our three core values amid this are fundamental to our 10x approach Transformation, Integrity and Impact.

Learn more at www.10xbanking.com

Equal Opportunities for All

Equality, Diversity and Inclusion are priorities for us here at 10x – we welcome and promote diversity amongst our people and if we are to solve the legacy problems for our clients and their customers around the world, our team has to represent the people we serve. We are committed to ensuring that all job applicants are treated equally. All applicants will be treated fairly and will be considered for employment without discrimination because of ethnicity, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or gender reassignment, family or parental status, pregnancy or maternity, marital or civil partner status, national origin, age, veteran, neurodiversity status or disability status.

As part of the application process we may ask you to voluntarily provide information relating to your personal attributes for the purposes of reporting and monitoring only. The capture of this information will not influence the hiring process but will help us monitor progress against our diversity and inclusion ambitions.']

industry: Information Technology and Services
description:
['Lead Cloud Data Engineer:
The role will be responsible for building new data pipelines and optimizing data flows using the Azure cloud stack.
Ideal candidate will be an experience data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys building data products from scratch. The data engineer will need to support Business Analyst’s and Data Architect’s with discovery and best practices. Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.
Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.

Experience with Bigdata Tools: Hadoop Spark, Kafka
Experience with Stream processing systems: Spark-streaming, Kafka
Experience with Object oriented/object function scripting languages: Python preferred.

Perm package and FTC also an option. Perm salary circa £100k p/a.
Contract Rate (Inside IR35) £450-£525 p/d
 ']

description:

jobtitle: C++ Developer : Cross Train to Java Developer : Homebased Yorkshire

description:
["Suitable for: Either a C++ Developer / C++ Software Engineer / .Net Developer interested in cross training to Java

Location: Leeds and Homeworking : Hybrid working, up to 3 days working from home with 2 days in Leeds office (LS25), West Yorkshire

This is an exciting opportunity for a C++ Developer or .Net Developer to join the UK's market leading supplier of software for local authority social care, children's and education management services.

Due to continued growth and success, our client is currently seeking a talented and skilled experienced Developers and Senior Developers to join their team near Leeds. Their products help protect vulnerable people and have been credited with saving lives.
