industry: Information Technology and Services, Banking, and Financial Services
description:
["Are you looking for a role where you can make a real difference and want the opportunity to see the impact you're making? At Leeds building society we're recruiting a Lead UX Researcher, initially working from home but then to spend some time at our new offices on Sovereign Street in the heart of Leeds City Centre.

You'll be responsible for providing various User Research methods/outputs for each project the UX team work on. You will decide what research strategy to employ utilising a variety of qualitative and quantitative methods.

You will demonstrate a good manner with internal clients; be thoughtful, measured, persuasive and good at listening; Experience of storytelling, critiquing, facilitating and presenting will be key.

It's a exciting time to join the UX team as we expand the reach and impact of Digital within the Society.

Do you have the essential skills, knowledge and experience for this role?
Experience of industry standard UX research, methodology and tools
Proven experience of successful research delivery of small to large projects
Relevant experience within a digital function/department or User Experience agency. This can include user research, requirements gathering, collaborative workshops & other Experience Design techniques
Degree (or equivalent experience) in Human Computer Interaction, Cognitive Psychology, Human Factors, User Research or a related field.
Demonstrable ability to translate key business objectives into effective research strategy that provides value and efficiencies in all projects.
Strong team player with excellent communication, presenting skills and the ability to work with stakeholders.
Experience of line managing staff, helping their development and career.
Experience of mentoring staff in user research best practice.
Good commercial awareness and strategic and analytical skills
Excellent planning and organisational skills and ability to manage and own multiple competing deliverables.
Why is Leeds Building Society a great place to work?

We're a mutual not a bank, which means we're owned by our members and are run exclusively in their best interests. In fact, our business is built on the idea of people helping people, whether that's saving for the future or buying their own home.

We're proud to be the first financial services organisation to be awarded Leaders in Diversity. We don't believe in a ‘one size fits all' approach when it comes to working here so we provide a flexible inclusive working environment that suits all colleagues. We're a 2019 Sunday Times Best Company to work for, which reflects our commitment to support our colleagues with the environment, tools and training they need to be able to excel in their careers.

We're committed to doing what's right for our members, colleagues and communities. We were the first national high-street financial institution to be awarded the Fair Tax Mark, we buy 100% renewable electricity for all our sites and have a charity partnership with Dementia UK. In addition every colleague has 14 hours volunteering each year. Our culture and colleagues are at the heart of everything we do.

Interested in applying?

Click “Please Apply” below.

Leeds Building Society is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact us."]

industry: Information Technology and Services, Consumer Goods, and Financial Services
description:
['Farnell, part of Avnet, is currently recruiting for the role of Senior User Researcher, based in Leeds (West Yorkshire). We are one of the world’s leading brands in high-service electronics components and technology products distribution.

We’ve been here for over 80 years and a part of that success is because we put people at heart and center of everything we do. Last year we embarked on an Agile transformation journey, standing up multiple cross-functional scrum teams who are all committed to building products that our customers will love.

We are also moving to modern cloud based architecture and a true DevOps mindset to make sure we give a great experience to our suppliers and customers at any moment of the day, because that’s the Farnell way.

Who We Are
Farnell, part of Avnet, is one of the world’s leading brands in high-service electronics components and technology products distribution.
We’ve been here for over 80 years and a part of that success is because we put people at heart and center of everything we do.
Last year we embarked on an Agile transformation journey, standing up multiple cross-functional scrum teams who are all committed to building products that our customers will love. We also run some projects in a Waterfall environment.
We are also moving to modern cloud based architecture and a true DevOps mindset to make sure we give a great experience to our suppliers and customers at any moment of the day, because that’s the Farnell way.
Who You Are
You can clearly plan and conduct research and synthesize the data to derive insights and customer pain points. You have a strong sense of ownership and are the advocate for the end user.
You embrace a Design Thinking working environment and enjoy collaborating with UX designers and wider teams
You are skilled in presenting research & insights back to large audiences and senior stakeholders.
More Specifically
Proven relevant experience of working in digital product design teams
You have deep expertise in various user research methods including (but not limited to) user interviews, formatting and summative usability testing, remote testing, card sorting, tree testing, competitive and heuristic reviews and affinity mapping
You are highly skilled understanding what the user research means; define insights and customer pain points
You can build personas and keep them continually updated based on the latest research
You are skilled at defining Customer Journey Maps
Any experience in UX design is a bonus but not necessary
What You’ll Do
As a UX Researcher, you will be responsible for a set of activities including: defining the road map for research based on the visions of various Agile and Waterfall teams
Managing recruitment for participants with recruitment agencies and internal sales teams
Advise on the best research method for the project and execute the study accordingly.
Furthermore
You will be responsible for defining and maintain the various user personas, and map user journeys
Champion & embrace a Design Thinking working environment
Present research/insights/painpoints back to large audiences and senior stakeholders.
You will actively collaborate with the Agile & Waterfall teams to ensure designs reflect the user research
a Career With Farnell
A career at Farnell means you will work alongside remarkable people who will help you reach your full potential and have a successful career with us.
Your unique voice will be heard here and together we can build a better, stronger and more inclusive workplace that will bring us to being the leading B2B eCommerce brand for another 80 years.
WHAT NEXT?

Please click on the link to Apply, your CV will be reviewed within 7 days and if successful in the shortlisting process, we will contact you directly. If you have questions, please feel free to contact us on hrnow.emea@avnet.com .

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY

Farnell is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability status, veteran status, marital status, citizenship status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law']

industry: Information Technology and Services, Staffing and Recruiting, and Financial Services
description:
["DWP. Digital with Purpose.

DWP is the UK's largest government department. We help people into work, and make payments worth over £195bn a year to support some of the most vulnerable people in our society.

We are looking for a Senior Data Engineer. You'll work with us on the development of Azure cloud-based services through data analytics, visualisation and strategies that will make essential benefits and support most accessible to our most vulnerable users.

You'll join our community of tech experts in DWP Digital. We're driving a once-in-a-generation transformation of government services, using fresh ideas and leading-edge technologies to create innovative, scalable and user-centric digital solutions.

The DWP products and services we maintain and modernise will be used by nearly every person in the UK, at key moments in their lives. The scale of what we do is extraordinary, and our scale and purpose is unique. We'd love you to join us.

Delivery. Work. Projects.

As a Senior Data Engineer you'll be at the centre of DWP's data solutions development. You'll use robust data strategies, approaches, visualisation and analytics, creating data-driven innovations that will positively impact our most vulnerable citizens, helping to make our services more accessible, available and efficient.

You'll be working on development of new azure products within a newly formed team; your experience with cloud-based technologies will be help us deliver better and faster. This will also give you a real opportunity to shape and steer the project within a high-project project on the leading edge of service development.

What skills, knowledge and experience will you need?
Leading the design and development of complex data pipelines.
Knowledge of API development and cloud technologies.
Deep understanding of the technical concepts required in their role and understands how these fit into the wider technical landscape.
Able to think outside the box, ask the right questions and critically evaluate and communicate findings to a larger team.
Using information and experience to make tactical and strategic recommendations.
Details. Wages. Perks.

You'll join us in one of our brilliant digital hubs in Leeds, Manchester, Newcastle or Sheffield, whichever is most convenient for you.

We also have all the tools and tech we need to enable our people to work flexibly, and many of us are working remotely at the moment due to COVID-19.

In return for your skills, we offer a competitive salary of up to £62,969 a brilliant civil service pension with employer contributions worth over 27%, and a generous leave package starting at 26 days.

We also have a broad benefits package built around your work-life balance which includes:
Flexible working, flexi hours and flexi days
Hybrid working: some time in a hub with the team, some time at home
Family-friendly policies
Time off volunteering and charitable giving
Bring your authentic self to work with 'I Can Be Me in DWP'
Discounts and savings on shopping, fun days out and more
Interest-free loans to buy a bike or a season ticket, so it's even easier for you to get to work and start making a difference
Sports and social activities
Working in an award-winning environment and culture
Professional development, coaching, mentoring and career progression opportunities.
CLICK APPLY for more information and to start your application."]

jobtitle: Senior Data Engineer - Fully remote (UK applications only)
industry: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Human Resources
description:
['Senior Data Engineer - fully remote - UK applications only - £40,000- £50,000 5% bonus

My client continues to acquire new businesses under their group which is resulting in continued growth in their data practice.

Working alongside a team of Data Analysts, you will be building data pipelines and moving data round from multiple data sources.

Must have exp:
Their DWH is in Snowflake, using Talend (ETL) to migrate the data, therefore experience with Talend or similar ETL tools as Talend would be considered
Experiance of building data warehousing structures, star schemas
Extremely strong SQL skills, where you've been involved with data modelling, cleansing data, bringing it in from various systems, re-structuring the data for a reporting system as well as pulling data from existing systems, their databases have a unique structure
Scripting in Python, PowerShell

Their mission is to build a "wide angled lense" across the businesses for stakeholders to bring everything together from some of their siloed applications

You will be tasked with bringing the data in, normalising it pushing through their data warehouse so they can provide a view of apps in one single source of truth for stakeholders and various users in the business.

if you'd like to take advantage of this fully remote role, please today for consideration. UK applications only.']

industry: Computer Software, Internet, and Staffing and Recruiting
description:
['NET Developer – .NET 5, C#, Blazor, Azure – Castleford

Our client is a crowd funded social advertising technology platform that sells services to Facebook advertisers to grow their marketing ROI. They were recently named one of 12 Facebook Strategic Preferred Marketing Developers (PMD); the highest distinction of excellence Facebook has ever offered their marketing partners. They have already grown by 100% in the past 6 months and have ambitions to quadruple headcount over the next 2 years.

We are seeking multiple gifted .NET Developer who have a genuine passion for developing revolutionary software solutions. .NET Developer applicants should have a skill set that includes: .NET, .NET Core 3.1 / ASP.NET MVC, C# and SQL Server. Full training will be provided into: .NET 5, Blazor, EF Core, Azure, JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3, ML.NET, Agile, TDD, BDD, MongoDB and SQL Server 2019.

This is an amazing opportunity to join a firm that has revolutionized its industry and to work on groundbreaking software development projects!

Location: Castleford, Yorkshire / Remote Working

Salary: £35 – £40k + Bonus + Pension + Benefits

To apply for this position please send your CV to Richard Gibson at Noir.

Noir continues to be the leading Microsoft recruitment agency; we can help you make the right career decisions!']

jobtitle: Senior Data Engineer - Remote - £39k + generous pension
industry: Public Policy, Public Relations and Communications, and Public Safety
description:
["Join a large government organisation in their Data Engineering team
Take on a senior role within the team and help define strategy

About Our Client

The client are a large UK government body with a heavy focus on the scientific sector undergoing a major digital transformation. Michael Page Technology are delighted to be partnering with this Public Sector client to recruit specialists into their Technology Services function.

Job Description

Senior Data Engineer - Remote - £39k + generous pension

In this role you will work closely with leadership figures and have people management responsibilities for the Data Engineers.

Role Purpose

To manage the organisation's data estate, ensuring that data remain confidential, integral and available, and relevant to business requirements.

This role will monitor all data flows and the use/re-use of data across the organisation to ensure that systems, business analytics and business intelligence are appropriate supported.

This role will manage data bases to ensure they remain secure, preventing unauthorised access, data exchange and data loss. This role will engage with users, supporting their needs and ensuring that a high quality customer-focused service is delivered.

Key Responsibilities
Deputise for the Lead Application Operations Engineer
Lead and manage the data engineers in the organisation, supporting the operational business and projects/programmes.
Plan, budget and account for all Data Engineering work
Support the Data Architect in designing and implementing a Data Strategy and data architectures to deliver business priorities and objectives
Administrate all current system databases, ensuring data quality is high
Support the development and implementation of data governance
Develop a Modern Analytics Ecosystem that supports business Management Information and Business Intelligence

The Successful Applicant

Essential Skills And Experience

This role requires a proactive, strategic individual who has previous experience leading a team. We are looking for the following skills:
Experience of leading engineering teams
Experience with SQL
Experience of monitoring databases and delivering database support services
Experience of delivering Information Systems development projects
Excellent communication skills
Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office

Desirable Skills And Experience
Experience with Oracle, Ingres and Agresso
At least one development language from X++, C#, Java, Python, PowerShell, .Net
Experience with ODS, ADS, Data Marts, Data Warehouses and Data Lakes
Experience with relational, Hadoop and OLAP database engines
Familiarity with QlikView and PowerBI

What's On Offer

This role can be offered to applicants based within a commutable distance of Liverpool, Leeds or Sheffield. Whilst some remote working is available, the role would require occasional travel to your most local office.

Salary: Starting at £39,000, annual increases up to £45k. Please note the successful applicant will automatically be offered at the lower end of the salary banding and that salary is not negotiable on this occasion.

Pension: 27% employer contribution pension

Annual leave: 25 days holiday, rising to 30 days with service

A range of other benefits to support your financial, personal and health wellbeing.

Senior Data Engineer - Remote - £39k + generous pension

Contact: Katie Maloney

Quote job ref: JN-072021-2943265"]
